Location_Incident: 3801 International Drive, Suite 206, Silver Spring, MD 20906
Description:
I walked into the Silver Spring office of Dr. Schwartzbauer, an ENT specialist. Iâ€™m here because of some sudden and uncontrollable dry heaving that Iâ€™ve experienced on and off the past few years, and has gotten worse the past couple of months. 
 
 I approached the front window, seeing a person presenting as an older white woman, who I assumed to be the front desk person. Expecting to be greeted and directed to check in, instead she stood still and stared at me without saying anything, her face a mixture of suspicion and apprehension. 
 
 I didnâ€™t know what to do. For a second, I wondered if I walked into the wrong office. I said â€œUh hello?â€ 
 
 She then pointed at a laminated sheet beneath me and paraphrased the text, with a hint of worry, asking me â€œHave you traveled from outside the country?â€ 
 
 â€œNo I haven't.â€ 
 
 She still looked at me with suspicion, like I was concealing something. I then told her, â€œI have a 10am appointment? With Dr. Schwartzbauer?â€ 
 
 She then seemed to wake up and said, â€œOh, you have to sign in.â€ As I signed in I said, â€œI feel like weâ€™re having an awkward encounter for some reason.â€ She replied, â€œIâ€™m sorry, itâ€™s because youâ€™re a new patient and you didnâ€™t know what to do!â€ I said, â€œRight, I didn't. I also know there were 3 cases reported yesterday in Maryland, so I understand if people might be a little on edge...â€ 
 
 She quickly replied, in a serious tone, â€œYeah they were reported right here. In this county."
 
 After I sat down, 2 more patients approached the window. Unlike me, she nicely greeted both of them, asking them if they were coughing or exhibited other symptoms, as listed on the laminated sheet. She didnâ€™t ask them if they had traveled abroad. They both presented as older white men. 
 
 Still feeling bothered, I told the Dr. Schwartzbauer what happened. She immediately apologized and promised to have a talk with her.

My parents had been really nervous about going out in public after hearing all the stories of racist attacks happening on the news, but because they were getting overwhelmed and panicky, my brother and I convinced them that maybe a nice walk outside and some fresh air would help calm them down. It sucks they had to have such an unpleasant encounter on their first venture out.

I am a pharmacist and experienced micro-aggressions from two other pharmacist colleagues while on duty after the 'Safer At Home' Order was placed into effect. They assumed I should have been aware of the latest quarantine practices enforced legally in China compared to Los Angeles and then proceeded to argue with each other if I was Chinese or Korean, all the while I was standing there verifying prescription orders. This was highly unprofessional and made me feel very uncomfortable and awkward while I was in the middle of taking care of stand-by patients waiting. This is an account of no matter how small the comment- how AAPI's are still made a specimen and subject to much scrutinized misunderstandings and racism.

During a question and answer with Jake Tapper, the news anchor brought up something very personal with Lah. â€œWeâ€™ve been hearing about all these horrific instances of anti-Asian discrimination, racism and xenophobia because of the coronavirus because it originated in China. You and I talked about this. You said it was OK for me to bring it up, you had an unsettling encounter today while out reporting on this story,â€ Tapper stated.
 
 â€œI think its been since elementary school. I havenâ€™t heard it directly to my face,â€ said Lah. â€œItâ€™s something you see on social media frequently, especially if youâ€™re an Asian American reporter. We were standing there preparing for a live shot this morning just hours ago, and a man walked up using a racial slur. I was so surprised, so taken aback that I asked him to repeat it because I couldnâ€™t believe it.
 
 â€œSo it is something thatâ€™s happening and what I find most surprising is that its happening in front of our faces, directly at people. That is something that I have not experienced in a very long time.â€
 
 Tapper expressed his sympathies and support for Lah.
 
 â€œIâ€™m so sorry you experienced that,â€ he said. â€œI would just like to note that if you are stupid and racist enough to be holding random individuals of Asian descent responsible for a pandemic, you should be self-quarantining from society.â€

Description: I was walking our dog home with my 6 year old and as we started passing an older caucasian woman with her dog, she gave a sort of annoyed look, nearly falling into a pile of garbage bags. So I gave her space and shortened the leash, thinking it was because of our dog. as we passed she said "Stay away from me" and other words I couldn't make out. Then she yelled to my door woman who was standing outside our building "watch out for her!"

Location_Incident: Sams Club 610 N Frederick Ave Gaithersburg Md 20877
Description:
We were waiting in line, a middle aged woman of African descent got in line behind us and started yelling at us. ( some in her own first language and some in English) and would not stop the entire time we were in line. She was yelling things like , do you even know how to speak English? English is our primary language and we were not speaking anything but English. 
 
 Saw her in the parking lot, where she started up again. I yelled back at her, but then we drove off, as my spouse wanted to avoid more conflict. 
 
 Similar thing happened today to a friend by a middle eastern man who walked up to him and yelled racial slurs at him at a store.

Location_Incident: Walt Disney Magnet School, Chicago, IL
Description: My 7 year old Chinese American daughter heard a group of 2nd graders that â€œall Asians have the corona virusâ€.

Business owner was talking to a patron and was explaining that all these out of towners and foreigners should just stay away. She was asking why so many were coming there (while she clearly wasn't talking to us but she was talking about us)
The man basically told me to get the fuck put of here coronavirus. And then continue to say, â€œhowâ€™s the coronavirus treating me.â€
Any_SupportingLinks: I called costco for footage, and will be filing for a police report.

Was singles out by a man and told to stand 6ft away even though the elderly white man in front of him was closer.

Sat down at a restaurant before they close to diners and as soon as I sat down, a table of people started talking about the Coronavirus and how it was from China. Continued to talk about it until I said I'm glad I was born in America.

â€œYouâ€™re a fucking disease and whatâ€™s wrong with this countryâ€

a woman suggested blowing up the Chinese restaurant in town while i was next to her unlocking my bike. she didnt know i was there until she said it and said "whoops"

Location_Incident: Bronx Pizza - 111 Washington St, San Diego, CA 92103
Description: While my (Asian) friends and I were physically leaving the restaurant, 2 white males (presumably "fraternity brothers") who were at a table nearby said out loud "Coronavirus just left the building"
I was sitting outside of my house reading, and an older white man in a pickup truck drove by and shouted what sounded like, Go home, to me.

I was eating at Wholefoods when a man came to sit in front of me. He called me racial slurs degrading to Asian women with extra comments about Cornoavirus. I immediately told the staff and security about the incident, but the only response I got was "we will keep a close eye on him now."
As I walked home, a man I passed by yelled "get the fuck out of here, chink!" I lived in Harlem for more than three years and have never heard racial slurs until after the Coronavirus.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description:
Person on train slammed his bike on the floor and stood up approached me.
 Mention about my mask and that I should take it off, not go to work, and should not be paid, along with mix of curse words.
 Proceeds to harass through about 5 train stops.

I was shopping at a wholesale restaurant supply store with my mother, both of us wore masks for preventative reasons (she is elderly and I have respiratory problems). Two black men starting chanting â€œcoronavirusâ€ as we passed them. When I confronted them they pretended that they couldnâ€™t understand my English and started laughing. I have no accentâ€”people are often surprised that I am Asian given my diction and first name. In Memphis, my experience has been that white people have been avoiding me and keeping distance (which is fine by me), but black people have been verbally aggressive. I feel like this is important to note because the media often portrays us Asians as part of the larger â€œminorityâ€ group. But that is a gross misrepresentation; other minorities have been just as (or increasingly, even more) hostile to me and other Asians in my life.

Location_Incident: Moorpark,ca parking lot of Moorpark plaza
Description: I was walking and two guys walked past me calling me coronavirus walking. I was scared and walked faster towards my car. Afraid if I stop they might harass or harm me more.

Location_Incident: Krist Food Mart Gas Station - Wausau
Description: I pulled into a gas station and parked behind a white truck while a Caucasian male exited the driver side and walked into the gas station. As I walked out of my car towards the doors, a Caucasian female got out of the truck (passenger side), stepped in front of me and coughed with exaggeration then followed me inside. As I turned right into the first aisle, searching for Advil, she murmured comments about the coronavirus. At this time point, I told her that women should not be treating each other this way. She became offended and said â€œExcuse me. But I am a womanâ€. I said â€œOk keep telling yourself that.â€ Then she called over the male who went into the gas station first. At this point, I did not want to deal with them anymore so I walked out. There was an elderly Hmong man paying for his things as I was walked out. I waited outside the door to make sure he was able to pay and get to his vehicle without incident. He did. And we were both able to drive away.

Location_Incident: 5601 Brodie Ln Sunset Valley, TX 78745 United States
Description: I was at a 4 way stop. As I was accelerating to go, a young Caucasian man quickly rolled down his window and spit directly towards me while glaring at me with hatred in his eyes.
Post denigrating Chinese people and what they eat along with blaming them for the coronavirus.
A very drunk white man yelled at me to â€œtake your coronavirus and get the f*** outâ€. No report was made and the man faced no consequences.

Location_Incident: Fred Meyer Lake City in Seattle
Description: I went shopping wearing a mask for personal protection. A man told me "I hope you have a cough or you are wasting the mask. Healthcare workers need that". I replied that "I'm not wasting it, I have asthma." He told me "Asthma is not a cough." then entered the store. While shopping we encountered again then this man put his face close to my shopping cart then coughed on my groceries on purpose. I received the video tape from the store and filed the police report as an assault.

Dude was yelling, I wasnâ€™t sure who he was talking to, angrily yelled at me for turning around, told me virus wasnâ€™t my fault, I yelled back, â€œare you kidding me?â€, dude started coming after me. I walked up my driveway and he stopped. I called the cops.

Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I am being harassed & bullied by fellow tenant named Carina I. Aguirre. I can provide full details with an incident report upon request.

Large family (3 generations) of around 8 people saw me walking toward them; I was by myself, so I should not have been seen as a threat at all compared to the size of their group. I was casually walking along the sidewalk with no coughing or sneezing, but some of them turned away (back facing me) and covered their children while walking past me, or went on the street to walk. I didnâ€™t have a mask and they did not either, but the way they acted was discriminatory, acting as if I were a COVID-19 carrier because I am Asian. They were Asian as well - now, racism is also from Asians towards other Asians, not just from other races.

Instead of exiting the door at MacArthur station (near where I was standing) he turned and walked up to me within inches, and spat directly in my face. I didnt hear him say anything because I had headphones, but he just spat and exited the train. He did not seem like a homeless person.

When they left the bus, I looked at each of them in the eye with disgust. They each looked at me & seemed pretty somber - I hope they felt ashamed! I looked around & there were a few other Asians on the bus.

While looking at rotisserie chicken, I slightly coughed beside another Asian-American woman. Another costco member then called us out, saying that we should stay home and had no business being in public, before finishing off by saying Â« I donâ€™t want to get what your people are spreading Â».

The Native man asked the victim if he was Chinese and the victim responded no. He then asked where he was from and he responded â€œVietnamâ€. The Native man corrected him and said heâ€™s Chinese. Iâ€™m a physician. Recently the chief of the hospitalist staff sent out a mass email to all hospitalist providers, encouraging them to brush up on mechanical ventilation skills in anticipation of a COVID surge. To â€œlighten the mood,â€ she attached a derisive xenophobic cartoon that not only condones but tacitly encourages further xenophobic sentiment at a time when we are most vulnerable to attack and harassment. This is especially offensive considering that several of her staff are of Asian descent.

Never had an issue at my local pharmacy. Today, the pharmacist acted as if though i
 I wasn't there, but after making me wait a while, finally asked what I wanted. He acted as if though he has never seen a government issued ID card, but many veterans use this pharmacy. His demeanor was cold, but was never this way in the past. I was the only customer present, waiting for service. He offered no apology for the wait, didn't thank me when he handed me my prescription. Location_Incident: 1950 University Ave #160 East Palo Alto, CA
Description:
I went to see my Cardiologist (Dr. Shalini Bhambani) due to having a chest pain for 5 days. I am a heart patient and had two open surgeries and ongoing heart illness. 
 When I went to see my cardiologist on 3-10 in her clinic. When a assistant name Sarai Manzo called me a in a room asked me a routine questions like, have I been to outside of county last 14 days? or Do I have a fever or cough etc. 
 Also she asked me do I know anyone who traveled outside of US or contact with virus? 
 I told her that I don't know anyone who has a virus or traveled outside of US, but I go to a Gym everyday, and I overheard some ladies talking about one of the member went to Mexico 2 months ago, that's all I said, and as soon as she heard Mexico she got up and left the room right away without saying anything. She didn't hear the whole sentence or words, she just left the room. 
 
 I waited in a small room for 30 minutes and finally I asked one of the lady at the front desk about why the doctor would not come and see me? As soon as I asked that question she yelled at me " Get back inside of the room and closed the door" I told her that I could not breath in a small room so I tried to open the door but she wouldn't let me open the door. 
 All of sudden they thought that I was carrying a Coronavirus. 
 Finally assistant and nurse name Cindy came into a room with fully mask on their face and told me that the doctor will not see you and you need to leave. I asked her why? 
 You told us that you went to Mexico Cruise and you need to be quarantine. 
 I told them I never went on a Mexico cruise or went outside of country. 
 But they wouldn't want to hear the truth from me, they kept on saying you have a virus and it's our hospital policy and we can't treat it you. You need to go home. 
 I told them over and over but they just told me to get out and doctor wouldn't come to see me. They don't want to hear the truth from me. 
 
 They wrongfully accused me be on that Mexico cruise and having a virus therefore, they denied my medical treatment to jeopardize my health.
 Next day I had a severe chest pain I had to go to Washington Hospital Emergency Room near my home. 
 How could they denied medical treatment to a person with heart disease and don't want to hear the truth from the patient? 
 A doctor should come to a room and asked me a one simple question than everything will be fine, but NO, doctor was afraid or didn't want to hear the truth. 
 They know that I am a Korean or Asian and thought I went to Mexico Cruise, therefore, they didn't want to treated me all.
 
 I was treated worse than an animal in that small room. I told them I can't breath but they would not let me open the door for air. 
 They would not put their own dog in a small room to be hyperventilated. 
 As soon as I got out of the office I called my lawyer and told them what exactly happened and he was so shocked and couldn't believe what just happened.
 Also, nurse name Cindy at the Cardiologist office sent an email to Palo Alto Medical Foundation for everyone can see that I have a Coronavirus. She sent a lie email to a Medical foundation. 
 So all the nurses and doctor wouldn't treated me when they see an email, which put my life in a dangerous situation. 
 I was so hurt by this and they totally discriminated me from getting a medical treatment. 
 
 I know this virus is giving everyone in a panic situation, but people in a medical field should be more caring and compassionate instead of judging people and accused me of something that never happened. 
 
 The Cardiologist should have come into a room and asked me directly but she never showed up at all. My primary doctor was furious and called her next day to tell the truth about this untruth incident, Dr. Bhambani left for a vacation next day.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have a copy of email that nurse sent it to Palo Alto Medical Foundation.

Location_Incident: LaGuardia Airport (LGA), Chicago Midway International Airport (MDW), Southwest Airlines
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description:
Around 4:00 PM ET on March 9, 2020, I was flying back to San Francisco (SFO) from New York's LaGuardia Airport (LGA). As my Southwest flight was boarding soon, I hurried through TSA and rushed through the walkway to my terminal gates. A passenger exiting the gates (elderly, tall, white male, wearing a dark green blazer) glared me and spit at my feet as we crossed paths. At the time, I didn't bother to look back as I didn't want to miss my flight. I boarded my flight without any issues, and as I was about to take off, I sank into my seat realizing what had happened. I regretted not saying or doing anything except putting all of my focus into walking to catch my flight. I pondered if what I was wearing had anything to do with the incident as well - a black t-shirt (design: a white-filled rectangle across my chest with the silhouette of "RESIST" in all-caps sans-serif letters), tan wool coat, light-blue ripped jeans, and light-brown dress shoes.
 
 I landed at my layover connection - Chicago Midway International Airport (MDW). During most of the layover, I walked throughout the airport browsing the different shops and amenities, noticing some mild stares here and there. A couple hours passed, and it was time to board my connecting Southwest flight to SFO. As I get in line for boarding, the first boarding group (the group I belonged in) was starting to board. I asked a white, female passenger what boarding number she had - her number was slightly after mine. Before I get a chance to explain that I had an earlier boarding number, she averted her eyes from mine, covered her face, and continued boarding. I ended up boarding at the end of that boarding group, behind a younger man who happened to be wearing a MAGA hat.
 
 On the flight from MDW to SFO, there were four flight attendants: two who I perceived to be Asian/Asian American, two who I perceived to be white. I happened to be sitting in a section of the aircraft that one of the white female flight attendants was servicing. During the flight, the flight attendant stopped at my seat to take my beverage order: I asked to redeem a drink coupon for an alcoholic beverage and for some water. The flight attendant moved on. As they were preparing the drink orders, flight attendants moved throughout the cabin distributing snacks. The flight attendant serving my section handed everyone their snacks; when she got to my seat, I extended my hand to receive my snack but she instead disregarded my gesture and dropped my snack in my lap. In distributing the collected beverage orders, this flight attendant brought me the alcoholic beverage I ordered but not the water. I chose to give her the benefit of the doubt, thinking that she might have forgotten. Later in the flight, she brought out a tray of water-filled cups - I requested water again and noticed that she had one cup remaining. She did not give me the cup of water, and no one else had wanted it. She gestured something that I didn't make out, walked back to her station at the end of the aircraft, and returned to our section with another tray of water-filled cups. This time, other passengers had gestured for water (as well as myself) and she ignored me, distributing cups of water, and returning to her station with a few undistributed cups of water left on her tray. Annoyed, I went to the lavatory at the front of the aircraft cabin. After using the lavatory, I asked the flight attendant at the adjacent station (who I perceived to be of Asian/Asian American descent) for water, which she handed me in a matter of moments. When our flight landed and the flight attendants were collectively facilitating our deboarding, the aforementioned white female flight attendant made eye contact with me and turned away as I passed her to exit the aircraft. 
 
 The experiences I listed were just *half* of the racist and xenophobic encounters I experienced during this overall trip. But generally speaking, my encounters with racism and xenophobia have been (and continue to be) especially prevalent around the transit and air travel industries. To this day, I have not reported anything to any airports or airlines and I still wonder if I can and should.

Location_Incident: 1051 S De Anza Blvd, San Jose, CA 95129
Description:
I am reporting for my friend, a Chinese-American woman. Her husband is husband is Japanese-American. She posted this on Facebook, regarding the incident with her 3 children, ages 12-under: 
 
 "So ... We were just attacked by an old white guy at a gas station. I don't know if he was high or sick, but he started screaming at Hideyo for stealing his car. He stomped on the car (we were all in it) and he put his fists up to my husband. If I thought my kids didn't know the words fuck, shit, asshole, or faggot, they do now. No one intervened: not other patrons, nor the attendant. So ... You tell me how to unpack this with my children. Mental illness? Racism? General prejudice? Trump's America? Yup, I'm gonna cry later. **
 
 ** Okay, now that Iâ€™ve cried, I should add that we are all safe. Hideyo (East bay hood life) was like â€œOh, thatâ€™s not the worst Iâ€™ve ever experienced ... he didnâ€™t REALLY want to fight meâ€ and while there is a sizeable dent on the side of the car ... if thatâ€™s the worst of it, I am ok with that. I should also add that I donâ€™t think it was racially motivated (we were the car closest to him) but likely a mental illness issue. Iâ€™m just sad that no one intervened. I also wonder if I did enough to protect my kids, because true to form, I did what I do best when actually confronted with conflict â€” I freeze. Lots of hugs for everyone today, I think, and they know we can talk about it more. Bear says she will never give Rotten Robbie (on De Anza) her business again."

I left very angry and sad as Iâ€™ve never experienced anything like that in my life and as a young college student I felt thatâ€™s why I was targeted too. The hate against innocent Asian Americans because of the coronavirus needs to stop and something must be done with all these insults and assaults. Many Asian Americans like myself do not feel safe not only because of the virus but also because of the fear of being insulted or assaulted just because of our race/ethnicity and because the virus came from a country in Asia. 
 
 Another incident i would like to share is I was visiting a family friend in South LA and as I was walking back to my car from his house a random guy on the street then yelled out to me to bring him some chinese food since he said he was hungry and craving it he said and that he also said That he might get the carona virus from eating it if I brought it he said. I felt again targeted because I am Asian again and I stormed off very angry and embarrassed that I even cried on my way going back home.

Immediately upon making eye contact with me a young man passing by threw his arms up and yelled, "Man! I fuckin' hate China right now! Eating dogs and bats and shit! ..." The rest was hard to hear as my partner and I kept walking.

When I finished running an errand I called a Lyft to return home because I did not want to use public transit. I was chatting with the Lyft driver at first and the subject got onto COVID-19 because it looked like a ghost town. He told me that he and other drivers would not pick up Asian passengers. I know there has been a lot of racist rhetoric so I politely informed him that the virus can be carried by ANYONE and that in our area patient zero probably wasn't even of Asian descent. He insisted that drivers were refusing rides for their own safety. I think Lyft and other companies need to issue an updated "How to stay safe" guideline and include the clarification that ANYONE can have the virus and refusing rides based on race is racist discrimination. I made sure to go back and report it, but it still upsets me.

When my son and I arrived at his preschool, we were immediately turned away. The teacher simply told us that we had to go. There was no communication beforehand that they would turn away children they â€œsuspectedâ€ had coughs or colds, and upon arrival (after not having seen any of the children since the previous Friday) they refused to let him in claiming he had a cough 3 days prior (which had gone away by this Monday we were coming in). They refused to let my son attend, so we just had to return home. Supposedly one other child was turned away because she was immunocompromised, but otherwise no other children were turned away that day. I believe they probably didnâ€™t think to communicate to the parents beforehand, and upon seeing my Asian son the teacher panicked and sent us away.

a white woman with her family and a dog told me to pull my dog in and away from her as she approached me, obviously because she was worried about my dog infecting hers. there was more than six ft of separation between us and she passed well within that range of another white woman who was walking two dogs but was not concerned about exposure by the other woman. she gave me a dirty/fearful look and muttered to herself as she passed by me when i said i would not pull on my dog (we were standing stationary at the edge of the trail to let them pass).
Donald J Trump officially changed the name of the Corona Virus to the Chinese Virus in his speech to stir up hate in the United States towards Chinese people.

Was at bingo with my mother. I was in line waiting for tickets. No social distancing at all. This woman Trump supporter that was next to me. Started pointing, making faces & nodding at me as a nice Korean woman passed me into the office.

Cashier treated me differently because I am Asian. Asked to stand at end of conveyor belt, cashier moved as far away from me as possible, threw my receipt in my bag. She did not act this way customer before or after me.

Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Verbal Harassment, Barred from establishment
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Verbal Harassment, Barred from Establishment
Description: I am disabled and immunocompromised, but had a misunderstanding over the phone prescreening before a scheduled new patient Dr's appointment, and the phone receptionist sent an email to the new office, warning I had positive exposure and not to see me, I tried to explain and thought it was sorted out. When I got there, I was told to go to urgent care and tried to explain the misunderstanding, but no one would listen and the nurse started screaming at me to leave and go to urgent care, while I was trying to sort it out with the office manager on the phone. Since I was on the phone and did not respond, other patients starting yelling at me as well, while the nurse threatened to call the police. Due to my disability I could not just get up and walk out since I use a cane, walker, or wheelchair, unfortunately did not have a caregiver with me, and was experiencing a flare up of cardiac, neurological, and autoimmune issues, which the office would know from having my medical history. I believe this was also a violation of HIPPA laws since they told other patients in the waiting room to put on masks because I was going to infect them with the covid19 virus.
Any_SupportingLinks: The office lobby says that it is under video surveillance, but I do not have any other evidence myself. The office staff would be the only witnesses and also possibly the recorded phone conversation with the office manager at Stanford Health, as well as SJPD reports and call logs from that day.

There's a lot of flinching, glaring and moving away when I was taking the subway too. My Asian American friend got yelled at just for yawning on the subway. I also read a recent Yelp Review from Bar Pisellino in the West Village of NYC where a customer experienced racial discrimination where the manager glared at the customer and only cleaned the bathroom she used and not when other customers used it after her. The owner nor manager did not apologize or do anything about how the manager treated the customer. I got this link to share my experience from a New York Times article and I don't know if there's a platform like this in NYC. If you know of one, please let me know. I wrote a discrimination report on the NYC government website but I don't feel like it did much. I did not want to write my name and I hope that's okay. Thank you for your help and your support.

In the meanwhile, she made coughing noises at me. She didnâ€™t not wear a mask but I did. She didnâ€™t keep distance with people in front of her or ask any one else to keep 6-feet distance with her. I have valid reason to believe that was a discrimination against my ethnicity and the fact that I was wearing a mask.

The woman was screaming me because I didn't have leash on my small dog. When I responded calmly I just moved to the neighborhood recently and didn't know she persist to not believe me and took pic of me then when I told her to stay 6 feet away from me she said " go back to your country".

Yuanyuan Zhu was walking to her gym in San Francisco on March 9, thinking the workout could be her last for a while, when she noticed that a man was shouting at her. He was yelling an expletive about China. Then a bus passed, she recalled, and he screamed after it, â€œRun them over.â€
 
 She tried to keep her distance, but when the light changed, she was stuck waiting with him at the crosswalk. She could feel him staring at her. And then, suddenly, she felt it: his saliva hitting her face and her favorite sweater.
 
 In shock, Ms. Zhu, who is 26 and moved to the United States from China five years ago, hurried the rest of the way to the gym. She found a corner where no one could see her, and she cried quietly.

During my 10 minute break, 2 workers made a joke about cornora virus to each other after seeing me sitting in the break room. 1 of the 2 said " I can't get the Corona virus because I'm not a chink." Later, I was retaliated by that worker distorted and falsify claim about me instigating something as I was getting materials.
Standing in line at Trader Joe's. An older caucasian male singled me out and ONLY ME socially distance myself in line because I was Chinese.

Location_Incident: Whole Foods parking lot - 70 Merrimon Ave., Asheville, NC 28801

I was initially sent home 3/18, Wednesday morning, with seasonal allergies' symptoms, which my co-worker called Chinese virus, and was denied to work remotely. I was told I can resume working if I get tested for COVID-19 and once a letter from the doctor was received. Provided the doctor's note that I was cleared to return to work and I was fired Friday, 3/20, over the phone.
My 2 Chinese boys Playing street pickup soccer against 3 Caucasian boys - the Caucasian boys got upset about losing and said to my boys â€˜your Chinese! You have the coronavirus!!!â€™

An acquaintance posted a story with photos of cookies and labeled â€œChina virus cookies.â€ I understand the anxiety and frustration everyone is facing during these hard times but I was honestly still perplexed as this person was somebody I respected prior to the post. Heâ€™s cancelled. Iâ€™m not from
 China, but I can imagine the first person who contracted this from an animal for sure did not ask for it as a HUMAN being, no matter what geographic location they were located in.
Patient called me an explicit name and told me not to "bring disease" with me in his inpatient room when I am assigned to assist him as a medical personnel.

My mom and I were taking an evening stroll in our neighborhood when two people drove by with their windows down and yelled something inaudible at us while covering their mouth with their t-shirt and glaring at us.

I am an Asian. I was picking up food from local restaurant, getting ready to drive home. As I was driving out of the parking garage, a white male in his 50-60s passed by, making eye contact with me and flipping his finger at me. Although I was in my car, I couldn't do anything with the fear of him getting close and physically harming me. The psychological damage is big enough that I won't go out to order food for a while.

My children and I was at Walmart and several people called me Chinese and said I had no business out grocery shopping with my kids bc I have the virus. They even harassed my kids and said to go home and stay home .
Older white gentleman stared at me through out store and then proceeds to ask â€œDo you have that krohns disease?â€ I was the only person of color in store
Person leaning outside of car yelling "fuck you, coronavirus!" At me and my friend walking outside

Waiting for the bus to go home after a shift at the hospital and I hear a black man in a mask grumble about how â€œmy family and ancestors brought this shit hereâ€ and he looked like he was approaching me but I moved-and as two buses came back to back, he deliberately got on a different bus.

My husband is chinese. (I am reporting on his behalf.) We were at Lowes and an old white man came up to him and demanded to know why he was not wearing a face mask. The old man did not accost any of the other white people around us who were not wearing masks. My husband de-escalated the situation, but I was very upset that he was approached in such a manner.

I was sitting on a bench at the station waiting for the train. Suddenly this young black guy in his twenties came over and spitted on me . His glob of slivas landed on my coat. It was an act of hate crime . He uses the outbreak as a an excuse for his act of violent and aggression. It's an act of hate crime due to his ignorance. Its unacceptable and disgraceful.

An older female customer of White passing, attempted to stop my purchase of food items at a grocery store. The individual verbally harassed with "You will infect us [...] Get the F* away from me!" They were physically aggressive and the person attempted to prevent me from purchasing the items and to leave the establishment. The individual left the scene, once I removed myself from the vicinity of this person of conflict. No action was taken from bystanders or employees.

Location_Incident: Canal Street A/C/E subway platform, southbound
Description: A passenger on the subway platform was yelling about wanting to "kill Chinese" for "creating coronavirus." I was with my 10 y/o biracial child, there were 3 or 4 other asian women on the platform, at least one was wearing a facemask. I caught his eye, and then he said he should push us onto the train tracks. When he boarded the train, my daughter and I stayed behind and waited for the next one.
Any_SupportingLinks: No. I did not think to report this, thinking there was nothing that could be done about a mentally ill racist person. However, since these days of mounting attacks against all ethnicities of Asians around the world, I feel like we should report any incident, to educate the larger public this is not OK.

Location_Incident: Whole Foods SOMA, 399 4th Street, San Francisco 94107
Description: While washing my hands in the bathroom with my N95 mask on, a white Amazon Prime shopper female employee came out of the stall. She came up behind me & started gesticulating in an aggressive tone: "Look at this woman here wearing a mask." The she moved close to my right side and leaned forward into my personal space with an aggressive stance and threatened, "I could cough all over you now and your mask would do you no good." Then, she rushed out of the bathroom. In the mayhem of Monday 3/16 of 100's of people shopping in Whole Foods SOMA, I saw the woman in a line when I came out of the restroom, found her supervisor and brought the supervisor to the woman who was still standing in the very long line. But, b/c of the mayhem of the Shelter In order which just announced 45 minutes prior, her supervisor couldn't deal with the incident right then and there. The woman was shocked I found her.

As usual, I took a walk near the neighborhood today. While I was walking across an intersection, a car stopped at the red light honked. I paused the conversation on the phone, lifted up my head, and saw that the driver and the person sitting at the passenger's seat were looking at me. After I passed the intersection, they looked at me and honked again.
 I kept on going, feeling strange, but did not associate it with anything. When I was walking on the sidewalk of a bigger street in a few minutes, another car slowed down when driving pass me, honked, and resumed the driving.
 After reading others' experiences about the ill-treatments or violence they received recently as Asian looking people on multiple medias, I experienced it myself today. I did not only feel my dignity as a human being created by God's image is diminished, but that even my safety is at risk during this time.

At that point, I got up and moved to a different part of the bus.

Location_Incident: San Francisco, While boarding bus at 4th St & Howard St bus stop

Looked to my right and saw a middle aged man who then continued to spit on me (my coat sleeve and backpack which I used to block my face). I rushed to the back of the bus and bus driver stopped the vehicle so two officers could board shortly after and removed the man (after I identified him).
Any_SupportingLinks: None (just texted my family and friends about the incident shortly afterwards)

Location_Incident: Japantown 1737 Post Street, San Francisco, CA
Description: As I enter the Nijiya Market at Japantown, San Francisco, two teenagers were walking out from the store. As we passed each other, they pretend to sneeze and cough at me. I vaguely heard them saying something about the coronavirus and spreading disease.

My gf and I were waiting for subway #2 in mid town Manhattan. We received a lot of unwanted attention while we were standing there waiting for the train. We were not wearing masks or gloves. A guy suddenly turned around and yelled at us with anger "we don't want your race here.."

I was talking to my housemate when we heard a helicopter outside, and I joked that they were searching for people not staying 6 far apart. In response, my housemate â€œjoked/commentedâ€ that they were searching for me because of my â€œeyes.â€

I was on my way home on the Metro, sitting at a window seat. At the Pentagon City stop, a man who just exited the train came to the window and flashed me his middle finger. He ran away very quickly and I could not see his face.

There were plenty of seats open, but no one sat near me and people decided to stand instead.

I was the only Asian at a school play, for my daughter, and the couple next to my starting talking about the Coronavirus in my direction, but facing his child, as if it was not directed at me. The chances of another parent needing to bring up the coronavirus, at a kids school play, while sitting next to an Asian, seemed unusual. I felt uncomfortable.

Location_Incident: This is the story of our co-worker. Our thoracic radiologist who is of Korean descent was walking to his car when this doctor accidentally tripped & fell sideways on somebody's car. The driver of the said car came out of his car & punched the thoracic radioligist on the face. The radiologist obtained facial fracture from the battery act.
Description: The driver of a car came out of his car & punched our doctor without asking first what happened. After punching the Asian doctor, the driver took off immediately.

I went to go introduce myself to a new patient, he immediately stated that he didn't want me (shielding his face) because he did not want to get the coronavirus. I informed him I wasn't Chinese nor have I ever been to China, that I am a medical professional and was born here in the US, however, I would be fine with not having him as a patient if that is how he was going to be. I left the room. This patient did apologize to me in the morning. I thanked him for the apology, however, informed him that he was not forgiven because in times like these, his actions and words were true to how he felt.

Description: I was not seen by the employee at my local post office where I have been a regular customer for over 20 years. After patiently waiting as she pointed to others behind me for nearly 45 minutes, I approached the desk when she prompted me to take several steps backwards in a very hostile tone. She had not requested any of the prior customers that had gone ahead of me, and they were also all non-Asians. I am an American citizen, and owner of the nearby community dry cleaners for over 20 years where I just today, chose to send my employees home with a generous cash bonus. The sting of her racism and coldness towards me made me feel less than and frankly, dehumanized.

I parked my vehicle and I as I was crossing the road/ parking towards the door of the store a vehicle approached, inside was a woman with a mask on honking her horn, screaming get out of the public, speeding up trying like she was trying to run me off the road. I was in complete shock that something like that had just happened to me. I couldnâ€™t get her plates because it was dark and she drove off. i was in disbelief and I just went home. Since the incident I have been extra careful of my surrounds and have my phone ready in case I need to call
 911.
I happened to be walking behind another Asian customer and a woman hawking products at Costco held a box in front of her face and said in our direction, â€œStay away from my face!â€

I was walking my dogs with my children getting some fresh air and exercise in. A Caucasian gentleman and a girl around 11/12 yr old rolled down the window and shouted out â€œCorona virusâ€ and rolled up the window as fast as they could and started laughing. They drove a black pickup truck.

Location_Incident: Snake River Community Clinic, Lewiston, Idaho, 83501

I asked if I was done or should leave and she said oh, yeah, you can go. I realize this doesn't really sound like much bit it was so subtle in that it wasn't outright racist language but rather facial expression, body language, tone of voice, etc. It's the subtlety that adds to the humiliation and makes me feel powerless.

A group of Teenage Caucasian Americans screamed "corona" at us when my friend and I walked past them towards the restaurant. Then when we were about to leave, an Asian family of four biked past the same group, and got yelled at "here comes the corona squad" directly at them.

Location_Incident: Sprouts/1500 E Village Way Ste 2279 Orange Ca
Description: They said â€œfucking chinos walking byâ€ and glared at me and my boyfriend for awhile

I am a physician completing my fellowship training. I just completed my case of the morning and while leaving, I needed to fill some gas. I turned into my usual gas station that I like to stop before hopping on the highway. I remember feeling pretty happy that prices were down. Approaching the gas station, I noticed some irregular potholes at the entrance, so I slowed down moderately to safely enter the station. A white SUV which was turning from another direction tailed me into the gas station and started screaming obscenities that I could hear through my closed windows. She rushed around parallel to my car on the other side of the gas pumps as I moved forward to my usual spot, then swerved around violently to block my car head-on from proceeding any further. I thought sincerely she was going to hit my car, so I stopped and stared at her aghast while she rolled her window down and screamed with such intense vitriol and unbelievable hate I have never experienced personally in my life. I remember clearly the look on her face. The moment was surreal and I sat stunned in my car. From a distant part of my head, I saw her license plate reflected in my side mirror and I thought for a moment, maybe I should memorize it or take a picture. But, all I was able to do was to just sit there stunned. I'm born and raised 30 miles from where this occurred. I was brought up with a mixed cultural background, so being 'Asian' is not something I have specifically identified, although I always felt especially in my younger years I was constantly pegged into the category. I am an Ohioan and I'm an American. I've completed my education in Ohio, stayed in Ohio for medical school, residency training, then now my second fellowship. To be reduced in my home state, no - my home - by someone by just how I look pierces painful holes in much of what I worked for to overcome "just how I look." This is not the America I'm proud of. And I know while this is not ever coming from the people I know and love, I felt fear. I felt fear of my personhood and I worried deeply about my parents and my friends of Asian heritage. I felt fear of the dark, secret hatred that festers in people as we try to face the unknown together. 
 
 I think one point that I learned from this incident, is that despite the madness, there are kind people out there. At the gas station afterward, a woman asked if I was okay. Unsure of what else to say or feel at the moment, I thanked her and said yes.
 
 I appreciate the opportunity to share this story. I am not avidly on social media in a personal sense and while I threw around in my head a way to share this, I also felt maybe I shouldn't. I saw that this venue was available through the New York Times article. I think it's important that our stories are gathered and heard.

I was stepped on by a middle aged black woman accidentally. When I said â€œexcuse meâ€ she started yelling at me, saying I should not expect her to bow down to me, nor should she have to apologize to me for anything â€œright nowâ€. She followed me and my SO (also Chinese) down the public escalator yelling â€œthis Chinese couple out hereâ€ repeatedly. There were at least 4 security guards witnessing and 50 bystanders who all did and said nothing.

Location_Incident: Todos Santos Bus Station in Baja California Sur
Description: As I was getting to my assigned seat on the back of the bus, a man in a polo shirt started yelling at me and to people that I had corona virus. He lifted his polo collar in front of his face and tried to squirm away as I was passing him. As I got to my aisle seat, the man in the window seat saw me, got up and sat somewhere else.

Was walking along a building on the sidewalk and trying to avoid a man coming towards me for social distancing. As he passed he looked at me and said "your people disgust me" and spat on the ground in between us.
I heard that it's a Pandemic so I was wearing mask and waiting Uber alone in the street. Four black guys(two men, two women) came to me and said "You brought Corona, Go to your country"

Location_Incident: Townsend and 172nd St. in Bronx, NY
Description: A guy yelled, â€œThanks for the coronavirusâ€ with snickers
An old white male came to me and told me to go back home. And he called me Ching Cheng Chong.

A man saw me in an aisle and made a shocked face, and then made it a huge point to avoid walking near me - I could tell I was the one being targeted because while avoiding me, he walked towards other people who were not Asian and did not try to distance himself from them. I know there are other incidents that others are experiencing that are way more severe (I carry the privilege of being a man of an athletic build and people are generally less likely to attack me), but I wanted to share this instance to do my part to not stay silent and help build our voice in this country. Thanks for the work you all do.
i was walking my dog as usual, Two guys were driving by next to me . they cursed at me and gave me a middle finger with no reason.

I was their waitress. They asked if I had the virus and if I was planning on being tested. They caused a huge scene and made other people look in my direction. They did not want me to be their waitress and only ordered from my other non asian coworkers.

A woman passing me in the park glared at me with a nasty grimace and then pulled up her scarf. As soon as she was a short distance away I saw her pull her scarf down again - clearly she saw me as a 'Chinese Virus' carrier.

Location_Incident: Santa Monica, near San Vicente Blvd and Moreno Ave
Description: I was jogging in the morning, but the teenage boys in the car passing by said the window down. When I stopped and pulled out my earphones, it was called a corona virus.
Man referred to Covid-19 as â€œThis virus thing, the Slanty eyed, yellow skin, province one...â€

I am submitting this incident on behalf of a friend who works in China and has work relations with clients overseas in England. Some clients requested masks from her companyâ€™s so she went ahead to ask all her clients if there are in need for masks and one of the Client from England verbally harassed Her and her country. Also called coronavirus as â€œChinese virusâ€ with a hashtag. My friend fought verbally in response to the this abusive message and received further response from him. I have all the screenshot as proof of this incident. Thank you ðŸ™
A black male yelling at me something "what the fuck is wrong with you wearing that..."

(I am submitting this on behalf of my parents, who are 70 and 65 years old.) My parents were pumping their gas at a gas station, when a group of men started yelling at them. They couldn't understand them completely but heard them say, "China virus" and "Chinese". They were scared and got in the car and drove away. They are already super paranoid about their own health, so the fact that they could also be targeted for being Asian, is making them more afraid.

Location_Incident: Lincoln Market, 33 Lincoln Rd, Brooklyn, NY 11225
Description: In a packed market as everyone was panic shopping, an employee (male, who appeared to be white & in his 30s) was stocking food on the shelves & when I walked through the aisle, he made a face of disgust, then made a shrieking sound & laughed mockingly, dramatically dropped what he was stocking & backed up, flattening his body against the shelves to avoid me & kept staring at me. Dozens of people (none of them Asian) had walked by him before & after I did in that aisle & he did not engage in this same behavior w/ any of them.

Location_Incident: Public Transport train stain hub, exiting into the annexed ahopping plaza
Description: My mum was wearing a face mask because she has stage 3 lung cancer and is having treatment. She was walking into the train area, and was virtually jumped on by an Asian lady screaming at her that ppl like her think all Asians caused the virus. Mum did not have a chance to respond before she hit mum. She swung her forearm knocking mum off her feet. She kept yelling it was all "your people's fault" & "we were all racist so & so'" . The area has a high Asian community that is very well loved, & integrated in our community. Even before this pandemic had taken any real affect here, the Asian shopkeepers were wearing masks, & were very careful. No-one could be more proud of a community working together. However, one other assault on a western person has occurred, and often when you try to report these, you are told " There is a misunderstanding in the language." They get it enough to come at you aggressively waving their arms, and then hitting you. I work in healthcare,I see quite a lot but on the flip side they cannot continue to behave in a way that is unbecoming of anyone. Regardless whether or not you understand DOES NOT mean you can ASSAULT or HURT another person. You can also speak to them in a pleasant voice. My mum is the nicest and kindest person, not a racist bone in her body, but is wary travelling on her own now. I abhor people bullying & assaulting Asian ppl because they are under the misguided presumption they have brought the virus from China (IDIOTS) but that does not mean they can behave the same way to people either. Please we are not all horrible, or narrow-minded.

One bus drove off without stopping for me even though I was the only one at the stop. Second bus opened itâ€™s doors for me, but tried to drive off once the driver looked at me. I had to run and hop on before the driver could close the door. The only other passenger pulled her scarf up and put gloves on when she saw me board.

A man right outside of the main Massachusetts General Hospital entrance yelled at me, â€œWhy are you Chinese people killing everyone, what is wrong with you, why the fuck are you killing us?â€ I continued walking and pretended I didnâ€™t hear, but he did follow me for a block before he gave up. I notified security and filed a formal incident report, and they stated that this has been happening with some frequency recently around the hospital premises.

Location_Incident: Whole Foods Redwood City Parking Lot
Description: A women said directly to me (we were the only two in the parking lot) "It's all because of you people"
Waiting to cross the street, I felt something on my head and it turned out to be spit all over my hair and back of my coat. I was repeatedly spit on by a big white guy
We were crossing path and he said, among other things "fucking Chinese".

Location_Incident: Near Van Ness and Mission, San Francisco
Description: While driving home, a homeless man spit on our car without any provocation

Location_Incident: San Francisco, Ashton St and Pico Ave
Description:
My 21 yr old daughter, 11 yr old daughters, and I were walking on Ashton near the intersection with Pico; I was 10 feet ahead of my girls. A white man about 5'7" walked past my daughters and said to them "You speak perfect English, don't ever change the way you talk."
 I did not overheard the comment; however, my 21 yr old daughter felt insulted and threatened after she heard the man. My 11 year old daughter also felt uncomfortable without knowing what she could have done.
 I had experienced worse encounters; yet, incidents such as this one, while not as grave, still causes me to reflect in how I should teach my children to respond in a confident and commanding manner.

I was walking my dog with two 8 year old daughters in the park trail. Two white males probably in their 50s were riding bicycles coming from the other side. They were loudly talking to themselves, but when they passed by us, one of the guy looked at my daughter and said " Hi, Killers" then moved away.

Description: I was wrongfully terminated from my job at the US Census because of the Corona Virus. I was sick for a few days and when I came back with a doctor's note, I was told I was not welcome back into the office and that I was already terminated without notice. There were also Corona Virus jokes made from the supervisors in front of my colleagues to my face about my coughing and not feeling well a few weeks before my actual days off. After the wrongful termination, it triggered me to have major depression and major cortisol levels to rise in my body causing me to cry all the time, be on medication, and gain 16 lbs. Also, I asked if I was terminated without notice, where was my notice, the supervisor went to write a notice on the spot and when she handed me the notice, she refused to sign it. Everything is not done correctly. I told her I never received warnings or anything. I told her I want to see proof. Supervisor told me that I'm unwelcome inside the office since I was already terminated and that she will email it to me. She never did.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have doctors reports and all Census paperwork

Reason_Discrimination: Ethnicity, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Ethnicity, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Description:
I was stared at by nearly everyone for wearing a mask, as I have done every day for 5 years. One woman Approached at the deli counter and angrily interrupted putting her finger in my face and screamed your mask is bullshit you're just spreading fear. As she walked away she mumbled to herself "she doesn't need a mask she needs to go back"
 Other customers stared and Followed me from aisle to aisle as I continued my shopping as if I was a criminal or spectacle. 
 Another asked me to please remove my face mask and glasses insinuating that they wanted to see if I was in fact Asian, as I have red hair and can generally pass for entirely Caucasian wearing glasses. 
 As I attempted to find packaged fresh meat in an empty store I overheard an couple joke to each other while making sure I could hear "bet bat and dog isn't sold out."
 I have been stopped and asked repeatedly why I am wearing a mask in public if I am not contaminated and all assume I am contaminated. I have a complex and extensive medical history and needs, including immuno suppression and extreme sensitivity to smells. I generally wear a mask as a courtesy as it is expected in my culture and family, But also spray a small amount of perfume or other cent on a mask so I do not smell anything offensive that would make me ill in public, body odor and bad smells are unfortunately very common in central Florida.
 People have demanded to know my medical history regarding the mask As well as my family and personal interaction and travel history. 
 I was shunned and stared at so terribly for sneezing due to allergies into my mask and elbow that I left the store out of fear. 
 
 I have ceased using other languages besides English.
Any_SupportingLinks: None but thank you for tracking this. I'm lucky enough to be able to skate by on white appearance privilege, but my family is not. I fear for their lives.

Description: I were verbally threatened and then almost physically assaulted by a white male, blamed me to bring the virus to this country

I was sprayed with axe body spray by a white kid who commented in the Coronavirus. Shortly thereafter he head-butted me and caused my head to strike a wall. The incident was reported to the New Kent Sheriffâ€™s Department & the School.
See social media link below
Informational meeting became a racist rant, mayor of scarsdale even wrote an apology letter
Male walked by, said in passing. I'll kill you Chinese bitch! was strolling my 22mos old son to post office
I was reaching for a bag of frozen broccoli when another customer said do you know about the broccoli ? It was grown in a China. You shouldnâ€™t buy it.
While grocery shopping, a group of three teenagers were roaming the store, possibly with a parent. The largest of the three approached me and coughed into my face at a distance of one foot.

I was buying a cup of coffee at 7-11 when a man dark curly hair approximately 50-60 y.o. perhaps Iranian or Eastern European approached me and immediately started verbally harassing me. He said you have Coronavirus. You eat cats and dogs. You are ruining things for my son and daughter. I was completely stunned and felt like throwing my coffee all over him. He seemed drunk like an alcoholic slightly slurred speech but speaking clearly and loudly for all to hear. I said You have Coronavirus! The cashier shook his head at him told him donâ€™t say those things, but the cashier still let him buy items. I walked outside upset. An African American male in his 20â€™s shouted at me that was fâ€™d up! Heâ€™d been inside and heard. I said, Yeah it was! I was afraid the racist harasser was about to come outside so I finished my coffee and drove away so I didnâ€™t have to see him any more.

He looked at me as he was passing by (another Asian lady wearing a mask was seated two rows behind me). The 2nd man continued: I would have to wear a mask if I sat here.
I was on the street and a guy driving by in his car coughing at me. He shouted out â€œhope you get corona you fucking Chineseâ€ even though I am not even Chinese per say.

I was walking my dog and passed by a parked car filled with three teenage boys. As I walked near toward them, they started coughing in a fictitious manner and called out â€˜co-ro-na-virusâ€™ in a sneering manner, then turned on their car and drove off.

Description: This lady walked towards me and asked if I am Chinese. I said I am, she then covered her nose and mouth told me I have to stay away from her.

Went to pick up take-out and the restaurant had their bar open. One woman looked at me as I walked in, leaned over to hear partner, and said "Thought we were trying to get AWAY from coronavirus" before scooting away from me. She attempted to get other patrons riled up as I waited for my food.
I was shouted at by a passing pickup truck with two young adult males, in the parking lot of a supermarket, while trying to buy groceries.

I was walking on my way home carrying a grocery bag from the supermarket. A middle-aged woman was walking towards me with an umbrella open. As she was passing me, she struck me with her umbrella (shielding herself from me) and yelled out "Fucking Chinese! Get off the fucking sidewalk!" No bystanders said anything, and I did not engage with the woman. I continued walking home humiliated and crying.
Someone I know made a Facebook post/"joke" about how his friend Rob sent him to the Asian market nearby to get noodles in an attempt to subject him to covid-19.

The man looked at me and my friends on what we decided was a final walk through the park before lockdown, when this man did the Nazi salute and yelled, "seig heil" at me and my friends a number of times. He was with a friend.

Location_Incident: Whole Foods Market, Mt. Washington, Baltimore, MD
Description: I may have date and time wrong. Can't find Whole Foods receipt to verify. I turned down an aisle at the grocery store and on the opposite end of the aisle, about 20 feet away, was a white woman in her 60s was standing with her shopping cart next to a younger white man (late 40's). The two appeared to be neighbors engaged in a conversation. The moment I turned down the aisle, she yelled at me hysterically: "STAY AWAY FROM ME!" Her neighbor friend that she was talking to physically restrained her. She was clearly comfortable with other shoppers near her. There were a couple other white people within close range of her, less than 6 feet. So, this wasn't just about social distancing. I was also not in close range of her. I left the store.
statement says mask are in high demand fighting the Chinese Corona Virus Covid-19
I walked onto a bus and a woman at the back of the bus shouted "coronavirus" at me. I stayed at the front of the bus. She gathered her things and ran off.

I want to request a dispute for the violation and fine that was given to us for unauthorized water shutoff. We had initially thouht that a water shutoff was necessary for a repair in our shower area. When the plumber tries to go downstairs into the room to shut off water, he found it locked so we were unable to access the water shutoff. That is when you see me remove the notice in the image. We later were able to repair and fix the problem without doing the shutoff. Please understand that we had thought a water shutoff was needed but later deemed it unneccesary. The water was not shut off at all during this time. Thank you fot reviewing.

She continued to accuse me of spreading the disease and that I was an idiot and probably didn't watch the news or understand it. As she checked out and walked out, she continued to name call me.

My husband was walking in Target Westgate parking lot with his mask and gloves on, and saw a Caucasian woman. He made sure to give plenty of distance between them. She kept staring at him and commented, "Hmm... Chinese virus needs special Chinese mask, huh?"

daughter's middle school during class one student said to another Asian student "you are Asian you have the coronavirus" and the other student referred to the teacher as "Sensei Corona, the teacher is half Japanese. When it was my turn, the clerk asked me to step back 3 feet. She did not ask any of the customers in line (who, were white and not wearing face masks) before me to step back 3 ft.This is a very mild case I experienced but it was a case of micro aggression nonetheless and I was shocked, as I've never experienced this type of behavior from my neighbors before.
White male followed me in his car while I was walking for about a block yelling racist stereotypes and COVID conspiracies.

Location_Incident: Oakland Postal Office at 201 13th Street, Oakland, cA
Description: African american female approx 20-30 years old yelled at me to "Go back to china and bring your chinese sickness!!! Oh, don't get me started....!" in front of a line of 10 people in line at Oakland postal office. She yelled for her african american boyfriend (20-30 years old) who walked at me in and past me in a threatening manner trying to intimidate me. I had originally given her a disapproving look because she was shouting about a "old bitch who worked at the post office". Then she said to me "What are you lookin at bitch?" I explained that I was old and did not appreciate her comment. No one helped me. I stayed and completed my transaction at the post office. They were still yelling at post office staff and not getting their business done when I finished. Karma.
Flip of the finger and Hostile aggression when I tried to say hi and why.

Location_Incident: Costco, 11000 Garden Grove Ave., Garden Grove , CA
Description: I was shopping with my two sisters and a Latino man came up to us and verbally harassed us â€œcorona virusâ€. We ignored him to avoid confrontation. It made us felt very uncomfortable
Please see below how these Latino are slashing asian being in news media. It is shameful and will get worst. Something needs to be done
2 men aggressively coughing and making sounds of disgust walking past me.
Some lady pointed at my friend and I, pinched her nose, and nodded in disagreement. We were so confused and we just laughed it off. Til this day, we still don't know what she meant.

Location_Incident: 3880 S Maryland Pkwy Las Vegas, NV 89119 United States
Description: I was looking for cardholders at Ross, and three African American ladies walked in. First one said, â€œThis motherfucker has corona.â€ I looked up and the second lady says, â€œEwww!â€ And gives me a disgusted look and starts kicking the nearby carts (I donâ€™t know why).

The racist man directly said to me, â€œdonâ€™t give me the fucking coronavirus, you Chinese bitch.â€ I took two seconds and a breath, then quickly walked away. Two days later, the shock wore off and on top of my usual police issue mace because I have a restraining order against someone, I sadly bought a fast release, large pocket knife for self defense. Today, my heart aches for our community and my nightmare disorder, which is a part of my anxiety, returned, to where I dreamt I was physically attacked and was thrashing and trying to pull someone off me in my dream.

Location_Incident: City & County Building, Denver District Court, 1437 Bannock St, Denver, CO 80202
Description: Coworker placed an offensive WASH YOUR HANDS! sign in a bathroom only shared between herself and I, and would use tissues to touch anything that had only been touched by myself - not my other white male coworker.

Location_Incident: Apple Fashion Fair Store 645 E. Shaw Avenue, Fresno, CA 93710 (559) 244-3400
Description: the floor sales mgr came up to me & the sales person, started wiping down with disinfecting wipes. didn't do that anywhere else, didn't occur to me until he just walked away to the back room. kind of strange.
Any_SupportingLinks: maybe you can obtain the Apple store's video surviellence

Description: "do not buy anything Chinese from here on. Check all labels. I am...years ago they went after our dogs and cats...they the garlic scandal ...they were harvesting...in cemetaries...they are no good...they ...manufacture all our antibiotics...they are slowly poisoning us & if you dispute that you are crazy...they have 250000 Chinese students stealing ...information...in our universities, take to China & use it against us...Time to wake up."
Any_SupportingLinks: I have screenshots and witnesses who were also in the chat room.

Description: Was told to self quarantine for a week (not sure about pay yet) after going out of town and was the only one told to leave when others traveled as well. I am the only Asian working there. Since returning to work, my neighboring co workers were allowed to work from home while I am in the office alone. My co workers have been whispering amongst themselves about me and it has made me insecure and unsafe since then.

Location_Incident: Trader Joe's / 400 Grand St, New York, NY 10002
Description: I was in line at Trader Joe's, there was a white man in front of me who told me to stay 6 feet away from him and I need to back away from him because of the covid19. There was a good amount of space between us and he only directed that message to me. There was a black lady in front of him who was NOT 6 feet away and he did not say anything to her. There was also a huge line behind me so there was no space for me to move even if I wanted too. I told him I can't move back because there was people behind me and he kept telling me to back up.
Caucasian lady said, â€œYOU people are bringing the virus to this country!â€, and walked away. I work at the airport so it was a very uncomfortable situation.

Description: The lady who was working refused to look at me while helping. Another person in line keeps kn eyeing me and called on his girlfriend to look at me. He kept looking until I passed by.
Gentleman who had been punched for Asian ethnicity.

Organizational_Affiliation: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
Location_Incident: Peoria St and Mississippi Ave, Aurora, Colorado
Description: I was jogging along Peoria St while an African male (around 6'6) walking to the opposite direction, to practice social distancing, I stepped aside. However, he walked towards me, grabbed me and pushed me to a pick-up.

Location_Incident: Trader Joe's Stonestown 265 Winston Drive San Francisco, CA 94132
Description: Elderly (white) woman physically and verbally assaulted me in Trader Joe's in the refrigerated produce section after we accidentally brushed shoulders getting vegetables on the same shelf. She pushed me on the shoulder and yelled in my face for the next 5 minutes about how I intentionally touched her and followed her - all of this was clearly untrue. The majority of people who witnessed this incident were Asian and no one said anything to defend or help me.
I received a robo call from the CDC - Chinese Descendants for Disease Control

Location_Incident: Florin Rd and Riverside Blvd, Sacramento, CA
Description: I was taking a walk on public sidewalk. A car drove by me and a youth passenger yelled out the window, "Coronavirus".

I was walking with co-workers from lunch, my hands were full but I coughed into my jacket which covered my mouth. This black woman shouted at me saying I was disgusting, and "your people are disgusting spreading diseases".
As the person saw me disinfecting my hands, he started mumbling towards me and made a disapproving gesture. The only word i could hear was Chinese or China.

Location_Incident: Washington D.C: U St/African-Amer CIvil War Memorial/Cardozo Metro Stop
Description: While on the subway, a teenage girl put her face very close to mine to physically threaten me. She then shouted that I had the coronavirus and that I should go back to my own country. I was with 3 other friends who were not Asian.
Students told my son he had Corona Virus because his mom is Chinese. Students also said only Chinese people can get sick.

Went into the post office wearing gloves, and was afraid to put my mask on. The African American worker covered her collar and mouth, put gloves on and a lot of sanitizer and refused to serve me but asked the white man behind me to step up. I said Iâ€™m not sick in perfect English and stepped back to her register and ignored it. She was silent. Microagression, shunning, and refusal of service.

I was wearing disposal gloves entering the supermarket. All of a sudden, an African American lady screamed at me demanding me to take off my gloves assuming my gloves were dirty and touched other things before getting into the supermarket. There was another non-Asian man next to me also wearing gloves but didnâ€™t get picked on by her.

I was wearing a face mask. There was a white man talking to another passenger and claimed those "Chinese" people wearing the mask not sure if they are sick or creating a chaos. It is just not necessary to use face mask...I was sitting behind him that I immediately moved from my seat and got off at next stop.
stop eating fucking bats u disgusting idiots. you are the true harassers because you're killing half the world
Somebody walking past coughed in my mom's face and sneered, "Chinese"

Location_Incident: Apple News App (Apple News Spotlight_Special Coverage COVID-19)
Description: Tying a random asian person on the street with Covid-19 in the news is completely inappropriate. The picture was taken in Chicago (on State st.) and it is not like everyone walking there is asian. This is racial profiling. The way the image is being used encourages racism toward Asian and Asian-Americans. I believe anyone in the public media/journalism has responsibility and they need to aware their insensitivity can ruin people's lives. I hope you can hold them accountable in this matter.

Later on when I was paying for my items he again approached me and called me a moron. I was shaking and after paying I quickly left. It was very scary since Iâ€™m just minding my own business and all alone.
