Description:
My former roommate and I both returned to our apartment after traveling to Los Angeles. He arrived one day before me and left his dirty suitcases and clothing all over the common area furniture. He claims that I have Covid-19 because I choked on a vitamin that I swallowed too fast and coughed once.
 
 While I was in LA I made sure to social distance, disinfect and wash my hands, and stay home as often as possible. I returned back to NYC early because we are being forced to move out of the apartment at the end of the month. Since returning, I have left the house twice. Once to walk my dog and once to go grocery shopping.
 
 He is supposed to return back to France as his visa has expired but decided to stay longer so that he could travel and hang out with friends. He had guests over, and the entire time I've been back I have not seen him wash his hands or disinfect any high touch surfaces. He also has kept his shoes on, has taken public transportation, and has been in and out of the apartment visiting friends and putting others at risk.
 
 He has sent me very nasty messages on WhatsApp and left the apartment for several days because he claims that I am putting him at risk and that I am a liar and he doesn't believe that I've made a conscious effort to self isolate, disinfect and wash my hands, and social distance.
A 19 year old Latino man targeted me and threw a softball intentionally on the passenger side of my car, while I was inside my car. I took photos and recorded their vehicle license plate.

Location_Incident: LIRR - Hempstead line to penn station
Description: White women verbally abused asian women wearing mask. I joined in to protect her and a ton of racist comments were made. We donâ€™t feel safe with you all here. Etc.
Any_SupportingLinks: Prefer not to share... only told family about this and left off social media

Description: I was walking on the sidewalk outside my apartment. A man was walking towards me and I felt something was off so walked quickly towards the street to create distance. He then tried to spit on me, but missed since I was too far away.

On instagram from Wu-Tang post which was about not discriminating against asians: a follower @triple.optics states that chinese people are nasty motherfuckers and that you can see how nasty it is in chinatown and that chinese and their disgusting habits and to fuck them.
See photos
Tenant did not honor deposit for rental payment , called her and she was abusive and then she text that i most probably have coronavirus because I am chinese

A white male in a car tried to take a parking spot that we were waiting for, and accelerated dangerously in a small parking lot. The man yelled at us and confront us, and bystanders (also white) began to yell and record us as well.

Organizational_Affiliation: You Matter-Not Alone Suicide Prevention Charity
Description: I would periodically go the Vons Store in N. Hollywood to get my lunch. On March 23rd, I went inside a Vons store around 2 ish pm to get my lunch. I was in the cereal isle looking for some protein snacks, when two older larger set American ladies were staring at me. I kept to myself and noticed that were about 5-6 ft away. They continue to stare and looked disgusted with my presence. I continued to ignore them and grabbed my protein snacks. I noticed from the corner of my eyes they continued to follow me, and stared me down again, and shake their heads at me, like I did something wrong. I proceeded to check out, and walked really quickly to my car, in hopes that they weren't behind me....

Location_Incident: A block from CVS Pharmacy in North Hollywood, CA (lankershim Blvd)
Description: While walking home from a pharmacy in my neighborhood at night I noticed a man yelling something towards my sister who was walking a short distance in front of me because of social distancing. I looked at the man because I suspected what he was yelling but was in disbelief. He then looked me in the eyes and said â€œyou too! You too! Thatâ€™s where it comes from. Corona.â€
During my morning run a man in a truck drove by and yelled â€œCoronavirusâ€ at me.
A girl posted abusive language against China and had stated that Chinese people deserve to die and deserved to be mocked at
Any_SupportingLinks: Yes I have screenshots of what she posted

Description: My half-Japanese son and his Japanese friend who live here at Waters Edge decided to try fishing. Within minutes the police were called by a neighbor who didn't recognize them and said they might be trying to "steal" something. Another neighbor began video taping in case something would happen. THEY WERE FISHING. That's it. WITH FISHING POLES. I cannot begin to tell you how angry this makes me. It is not the first time he has experienced discriminatory accusations based on his looks. Riding his bike to school one day, a jogger literally pulled him off his bike, accusing him of stealing her son's bike and interrogated him with questions on "where he was from" and "how long he's lived here in Rye" (We produced all bike receipts)
Called â€œhey Corona â€œ while I was walking with my kids in the park in Colorado Springs, Colorado

As I walked out of the building from getting my medication. I noticed, I was being scowled at by an older couple at a medical marijuana dispensary in Lowell and they were muttering things and pointing at me. I looked behind me for a second because I was confused at who they were looking at with such hate on their faces. There was no one behind me. They looked at me with such disgust. They were standing by my car unfortunately, waiting or something to go in, who knows so I just stared back and got in my car and left. I was getting my medication for my Lupus. I am disabled and just lost all my teeth. I was adopted from South Korea 31 years ago. I donâ€™t even know how to speak Korean, only English because this is where I was raised and I call home. I have a 5 year old, born here and Iâ€™m scared to take him anywhere. I can handle the abuse or bad looks but a 5 year wouldnâ€™t understand.

Location_Incident: On the "J" Church - In the Tube from Montgomery to Van Ness
Description: I sat across from a White Lady and when she saw me she said, "WTF, why are you sitting here", then a older Asian man sat next to her and she said, " WTF sit next to the other F***King Chinese guy, then a third Asian sat next to me and she went off and said, "WTF why are all these Chinese sitting next to me. 2 Mins later 2 Hispanic mothers came on board speaking Spanish and she said, "What with all these immigrants"
Any_SupportingLinks: I have a photo of her on my phone.

Description:
I've lived in the Green lake neighborhood over a decade and never seen any graffiti targeted Asians. I shopped at this Bartell drug store since the opening of the location, but in my recent trip last week I found the offensive graffiti, 'NO ASIAN PARKING' in the parking garage. I notified the Bartell drug store management to remove it. 
 I've lived in Seattle metro area over 20 years and it was my first time seeing that kind of graffiti.
Middle aged woman called a man â€œGookâ€ and â€œwhere is his maskâ€, â€œhe should be wearing one because heâ€™s killing everyoneâ€
A post on Facebook calling names against Chinese for the virus.

2 incidents within a week. On a subway someone called her names and told her that the virus was her fault. At school (although I don't want to report the school because the Principal would be horrified that it happened in his school) where some girls made gestures about her physical appearance, moved aside, and blamed her for the virus.

my dad's info in the stats
 this happened early march not sure when.
 my father went to get his weekly allergy shot and the secretary told him to put on a mask but he looked around and didn't see anybody else wearing a mask. he was upset but wasn't sure if he knew how to communicate correctly on what to retort.

Location_Incident: Basic exchange store, Ellsworth AFB, South Dakota
Description: Mike is a sale at BX. He was extremely rude to both me and my husband while we want to purchase pistol on March 13, he was throwing a fit like a little kid looking at us weird. Scare of getting infection. Not just one incident , yesterday when my husband went to buy guns he was rude again . It was March 25 and the basic exchange headquarter does nothing about it !!! We will continue reporting
Any_SupportingLinks: March 24 . When my husband went in to get his ordered rifle. Mike was super rude and didnâ€™t prepare the rifle as email said itâ€™s ready. Mike is also rude to another Senior Master sergeants

Location_Incident: 4 Blackwater Trading Estate, Blackwater Way, Aldershot GU12 4DJ
Description: Colleagues at work have been increasingly hostile, shooting me fearful or hateful looks and slamming doors when passing through our office.

Location_Incident: On the Redline in Chicago: between the Jackson and Chicago stops
Description: I was the only Asian on the train and no one would sit next to me. I wasn't carrying a bulky package or wearing a mask or displaying any COVID19 symptoms. The train was so packed that they were not letting people on my car as we stopped.

When I just got out of the car, this man, who looked just like a regular person, kept staring at me when walking pass by me, and he shouted: "fuck China".
 And later on he screamed to the bus that was driving by:"Run over them!"
 And I was stuck with him while waiting for the traffic light, he kept staring at me, and he spit on me after I told him "please don't".

Location_Incident: NOTA: Driving on Dana Avenue, in Cincinnati, OH.
Description: A woman was driving aggressively around me. Though I tried to ignore her, she threw coins at my car. Then, she yelled, "You have the coronavirus!" and three more coins into my car.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have video, but did not post.

Location_Incident: Petsmart at Hampshire Mall, 367 Russell Street, Hadley MA 01035
Description: I was waiting in line to check out and the man checking out was asked to step back to a marker on the floor 6 feet from the register. He started shouting "why me? HE should step back" and pointed at me. It escalated quickly but luckily two of the store managers stood on either side of me and worked to diffuse the situation. The man threatened to punch and spit on all three of us but left without actually doing so.

Location_Incident: Huntingdon Station, East Kensington, Philadelphia, PA
Description: I was walking down the train platform when an elder white male shouted to me, "CORONA! FROM CHINA!" I turned around and told him he was f***ing rude. He replied back, "But it's true though," so I yelled at him to stop talking to me and continued to walk away.

Target check-out line wasn't observing social distancing which made me very nervous. Requested check-out person to enforce social distancing, so she called supervisor. Another customer walked over and said i brought in the virus. Supervisor wouldn't check out my purchases but made me do it.

Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Barred from establishment, Workplace Discrimination
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Barred from Establishment, Workplace Discrimination
Description: I was working Ubereats and picking up an order. When I went to open the door. I was yelled at by a worker at the top of her lungs with the word 'Outside'. However, a man behind me who was white was allowed inside the building and the same worker was being friendly and pleasant to him. There were no signs on the door/windows to indicated that we had to wait in the designated area outside.
I was walking down the street with my friend who is also of Asian decent, and an Mexican guy walked over and said: "You Chinese people spreading the Coronavirus".

Location_Incident: Not really a public park - but on Telegraph Avenue, near Alcartraz
Description: A man in his car gave me the middle finger. I did a double take, but when I looked back he was looking right at me and held up his finger for more than a minute. Over the course of the past few weeks, I've had people look at me and tell me corona was from China, I had someone call me f****g coronvirus asian. I feel scared to walk out on the street, I'm always on edge. This is scary.

Organizational_Affiliation: ACLU, Planned Parenthood ? No Asian org affiliation
Location_Incident: On the sidewalk at Cedar and Shattuck Avenue in North Berkeley
Description: Unstable African American ?gender who appeared to be homeless shouted at me calling me a â€œChinese bitchâ€ because s/he thought I was approaching too closely behind her/him trying to pass. I had slowed down because I realized that my fast walking pace could have caused concern, but it was too late. I turned away and went to a local butcher store (they have sharp knives) where I stayed/shopped then went home. Makes me scared to walk on my own in my own neighborhood but I need the exercise. I will choose a different location for my walks and make sure that I carry my cell phone, sonic alarm, a whistle, and a hiking stick (which I donâ€™t currently need).

Location_Incident: Wells Fargo bank, 10 Chestnut Ave, South San Francisco, CA 94080
Description: The bank teller asked me put my ID on the desk, said" I don't touch your stuff." In a disgusted voice. She looked very irritated and uncomfortable the whole time I was there. I understand her concern, but the bank should let the employee stay home if she is not comfortable around Chinese.
I walked into a classroom (I am an education assistant professor and was observing one my students, who is a PK-12 teacher), and students started saying, â€œCoronavirus!â€ to me.

I was in an elevator with three other people (so four people were in the elevator, including myself) and an older Caucasian gentleman was staring directly at me for quite a while so I started back. He finally decided to ask me, "Where is your mask?" He did not ask anyone else in the elevator.
verbally assaulted, and lurched at. man shouted "you people brought the virus here, go back to china"

My husband came home and found a note taped to our front door regarding racial discrimination and the coronavirus pandemic.
My husband came home and found a note taped to our front door regarding racial discrimination and the coronavirus pandemic.

This incident may or may not have been related to the coronavirus outbreak, but I cannot imagine any other motivation than racism. I was walking towards an area on the metro platform to wait for the train going downtown, when a black woman passing me deliberately stepped into and crossed my path while raising her arm to the level of my head and forcefully pushed my face with her arm. She was shorter than me and I was not in her path--she walked into mine--so clearly she went out of her way to assault me.

I needed to pick up meds for my pregnant wife and waited in line to get into Duane Reade with the current limited occupancy. While waiting, a black lady passing by started yelling at me saying I shouldn't be here and that I was spreading Coronavirus. She went on to another black passer by to say watch out for him and the other person went on to say yeah i know, there are "so many of them." I just stared at them and shrugged it off but FYI, I have been here since I was 3 and am (possibly unfortunately) an American citizen.

Location_Incident: n/a - this happened on a train
Description: I took my morning train to work, as usual. I was sitting by the door. This guy who wanted to get on the train saw me, smirked, and walked to the other set of doorsâ€”for the same train carâ€”and sat all the way on the other end of the train, next to a bunch of non-Asians. No social distancing at all. Tell me: If that racist was really afraid of the coronavirus, why didnâ€™t he go to the next train car over? Why did he sit near a cluster of non-Asians?

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was in line talking with my husband while waiting to enter a Costco to shop, when the man in front of us turned around abruptly and started yelling at me to maintain my distance and saying that I was too close to him - that he could feel me on him and that he would MAKE me back off if I didn't. He made such a scene that the people behind us began laughing. We were holding a shopping cart and he was in front of the cart we were pushing facing forward with his own cart. We were wearing face masks and speaking a mix of Korean and English.

Location_Incident: Local post office in Walnut, CA
Description: The post office posted a sign asking everyone to respect social distancing (6 ft apart) when waiting in line, so my father did so and was approached by a Latino man, who asked why he was standing so far away. My dad referenced the sign, and the Latino man turned to his wife and loudly said, â€œOf course his people would bring coronavirus here, theyâ€™re all dog-eaters.â€ My dad did not reply.

Location_Incident: Burger King restaurant in San Mateo,CA
Description: White female customer was seated with her husband at Burger King eating and as East Asian customers entered restaurant, white customer said â€œI donâ€™t want any Asians near me,last thing I want is to catch the Corona Virusâ€ and white customer got up and left BK. I was witness to East Asian restaurant customers being avoided because of their race.

Submitting on behalf of my friend, Hyuntae Byun: he was walking home from class when a 17-year-old black male punched him, completely unprovoked, and physically beat him. He was hospitalized; his jaw was dislocated, and he has been concussed for a month. Police officials caught the attacker, who admitted it was an anti-Asian hate crime due to COVID-19.

Location_Incident: Baiz Fresh Foods 1858 W Baseline Rd, Mesa, AZ 85202

When I gave the guy my number, he suddenly pretended that he couldn't understand English, even though I asked him for the exact same thing, chicken thighs, that a previous customer had requested two minutes ago, also in English.

Staff at health clinic purposefully kept my mother waiting four hours after her appt. time to just to get her blood drawn, a procedure that takes only a few minutes. She was informed that she was prediabetic during her last visit and had been fasting for more than 12 hours at that time, so it was not only callous but dangerous. They kept her waiting because they didn't like that she brought up concerns with them, a suspicion confirmed when the attending physician expressed surprise when informed and divulged that she'd only received her order five minutes before actually seeing my mother. I have written my senators about this incident.

Asked the only Asian in the market in the produce aisle to go get disposable gloves from the cashier while reaching to grab an item (even though I displayed zero symptoms). Location_Incident: Around 777 Chapel St, New Haven, CT 06510
Description: Iâ€™m a Yale student, I was very sad that this happened. Over the past two weeks I only left my house twice (for grocery), and yet every time I go out, some people on the streets would shout â€œCoronavirusâ€ at me or other Asians. I found it unacceptable and mostly hurtful because New Haven is a college town and majority of the people here are very respectful. I have encountered this several times in the past two weeks. Some people would give me â€œangryâ€ look and hateful stares, but I was not really bothered by that because they didnâ€™t harm me in any way. But some would yell at asians and call us names like â€œcoronavirusâ€ or â€œcoronaâ€. Thank you so much for doing this, I hope our society gets better when we speak up more.

He then Rolled his eyes huffed and grumbled and marched away. I havenâ€™t incurred intimidating or blatant racism since I was a bit younger but I know when itâ€™s happening whether slurs and words are used or not. Location_Incident: By phone at my office located in Austin, TX
Description: My division has been closed down by parent company. My termination date has been set as April 15, 2020. Two other male employees - one white male and one Hispanic male were given more favorable and later termination dates. I was given an earlier one because I am Chinese. I was told earlier in January, 2020, to not travel to the Houston office. The reasons are because TIAA, my employer, is not giving guidance to not discriminate against Chinese because of COVID-19. TIAA is encouraging discrimination against Chinese employees.
I was walking my dog with my husband and a lady drove by, honked her horn, and gave us the middle finger.

Location_Incident: Angelo State University Texan Hall, San Angelo, Texas
Description:
I am a Korean International Student in Angelo State University in San Angelo, Texas. And I'm living with a Mexican American roommate. In the morning on March 27th, 2020, I was on my way back from the laundry room to my dorm room. And I saw that four of papers about coronavirus posted on my room door. That paper was posted by housing staff one paper per each room, which have content about coronavirus. When I saw that, I thought this is the racial discrimination clearly. Because the paper was posted a month ago, but it suddenly happened that day. Also my room was only one like that. 
  So I took a picture of my room door and trynna report this problem. First I showed my room door to RA in our dormitory, and she cognized this is the racial problem and said that she's gonna talk with supervisor about this situation. So I send her a picture of my door and said I'm gonna go to housing office too, she said okay. After that, I went to the housing office to figure it out. I went to one of the staff in the office and just showed picture to her. I immediately recognized this is a serious problem, and grabbed my phone and showed the supervisor in the other room. Then she let me in and said that this is a serious problem and gonna fix this situation as soon as possible. Supervisor said this is a serious problem on campus and will give a strong penalty to who did this. 
  After that, I went back to my room and saw my roommate coming in our room. I asked hime about this situation whether he saw or not. He said that he didn't see that so I show him a picture. Then he said his friend may did that. So I asked my roommate for the information of his friend to contact but he said no. So I asked him to call or contact his friend but he said no neither. I got his name at last, Shane. At that moment, one girl showed up and was waiting opposite room of our room. I asked her it it's Shane's room because I felt like that, she said yes. So we were waiting for him in the hallway. About 10 minutes later, one guy was coming to the room, that was Shane. I said hi and told him about this situation if we did that, he said he did. So I wanna talk about this problem deeply but it didn't wanna talk with me and just said sorry to me roughly. I felt disregarded but trynna talk to him. But he just walked into his room, and I came back to my room. 
  Then, I thought it should be said so I trynna talk to him one more time. I knocked his room and he opened the door so we could talk for a while. During the conversation we had the same attitude that he doesn't wanna talk bout it more, but we changed some world for a short minute. During the conversation, Shane suddenly punched my face and yelled me to get out. I was in panic but I punched back because I felt threat from him. That was obvious threat. During that fight, Michael, my roommate keep holding me and Shane kept hitting me, I tried to break it out. Even he threw everything on his sight to me and I got out of the room. 
  I thought that I should report this situation, so I went to the lobby, but there's nobody. So I came back to my dorm to wait somebody to help. On my way to my room, I felt victimized so much. So I kicked his room door twice, and the door got damaged little bit and opened. There were three people in that room, Shane, Michael, and one girl. I asked him why he hit me and he just told me to get out. And he suddenly pull out the shotgun from his room. I felt so scared and get out the room. And I sent a message to my dorm RA to help me, and was waiting for her in the lobby because I felt so unsafe in my room. And the RA came, during that time, the other sides called the police me as an attacker, then police came to me and I got investigated. During the investigation, I told the officer that this is clearly racial discrimination and hate crime, also fully wrote down the statement as it is. After that, I got detained for a while. 
  I felt so victimized because I didn't even mean to attack him and just wanna talked with him. But he suddenly attacked me. Everybody whom I showed the picture and explained my situation, they all recognized as a serious racial problem and also I behaved very rationally about this situation. This is the clear Racial Discrimination and I am physically and mentally distressed about this situation.
Some customers in Walmart were mocking me for wearing mask saying things like Chinese virus. This made other people laugh along and said that was cute.

Description: I was driving with my girlfriend (also Chinese) and stopped at a crosswalk to let a family walk (father, teenaged daughter, younger son). Description: My husband (who is not Asian) and I were waiting to get into the checkout line at Costco when I heard an employee make a hissing sound (at me) from my right side a few feet away. At the time, I thought she was doing it in jest at another employee on the other side of me and didn't think much about it. When I read a report of anti-Asian discrimination due to the Corona virus later that day, it made me change my interpretation of the incident to the opinion that she was actually directing her hissing at me.

When I was driving out of the smart and final parking lot, a Caucasian male jumped right in front of my car, forcing me to stop. He then jumped onto the front on my door, made verbal gestures, acted like Iâ€™d just hit him with my car.

Description: As I was walking toward two young women to get to my car that was parked across the street from them, I suddenly noticed them glaring intently at me. I was going to smile to them as I continued walking, as I often do when I cross a fellow walker, but the glares were so intent, as though to scare and show me hate, I instead stared back at them with a frown as I walked away and toward my car. I expected this to stop their glares, but it did not. I had never encountered such behavior from strangers along my walking path. Later, after reading a news article about the uptick of emotional and physical assaults agst AAPI, I recognized their glares as a Covid19 backlash.

Approached free sample employee at a grocery store, they physically backed up away from me and turned away from me. When I asked if I could have a sample, they grunted at me and wouldn't even look at me or talk to me. Date/time of incident is approximate.

I've had two Lyft ride requests rejected a few days apart despite having a good rider rating. In 2 years of using Lyft and over 100 rides, I have never had a driver cancel on me until Covid 19 and I don't think it's a coincidence.
i was told â€œget your ass back to korea. or better yet, china.â€ for posting a negative opinion about donald trump

A 2009 pandemic apocalypse film "Carrier" in Netflix's has a racist scene about 18 minutes into the movie: a man was hunted down by a group of men and was shot like a hunted animal. The next day, the protagonist saw the murdered man's corpse, which appears southeast Asian, was hung with a sign around his neck : "Chinks Brought It", implicating the pandemic is caused by Chinese and the genocide is a vengeance. Pandemic related movie is on high demand during this time with people stay at home and watch Netflix, viewer of this movie may develop a sense of justification to perform hate crimes on Asian even lethal ones. Please see if it's possible to contact Netflix in a SUBTLE manner requesting the removal of this film or at least edit out the derogatory scene. Please do not stir up public attention on this movie or the Asian-American community will suffer more discrimination.
Exited a business and on the way to my car a passerby on their phone looked at me loudly and said, â€œAll these Chinese people out here giving is coronavirus.â€

Person named Gary Saxtech in Fountain Valley posted a comment on NextDoor App about going to Costco and seeing lots of people of a particular ethnicity wearing face masks while employees at hospitals don't have these personal protective equipment. He went on to imply that these people are doing something wrong by hoarding the masks and should instead donate them. I knew he was talking about Asians (Vietnamese and Chinese in particular) because Fountain Valley is very close to Westminster, CA and has a large Vietnamese population. I engaged him in a debate because his post was targeting Asians but not mentioning them by name. I told him that these people wearing masks paid a premium to buy these masks and deserve to wear them however they want. The real hoarders are the ones online selling them for $10 each. I told him that pointing fingers at others does not solve anything. It is better to think of better ways to help than playing the blame game. Others proceeded to educate him on his ignorance. He is parading on the net trying to make himself look good by putting down others and telling the world he wants to do a good cause. The post has since been deleted by the site.

Location_Incident: Smart & Final 13110 San Pablo Ave, Richmond, CA 94805
Description: I was discriminated against and harassed at 3 different businesses all on the same day 3/30/20. Starbucks in Oakland 3013 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94611, Safeway in Oakland 5100 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94611 and Smart & Final in Richmond 13110 San Pablo Ave, Richmond, CA 94805. I even called Safeway's Customer Service to report this, the rude unprofessional male agent was nasty and didn't care, and refused to help me, then he hung up the phone on me! At Starbucks I went to buy a drink. I asked the male employee where's the menu? He immediately told me if you want a drink you have to order on the APP. Yet the people who came after me and there were quite a few, he offered several people to take their order directly without using the APP. At Safeway I was yelled at and accused by a Black older Woman at the Customer Service desk. She kept insisting I was lying when the Safeway cashier rang up all my items except one at the incorrect price and she didn't have a clue how to correct her own mistake. After trying to correct her mistakes, now it is 20 minutes standing at the cash register and the line of customers is getting longer and longer. She then gave up and did not know how to correct the prices. She told me to go to the customer service desk. In addition to being yelled at, accused, and humiliated in front of all the customers by the Black Woman, I was at customer service desk for another 15-20 more minutes. At Smart & Final in Richmond CA they have red markers on the floor to stand 6 feet apart. The woman in front of me wasn't even standing on the red mark at all, and there was another guy in front of her. The employees completely ignored these people who were standing there a lot longer than me and never said anything to them and did not harass anyone else in the entire store. I was the last person who walked up to the line and was not even standing there very long and was immediately harassed and yelled at. They sure didn't waste their time with me. A White older female employee who walked by me and the older White female cashier named Jessica, both of them harassed me and both of them yelled at me saying Stand on the red mark! I was standing on the red mark and I didn't say anything back to either one of them and just kept silent. This is getting so out of control three different businesses all on the same day! You have my permission to OUT THESE BUSINESSES TO THE MEDIA, PUBLIC OR SOCIAL MEDIA. Just please don't list or mention my name as I fear retaliation, threats or worse. Thank you for your help.

Description: I usually take my daughter to ride her scooter or roller skate in the parking lot of a church near our home, a church that I attended as a child and that is temporarily shut down due to the pandemic. I've had a few run ins with the director of an unaffiliated preschool (also shut down temporarily) on site, with the first incident feeling like a micro aggression as she insisted on shooing me and my daughter nearly 70 feet away to the other side of the parking lot and told me to keep my distance even though I was already 25 feet away from her. Today was the third time that I've seen her there, and she came out to the parking lot snapping photos of me and my daughter and threatening to call the police if I didn't leave immediately. I believe that she has a personal vendetta against me for not giving in to her first micro aggression, as I've been returning to the lot and also held my ground that day and assured her that anything above 6 feet is an appropriate distance. She has not acted this way to any other families using the parking lot for recreational activities, evidenced by the fact I see many non-Asian families still visiting the lot frequently.
Any_SupportingLinks: I've written a Yelp review about her behavior on the preschool site: https://www.yelp.com/biz/montrose-preschool-and-infant-care-at-cvumv-montrose

Description:

We've walked from our house to the Legion of Honor. My senior citizen mother walks past a parked painter van who tells her "Stay 6 feet away, you bitch!"

Another white guy in his late twenties or early thirties yells at us across the street: "You brought the coronavirus to America. China can suck my fat white dick." I'm annoyed at this point and reply: "Shut up you ignorant prick." He then proceeds to cross our side of the street and throws his ice cream at us. I came across a screenshot of another person's Snapchat story on my friend's story. The racist's screenshot goes "Go back to your country you dumb bitch! Every China person if I see you I will flat out degrade you the piss out of you"! This was disgusting and disturbing to experience and to even witness. I immediately screenshotted the story and posted it to my Instagram stories, tagging the original poster as well, Zach Seiler. As soon as the offender saw what I had shared, he immediately threw even more racist and xenophobic remarks: â€œThatâ€™s right f*** you slat eye gooks,â€ Seiler wrote. â€œGet the f*** back to your poor ass country you dog eating bat munching no good freak-o-lops. God damn zipperheads are ruining my chance at the American Dream. You should be grateful I donâ€™t have a one way ticket to your worthless pathetic country yet.â€
This is completely unacceptable and it is behavior like this that leads to physical assaults! If people think they can get away with saying racist things online, what's to say they will be scared of getting repercussions for beating up an older Asian woman/man. Zach Seiler needs to be made an example for others with the same racist mentality. 
This is a link to an article by NextShark, a leading global Asian news source, that has covered the story: https://nextshark.com/pennsylvania-college-student-racist-dms/

Location_Incident: Harborview Medical Center: 325 9th Ave, Seattle, WA 98104
Description:
Hi there. First off, I just want to say thank you for creating this website and form. I'm submitting this incident on behalf of my 60 year old Korean mother, who currently works at a Deli inside the Harborview Medical Center. Unfortunately I was informed of this incident a week or 2 after it occurred so the time of date of the attack on the form is not accurate. However, I am still submitting this form to help capture the racial attacks that our community has been seeing as a result of Covid. 

The attack occurred when my mother was on her way to work. A tall African-American male was looking at my mother aggressively on the bus. When she got off her stop, the same man also got off and physically attacked my mother on her arm while muttering obscenities about asians and Covid-19. I don't have the details on how he attacked her (i.e. punch, kick, item, etc) as my mother did not see him as he was behind her. From what it sounds like, this man appeared to forcefully "bump" into my mother as he was getting off the bus. This attack left a bruise on my mother's arm for a week. A similar incident occurred on the transit a week after with a different male individual (repeatedly asked her if she was 'Chinese' on the bus), however fortunately, this did not result in a physical attack.
Stranger yelled "this virus is your fault" when I walked by

Location_Incident: Walmart, 150 Barnum Avenue Cutoff, Stratford, CT 06614
Description: I got racially attacked the other day at Walmart when I was surprised to see a line queueing up here in Connecticut where I live. I asked the Walmart employee "hey sir, why is there a line? I was here last week there wasn't a line. What's happening?" Before he could muster a response, a black woman at the front of the line next to this employee said "cause of corona your people bought over that's why!" I was surprised so i laughed and said "wait what?" And by this time the employee said "no, because of President Trump that's why." I then turned to the black woman and said "wait tell me again what you just said to me. My people what?" At this point she must've been surprised my English is good so she said "cause of corona thats why ok?" I said "yeah, you know that everyone is infected now right? Black, white, Latino, every race has got it now. know that right? You're a fucking dumbass." I then walked back into my car and went to another store.

He re-framed question to say my face didn't look like I was from around here. Said he thought Culver City was a white only town. I told him that he didn't seem like he was from around here and that I would call the police if he didn't keep his distance. He backed down and walked away.

Description:
Upon my arrival to the bus stop a hispanic male driver parked at McDonald's immediately began berating me.  I ignored him with the exception of giving a cursory glance (being careful not to provoke him) though it only enraged him.

The bus arrived shortly and when I proceeded towards the rear entrance, an object of substantial weight was thown at me with high velocity -- missing me but impacting the side of the bus with a sickening "thwack."  Instantly I sobered to an awareness in the amount of trauma the object would have caused if it had struck my head.  I turned directly towards him and glared (which gave him a moment of pause) but still he continued to berate me.  I then boarded the bus and left.

I called in the incident and subsequently filed a police report at my precinct station.

I am not an Asian person. I suspect that my firm response to an asian couple cutting in line and getting far too close may have been interpreted as racial discrimination. I had waited for over half an hour at grocery store before it opened, in a line with dozens of others all keeping at least 6 feet between us. When store opened, an asian couple came up alongside me inches away from me rushing to the door, taking cuts in front of me and everyone else, some of whom had waited over an hour. I plainly told the woman she was cutting and getting too close, after which she seemed to be afraid of me. I have observed this same situation numerous times. Cutting in line and getting too close to people may be a cultural thing but it is unfair and will prompt similar rebukes because it is disrespectful to others. It is erroneous for an asian person to misconstrue this as anything other than a fair rebuke. Those from an asian background will foster a more respectful response if they would in turn respect others in their midst by waiting their turn, and respecting the prescribed social distance.

Location_Incident: Palm Springs Aerial Tram (On the shuttle)
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: An older white male, when I sat down next to him on the parking lot shuttle, loudly shouted too all other passengers, "Look the mask people are sitting next to me. I guess I have to sit next to them." Then, he turned to ask why I was wearing a mask. Although he was not spoken in an overtly aggressive or hostile tone, the incident was definitely uncomfortable and scary for myself and those who I was traveling with, and the man's choice to publicly call me out for wearing a mask could have endangered us by inciting others on the shuttle. Fortunately, our's was the first stop, and I chose to diffuse the situation by using humor and wit, and replied, "I'm Batman", to his question of why I was wearing the mask. The point is, I prepared by bringing a mask to a place that traditionally would have crowds of people from different countries and who were traveling as tourists. As someone at higher risk for complications from the virus, I have asthma, I was trying to protect myself, and was also protecting others by practicing mask wearing. Now, I feel unsafe wearing a mask to do my civic and personal duty in this pandemic because I might be targeted, but I also feel unsafe not wearing a mask. The news and media has covered this issue, but very poorly and has given little time in the larger scheme of things to how discrimination due to the virus has impacted the API community in the U.S.

Location_Incident: County of L.A. Superior Court (Stanley Mosk Courthouse)
Description: The incident occurred mid-March 2020 during jury selection. The elderly Caucasian judge called the next prospective juror, an older Taiwanese man, to sit in the jury box (where I was already seated). The judge asked the man what his son did. The man replied in "broken" English that his son had recently returned from teaching English in China. The judge joked, "Well, I hope he didn't bring anything back." The room chuckled and I chuckled half-heartedly, even though I didn't think it was funny. But as a member of the model minority, I didn't want to look like I couldn't take a joke, either. I suspect the man chuckled and smiled for the same reason. He wasn't stupid. He just wanted to get out of there. So did I, after that remark, joke, whatever that was. Fortunately, we were both eventually excused. Most people would consider slights like this to be harmless, but they contribute to the insidious racism at every level of society in this country. These "little" incidents happen every day but they get brushed off by the perpetrators and buried deep by their targets. It's tiring. When will it end? And why were the courts even open while a pandemic was spreading in the U.S.?! I know this story doesn't quite fit the data you're collecting, but it's been sitting in the back of my mind for weeks now and I just needed to put it somewhere. Thanks.

Her name is Lisa Annebro, a Senior Academic Advisor works in hospitality advising center. She called me since I made an appointment with advising center for Course Planning and class permission for Fall. Her voice was not clear due to the location as she told me. She was aggressive when I mention I could have my final test due to the school was closed because of virus. She supposed to help me to figure my out my questions but she was keeping blame me that I should finished my english course which I am taking at BYU 1 year ago, but it was impossible since my class is end this August. When I said the virus delay my final she said I should have the text to be done before virus... How could I know when will the virus start? When I ask how my courses could I have in CSN she said 3 at the first time but when I said the other advisor said there was a limitation like no more than 2 she just suddenly changed her words and said she was not sure maybe 2. After I ask for recording that she said I can how many courses in CSN just in case I would need it for further help in future, and she just change her mind again said she did not know since she did not has my file on her hand. I felt that was ridiculous. I made this appointment week ago she should have my file to help me to plan my course. Then, I said I was confused about internship program she said she will send me the details about the internship but she did not, not even the record about our conversation which should be sent every time after a advisor helped student for course planning at least. She did not even send my course planning to me which was my main purpose for this appointment. After a while I received a phone call that she said she was going to dropping my summer courses immediately. I am so confused how could she just cancel my permission and cancel my courses after I got the permission from advising center via online application. I have my proof of the course I am taking and everything was checked by the advisor. How could she just give me a phone call and said she gonna drop my courses?? She was so rude and disrespect during the conversation and I was literally felt offended. I am totally disagree and offended, there is nothing to do with me and the virus. Having a Chinese name and nationality does not mean that she can be that unprofessional and aggressive with the students.
I received an insulting text message from my client with inappropriate gender and racial terms involved, "......have a nice day bitch ass Asian ho. Thatâ€™s the fucking way I feel about the Chinese."

She was sitting there, when a car drove with 3 young men, they got out of the car, then proceeded to beat and punch her in the face and kicked her in the ribs, and stole her bag. Serious cowards. AndrÃ©s Bonifacio Samahan, the Filipinx/Filipinx-American student organization at San Diego State University was holding board elections over a Zoom video conference with over 40 members who identified as either Filipino, Chinese, or Vietnamese. The call was then interrupted by several anonymous hackers who flooded the call with hateful speech including racial slurs and broken english meant to mock Asian accents. One hacker even saying "All y'all have coronavirus, every single one of you." Multiple other remarks were made pertaining to the coronavirus and its association with Asians. The remarks went on for almost three minutes while the members stood and listened in silence and shock. You can hear the chilling and disappointing silence at the end of the video. Some members also experienced multiple website accounts being hacked into following the call, assuming that their personal information was exposed during the call. Their safe space and and privacy were violated as they were unexpectedly attacked with words.

Ironically, the two physicians and the nurse were born in India.

They got several comments about how it was inappropriate that were deleted and this account had engaged in discussion about how people are too hypersensitive and something about how hypersensitive people have mental issues. Unfortunately I didn't take a screenshot because I was so disgusted and it seems like they have since taken it down. I thought I would report it anyway just to keep it on the record.

Please listen to the attached link from 36:45 onwards. He directs hate towards Chinese people here and in many other episodes. You only need to look at the descriptions of the episodes to see. He also has a channel on spotify and is @joshlecash on Twitter.

Description:
Not sure if this was racially motivated or the guy was just trying to mug/attack me. I was walking my small dog while wearing a bandana and due to social distancing, you kind of make eye contact and figure out who is going to cross the street/move first when you encounter someone else. This guy kinda got in my space instead of cross at a distance, and tried to corral me when I made abrupt movement to get away from him. I couldn't totally hear him, but he was saying stuff like "This is my town, this is my street." I started yelling for help and running away from him. I don't know if this was race/ethnicity related, but even when I called for help and ran away towards another couple with a dog(not Asian), the guy was clearly trying to follow me. The woman in the couple and I ran away and locked ourselves in her nearby house while waiting for the police. The man in the couple had a big black labrador, and neighbors came out due to my yelling, and the attacker still seemed undeterred and cornered the guy. Eventually he ran away. 

 The police were reluctant to take a report because "the guy never threatened you". I think trying to corral me and then chase me for two blocks count as threatening.

I clicked their profile picture (which was a art piece and not a human face) in hopes of reporting them, but the page it led me to no longer existed so all I could do was delete the message and block the user from the FB messenger app.

Description:
My mother and I were shopping at Costco- Roseville (Placer County). I asked two employees (possibly white, male & female) for help and they turned their backs to us. Later, at the self-checkout line, when the machine wasn't working, I asked the self-checkout clerk (white male, bald, facial hair) for help. He immediately said "shit" and looked like he wanted to say more but stopped himself. He ran over, punched in a few numbers, and ran back to where he was standing. This happened too fast for me to even get a sentence out. When we exited Costco, not all items rang up and we were stopped in order to re-itemize the goods purchased and to make a second purchase of the items that didn't initially ring up. We waited a long time for help at the Costco exit. It was embarrassing because it looked like we purposely didn't ring up the items. I did speak with the person who eventually helped us and identified the self-checkout clerk to her. She (white female) apologized to us. 

While we were shopping, my mother and I spoke Cantonese. I made a conscious decision to keep it that way, and not switch to English. We were dressed casually - sweat pants, sweatshirts. My mother has a very small frame. But many people gave her a wide berth whereas they would normally not see her and cut in front of her. This part of the discrimination wasn't so bad. I noticed this when we weren't walking together. Not sure if people gave me a wide berth. Neither one of us had masks on.

Location_Incident: Valley Springs Presbyterian Church - 2401 Olympus Dr, Roseville, CA 95661
Description: I am unsure if there is intentional racism involved. I don't think Covid-19 was a factor. I accompanied my mother to her polling place for the 2020 primary election. When they handed her the ballot, they gave her the wrong one. They had a system of identifying the political party based on a number. The poll worker that verified my mother's name told the poll worker next to her, a number. The poll worker then gave my mother a Republican party ballot. I told her it was the wrong one. She, then, confirmed the number with the poll worker next to her. Then, she went to the bottom of the stack and retrieved a Democratic party ballot. Since they are volunteers, I understand the mistake. However, my mother's first language is not English and she is elderly. Had she gotten the Republican ballot, she would've been confused. She wouldn't have asked for another ballot. Later that day, I asked my mother if she would've asked for another ballot. She didn't say anything.

Description: I had just returned from grocery shopping, parked my car on the block and was getting out of the car to unload. My white neighbor rolled up and parked his car too, rolled down his window, and started yelling that it was â€œtime for you to go live where you belongâ€

I was calm and yelled back a few choice words about his people and the virus. That quieted him down. Then I yelled obscenities at him and drove off. 

I find that most Asian Americans are far too passive and do not fight back. We need to fight back and speak up in the media and when these incidents happen. If we don't, it sets the precedent that this behavior is acceptable. It is not, especially when our doctors and nurses are on the frontline saving blacks and hispanics.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description:
Two separate incidents at Whole Foods San Mateo within one visit on Thursday, April 16th: 

First incident was when I was waiting to be helped at the meat counter at Whole Foods. I waited an abnormally long time to be helped -- there were many employees around, but no one seemed to want to help me. Then, one of the meat department employees went to help a white male, who had arrived after me. I then told them that I was here first; the white male customer was very nice about it, apologized, and stepped aside. The employee however then asks me rudely what my number is. He did not ask the white male customer what his number was before starting to help him. I tell him my ticket number. He then walks over to a non-Asian woman, asks her which number she has, and she then says a number higher than mine. He then proceeds to help her, leaving both the white male customer and I completely dumbfounded. The white male customer then says to me, "Um what happened there? Why is he helping her; what was the point of him asking for your number?" 

Second incident was when I was waiting to check out. A friendly customer asked me which checkout lane I was waiting for, and I pointed to the one on the right. He then said he'd wait for the line on the left then. When he saw that the lane he was in was moving faster than mine, he kindly told me to go ahead of him and he'd take my spot instead. I asked him if he was sure, and he said yes. The cashier then proceeds to yell at me and berate me repeatedly about how rude I was to cut in line, and how line cutters are horrible, and that I need to get back in line. The customer then tells her that he told me to go in front of him. The cashier continues to yell at me that I was so rude and a line cutter. She causes a scene while doing so. 

I've never been yelled at by any retail worker before; this was incredibly appalling. Both incidents left a horrible taste in my mouth and I no longer want to be a customer at Whole Foods when it treats its customers so poorly. I've shopped at this location for three years since moving to this city and no longer want to shop there anymore. 

While neither employee used a racial slur against me, after having mentioned these incidents to my family and friends, everyone has agreed that both were racist incidents because I'm Asian American.
â€œcovid loverâ€ written on vehicle with mustard

Location_Incident: Whole foods, 500 W Germantown PikePlymouth Meeting, PA 19462
Description: the line to check out were all 12 people deep. When my wife and i enter the line no one came behind us even though the rest of the lines were still 12 people deep.

As I jogged through a bus stop on the street sidewalk of140th Ave SE, a person waiting for a bus looked back, saw me running toward him, and coughed up an enormous phlegm just as I was passing. I did not proceed to look back if he spat at my back but ran away to avoid a potential spit.
Doctor and patient were talking about blaming China for coronavirus. After visit was done and patient was leaving the clinic, patient saw me and said, "I'm going to kill you."

I am a resident living in Bellevue Woodridge neighborhood.Since Donald Trump made Chinese Virus comment ,we have a neighbor putting up racist sign on her window(see attached photo link) . We call the Bellevue PD and there is nothing they can do as the neighbor is exercising her freedom of speech and there is no crime that can be filed against racism.
The name of the neighbor is Toni Fimiani (Address:12511 SE 30th St ,Bellevue, 98005) who worked for Law Office Of Michael Fulbright.Address:11820 Northup Way, Bellevue, WA 98005.
When we called her out for her racist banner, she said we have infringed her constitution right of free speech , slandered her as a racist since President Trump mentioned the same thing with no consequence and threatened a lawsuit against all that have voiced out.
She mentioned she worked in a law firm and know her legal right. It has been frustrating dealing with a racist without an avenue to ratify the situation. I believe our incident is not an isolated case in the country as most Asian who faced discrimination are new immigrants who do not know how the law works here since police can't even do anything. I believe many Asian immigrants have been racially abused in the public in this challenging time and can't do anything against their perpetrators.

https://covid19.colorado.gov/blog-the-double-bind This article has racial discrimination against me, an asian, white by saying that only the black and brown people can avoid wearing masks. Also it is also discriminating the black and brown people saying that they look like criminals by wearing masks. This is sick and disgusting. Colorado state government arouse racism.
Verbal harassment by a transient stating that it is my fault that I caused the corona virus for eating bats, and cats.

Location_Incident: West Philadelphia (s 45th St and woodland St)
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description:
My roommate and I (both wearing masks and visibly east asian) were standing on the side walk outside our house chatting. In the 30-45 minutes we were standing there, three white men place a hand drawn trump 2020 sign and then shortly after a Chinese flag. We are a house hold of 4 going asian americans who have bernie signs in our windows and red lanterns on our porch. We live in a progressive university adjecent gentrifying but still heavily POC neighborhood. If this can happen here it can happen anywhere in this city. 
We've had neighborly interactions with them the entire time we lived here and knew about their conservative politics the whole time. They'd worn Trump gear before but the hand drawn sign tells me it was targeted to mess with us. They hung it on their 2nd floor porch but they were all hanging on the street next to us and one was swinging a golf club in the air for no reason

Location_Incident: South Main St & W Bellfort Ave in Houston, TX
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: Not sure if this incident applies, but it happened while I stopped at a red light to turn left. There was a white homeless person on the median who randomly started yelling repeatedly on "how it's our fault for bringing the disease from China" & to "go back to China" even though I was born here & have never been there in my entire life; at the end of every sentence, he would end it with the racial slur "gook." There were 2 other cars next to & behind me so I cannot be 100% positive that he was directing it at me, but he was walking back & forth next to my car; even so, it was hurtful to hear his words while knowing I can't escape until the light turn green.

Location_Incident: Old Ranch Road, San Ramon, CA
Description: I am reporting this on behalf of my husband. He would not want to report it. He was driving on Old Ranch Road in San Ramon after a shopping trip. A person from a car coming from the opposite direction yelled profanity at him. Although it was not exactly clear what the person said, it was very likely that my husband was yelled at because of his race.

White woman was shopping with her young son, who was around 3-4 years old. Boy was running around the produce and meat areas. Upon seeing me (I'm the only Asian in the area--everyone else was either white, black, or Latino), woman yells for her son, runs to him, drags him close to her, and moves quickly and as far away from me as possible.
Any_SupportingLinks: I was texting two friends at the time. I didn't report this and I didn't post this on social media.

Description:
We asked him not to uncover our car, and he said that he was looking at it to make sure that itï¿½s legal; he then said that the car was ugly, and we should just ï¿½go back to Asia, this must be how they do it in the Philippines.ï¿½ This is not the first time he had shouted racial slurs at us but this is the 2nd incident this week alone. We called the police department but the officers told us that this is a he said, she said scenario. But we have witnesses who have reached out to us to extend help and their cell numbers. They said that the neighborhood has a long history of runiins with this same neighbor but the cops doesnï¿½t do anything about it. This neighbor has mentioned that he has guns but the context in which he brought it up was deceptive (he said that he also has guns like us). None of us has one has ever mentioned guns before now. I was unable to sleep last night. 

Can you please help, or direct us to someone who might be able to? Thank you. 

Stay safe.
While waiting for take out, homeless lady tries to sell us stolen good and drugs. We politely refuse and she gets upset and calls us rude Asian Motherfuckers. We are the reason for this.

Location_Incident: Northbound 280 (freeway between Bayshore and Cesar Chavez exit)
Description: Graffiti saying "CHINA LIED", "PEOPLE DIED" on the freeway bridge poles

On Thursday, March 5, as my 12 year old daughter was riding the subway to school, she accidentally bumped into an adult woman. The woman pushed her forcefully with both hands, yelled at her and immediately covered her mouth and nose with her shirt.ï¿½
I was picking up food at a restaurant. Suspect drove by my car and spat on me, luckily my window is closed

I had an appointment at Pearson-Weary Chiropractic Clinic, Spokane WA because I have chronic back injuries from being a firefighter. They canceled my appointment because they were afraid I might have the virus. I had been a patient there previously before the virus pandemic. I have been by the clinic since then and I see that they are treating white people.

I let a Latino cross the cross street but when he saw that I was driving with a mask and as he passed by my car he spat on my car. In doing so I drove next to him to scare him, by pretending to hit him. I wanted to beat him up if I was not married. I didn't beat him up because I didn't want to be sent to jail leaving my wife and kids alone. I didn't call the police because it would be hard to deal with the cop.

Location_Incident: In Target Store at Stevens Creek Blvd, Cupertino, CA
Description: You shouldnï¿½t be here in this country, you bring virus
Any_SupportingLinks: I report to store employees and send email to Target customer service.

Description: Husband and I were walking behind a white woman wearing a backpack and lots of clothes. Because she was walking slowly, we went around her to walk past her and she stopped to look. And she started yelling racial slurs and some unintelligible comments about "people of color" etc. We walked past rather quickly so it was hard to hear what she actually said.

We were walking towards each other on the sidewalk so me and my partner walked towards the street to avoid. The man then got angry and started verbally shouting at us and made some racist remarks about me being Chinese. I think he also had mental health issues.

I sneezed in a Costco during a conversation with a cell phone salesperson. The salesperson stopped, backed away several steps, pointed at me, and yelled, "SHE HAS CORONAVIRUS!" This caused all shoppers nearby to scatter away from me - humiliating experience.

A customer came to order take out, he ordered a dish. As I was collecting his change, he muttered something I did not understand and gave me a handwritten note that included the phrase "you fucking Chinese bastard "
Any_SupportingLinks: I have a photo of the note mentioned above.

Description: I saw a few women harass an Asian man that was taking a walk. It seemed like they were shouting names at him and trying to intimidate him. It ended with the man just quickly walking off, and the ladies giving up on yelling at him after following him a bit.

Location_Incident: Facebook and on the ground in San Jose
Description: Started with use of ï¿½Chinese virusï¿½ when asked about it and advised not to use that phrase because of the attacks on Asians the assailant doubled down and added Kung flu, threats of lawsuit and later on it was relayed to me he has been telling people he will go after me.

Location_Incident: Van Ness Ave and Clay St
Description:
???????????ï¿½?????????ï¿½????????????ï¿½ 
Take the stick directly to me and attack me ... Fortunately, I held the umbrella ... I chose to walk away, she continued to walk towards me ...

An Black driver in a tan color SUV vehicle made an attempt to hit me, but stopped abrupted as soon as I jumped out of the center of his (approaching) vehicle. The faster I try to cross after I saw the driver decided to turn as I was crossing, the more speed he was coming towards me. The driver acted like he was sorry with his body gestures. I wore my yellow vest through my entire shift.
I was walking my dog at night and a car swerved toward me on the sidewalk, two guys started shouting, "Trump 2020, Die Chink Die"
I was riding the elevator and the other riders pulled away from me and glared at me.

I was riding on the subway and I cleared my throat. It wasn't even a cough. A passenger said something disparaging and then moved away from me. it took me a moment to realize that his behavior was racially motivated. This was before people were wearing masks.

I was accused of having the "Chinese virus" by a co-worker after coughing due to my spring allergies, which prompted many colleagues to avoid me for the rest of the day. The co-worker has since been released and relations have returned to normal, but I still can't help but think back to the incident from time to time.
Was hit on the head with a rock

Location_Incident: Hudson Valley Rail Trail parking lot, Highland, NY
Description: I politely said, ï¿½excuse meï¿½ to get the attention of a Caucasian woman and she said loudly with disgust ï¿½Get away from me.ï¿½ When I tried to finish what I was saying she and who I presume to be her teenage daughter said to me ï¿½we donï¿½t have to talk to you,ï¿½ ï¿½Get away from us.ï¿½ Later the woman passed me on the bike trail and said Iï¿½ve called the cops on you. My 8 yr old daughter is very scared. No slurs were used, a small mercy for my daughter at least.
Any_SupportingLinks: I took video of some of the encounter.

Location_Incident: Fournï¿½e Bakery / 2912 Domingo Ave, Berkeley, CA 94705
Description: I was verbally harassed by a white man who seemed to be about 50 something years old when I was walking across the street to go into a bakery. He yelled at me ï¿½Back off!ï¿½ as I was walking across. He also yelled at me to back off when I was outside the bakery waiting to enter once he was out of the bakery. It was especially frustrating and upsetting because I was following all the rules such as wearing a N-95 mask and such, but he wasnï¿½t wearing a mask or anything and yet yelling at me to back off.

My neighbor came to our yard uninvited to tell us how happy she was for the protests in MI. When I mentioned that Taiwan and S. Korea did a good job on controlling the COVID-19 by testing and contact tracing, and I tried to look from a world view since I have families there and monitored different countries, my neighbor got angry and accused me of being obnoxious and yelled at me "if you like Taiwan so much, you should go back to Taiwan!!!"

That one of the granddaughters is 1/8 Native American so she is more of a minority than I am! There was a threat to call my work place to get me fired.

Homeless person made racist comments, then chased me with a stick threatening to hit me.

Location_Incident: St James Roman Catholic Church Pennington NJ
Description: I was interested in applying for a position in church to work with young people to evangelize the faith. I asked one of the parishioners, an acquaintance I met at a knitting class, if she could possibly be a reference and if she could tell me more about the parish, as Iï¿½m registered at another parish. Instead of talking directly and honestly she started interrogating me as if she was a police officer: where do you live, what church do you attend, whatï¿½s the name of your priest, how do you get to that church, what street is the church on what highway what exit how many parishioners are there how many Democrats, the weird thing is Iï¿½ve been a lector at my church for 15 years google my name and youï¿½ll find it on their website and this womanï¿½a religious fanatic and diehard Trump supporterï¿½doesnï¿½t even drive that much she has a phobia of the highway and wouldnï¿½t know the difference between route 1 and I-95 so why should she be the expert on driving but on she goes making me feel like Iï¿½m the devil incarnate and have no business being in her church I felt so humiliated, later I found out from a gay hairdresser who hates her that she is in charge of the retreats there and didnï¿½t want me-a more educated woman of colorï¿½to be in her territory. Then the virus came and the job would have been put on hold anyway, but the point is I should not be made to be in an Inquisition, if she didnï¿½t want to help me just say so , no she accuses me of being a Democrat and that a Catholic canï¿½t be a Democrat and that only Trump supporters truly believe in God!

On Facebook I post my artwork as Iï¿½m a fine artist and freelance writer. An elderly woman Iï¿½ve never met but us a friend of an acquaintance in my knitting classï¿½probably in her 70sï¿½who claims to be a devout Catholic (Iï¿½m Catholic, too) used to always like and praise my artwork, seemed very supportive but then after the disasters in Puerto Rico she started to change and got very aggressive in her comments. I posted something about pray for Puerto Rico and she started posting comments about ï¿½thereï¿½s nothing we can do for these voodoo people just like Filipinos ha haï¿½ but then when someone else posted something similar she wrote ï¿½am praying ï¿½, itï¿½s like she was mocking me, especially after I mentioned that I pray to my patron saint St Rita she wrote ï¿½donï¿½t you know anything about cathechism you go directly to God only pagans ask help from people youï¿½re a typical Trump/hating Liberal mutt artist (when I told my parish priest this he was shocked and said this woman just be crazy Catholics have always asked for saints to intercede) later when I posted a photo of my elderly dad and some mentioned good for you to take care of him this Mean Woman commented oh good for you at your age youï¿½re too old to be a mail order bride ha ha, I swear Iï¿½ve never encountered a meaner person FB and this woman claims to be a devout Christian. Iï¿½ve unfriended her , and while I know this might not sound like a big deal after all I didnï¿½t actually meet her when one starts to be bombarded with such negativity it really can affect your mental health, Iï¿½ve found that FB is one place where Asians are attacked and dumped on.

Organizational_Affiliation: NYU Langone Health, NYU Center for the Study of Asian American Health
Description: My public health colleagues and I organized a live COVID19 information session for parents from the Chinese-speaking community, with a pediatric doctor from a federally qualified health center based in NYC Chinatown (a community partner of ours) as our speaker. Toward the end of the live session, our webinar was "Zoom-bombed:" racial slurs (including "ching chong"), phallic symbols, and nonsensical graphics were drawn on the virtual presentation slides in Zoom, while assailants played snippets of music and yelled expletives, racial slurs, and hate speech ("you guys gave us the coronavirus, f*** you") across the live audio for all to hear. The interruption to our webinar call was traumatic and disturbing to our 135+ community attendees, as well as to my team as event organizers. We have a recording of the full webinar with evidence of this incident and have submitted it to the NYPD and to our institutional communications and security teams.

I entered the subway car and stood in the middle of the aisle to avoid blocked the entrance way as I always do. The passengers seated next to where I was standing looking at me and immediately got up and moved to the exit way. While moving away she glared at me and mumbled about "F*ing Chinese and their viruses. Stay away from me!". Another random passenger agreed with her and said "I don't trust anyone, especially those Chinese". This was early January, I wasn't wearing a mask and I wasn't exhibiting any symptoms of illness --coughing, sneezing or otherwise. I was just trying to get to work on a normal Wednesday morning. I'm used to random strange men saying "Ni Hao" to me on the subway but being chastised purely for my assumed ethnicity from different strangers simultaneously was frightening. I see anti-Asian reactions all the time in Philadelphia but mainly directly to those more traditionally Asian looking. I'm afraid to see how all this is going to play out after America re-opens and I have to take the subway to work again.

Description:
On April 16, around noon, I was walking near my house ( 6th and A street) toward the North on the pedestrian road. Description: My husband (who is white) and I (I'm Filipino) were walking our dog on McGee crossing University Ave. We were both wearing our masks, once we crossed, as the cars passed us, a middle-aged white woman yelled out to me "hey, Wuhan mask!" She yelled it again as the car drove west on University. My husband and I didn't know what to make of the comment, it seemed so stupid. But no matter how stupid it was, I know she was being racist towards me. Someone told me it's called a "microaggression".
Some old black woman, she looking to soon, Don't came to here anymore! you better get out from here now. You are coronavirus! That 'is it to make sick to everybody! Get out from here now!

I requested to the Staff,(Black woman) I said please disinfect for cash register plate. But She said, why I have to do that! Hey, Look!. that's looks likes already cleaning. I don't have do it. That's staff lady told me. I had a taken care by my self on the Cash register disinfect cleaning that's date. I am so sad, and I am scary go to there.

Bar/Restaurant is continuing to post a “Kung Flu-19 Wuhan Wet Market Special” on their Facebook page, which is a barbecue meal. It’s stirring up comments about dog and bat meat. The restaurant is also blatantly stating that they don’t care if people react negatively to this.

they signature my name as ryan C.V.
