Description: I applied Edd online on about April 2020 ,& confirmation number is 29873331. I have been waiting since April 2020 until now without any response. I login online to ask questions many times , but nobody answered me . My friends applied same time with me ,& they received edd already . I am a self employed for Lyft . My business was super slow from March 2 , 2020 until now May 22, 2020 . I made $1,100 a week from February 2020 ,& before that time . However, i am making $5.26 a week to $35 a week . How can i be survive? Federal government had new law for Cares a. to help self employment, but Edd worker discriminated on my race , religion, & they don’t care asian people by they don’t respond anything to me . Edd sent to me just a card for contact to office name : Gurshakti Gill , phone number is : 559-445-5150 ,& fax 916-449-1561 ,& email : gurshakti.gill@edd.ca.gov . I called him more than 30 times without any response. Edd worker is so racist, rude , unprofessional on Covid 19 .

Location_Incident: Montgomery Street in the financial district of San Francisco, CA
Description: While I was walking to work, I was followed, on Montgomery Street, from Market to California Street in SF, at 7:30 a.m. today, by a white male, who was yelling loudly about how I brought the germs and that was why he did not get his dog check. He also yelled false accusations that I took off my mask and spit on him, and he called me a gook. He only stopped following and yelling at me after he realized that I called 911 for police assistance. From beginning to end, I did not say a single word to him, and he was yelling loudly at me, nonstop about many racist and completely false things.
I saw a large sign on someone's front lawn that read, "Make China Pay Reparation". There was also a smaller sign near it that read, "Sorry America is closed. Owner gone nuts!”

A roommate been living with me for couple of years, but thing are more intense when stories stir up relationship between china/US, he would take it out on me. Things are extremely intense before the lockdown began and it gotten for the worse as it proceed. Things like stomping the floor when I'm in the kitchen, literally underneath him or when I turned off all the lights in my room and go to bed. He would literally stomps when walk downstairs and stomps when walk up and keep repeat it many time over. One time he went up to my door and cough, another time he said out loud to my bedroom door when I was inside my room and said "ghetto" and another time he went by my bedroom door and said "Goodnight", but deliberately talking on the phone and making random noises till 3ish AM, slamming his keyboard when playing video game, slam his bedroom door, shut his window loudly. I couldn't take it more than 2 weeks of torture, I then proceed to address him about his anger issues. Everything went smoothly as I thought, but turns out he immediately looking for a new place and moved out within 3 days without telling me till the last day, last hour and just dropped the house key.

Here is the quote from Facebook seller when I made a comment that their items were too expensive, “ sum ting Wong. These prices are very good. You probably buy from ship like dollar general or Walmart. Ma ho wong say you very cheap no pay for rice in her store. She say very bad. You need to stop acting like things expensive & pay $. Bad karma and Buddha say very bad. He not pleased you so cheap . He say vert very bad luck fall on you until u buy from non Asian store & actually pay $. “
Any_SupportingLinks: I would like to include the screen shot of this conversation but don’t have the option to here.

Description: I was standing outside of an apartment complex and a car drove by and shot paint balls at my car and I.
When I requested to keep a distance because this person (white male) came to close to me, he said "What do you mean, you brought this upon us. You are Chinese, right?"

Location_Incident: Edinburgh Street, San Mateo. Cross road Fordham Rd
Description: Middle aged Caucasian woman approached me with her dog. She screamed at me " Yeah, I don't have a mask on! You Communist! You think you can make your own rules! Yeah! Yeah! I don't have a mask on!"

Resident at 1081 was belligerent and racist towards my family while we were moving my little sister out next door. My mom is Chinese, and he came out angry at where we parked and the noise we were making, later saying "This is what happens when you rent out to a Communist from China."

Location_Incident: JFK Drive, Golden Gate Park in San Francisco
Description: I was walking on JFK Drive and a young white man between 18 - 21 was crossing the street towards me. He yelled, “Fuck you, Chink!” His face and body was angry and he directed it all towards me.

Description: Vandalism in Honolulu Chinatown

A black man came across myself and my white (male) friend having a conversation outside the building. He initially seemed surprised to see us, but then came directly at me saying things like "I know what you did. Get out of here" and "Take this bitch out of here" as well as calling us both expletives and giving us both the middle finger. Given that I don't recognize this person, that he specifically targeted me, and that he did not specifically address anything else about us, I suspect that this is Anti-Asian racism.

I was crossing the street with my sister (on my green light) and a car came speeding down the st at me. The driver and his friends rolled down the window to scream at me “go back to Wuhan, China, you stupid bitch!” and drove away while laughing at us. I wasn’t able to grab his plate as I was in shock, but there may be cctv footage from the deli on that corner.

Malicious Zoom Bombers logged onto a Zoom call hosted by the Indian American Forum in celebration of Asian Heritage Month. They screen shared images of "dead Paki" and said obscenities over the speakers, while typing sexual slang on the female host as well as phrases like "MAKE ME CURRY NIGGER" and "HITLER WAS NOT WRONG," "FAGGOT," et cetera. Several local government officials were speaking on the call.
I was walking across the street and a car sped up when they saw me. When I jumped out of the way, the driver yelled out “fuck you” and sped away

Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Other: Repeated rude, discriminatory treatment
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Other: Repeated rude, discriminatory treatment
Description: I live in an area with very few Asians, and at Grocery Outlet, one of the cashiers has been repeatedly rude to me since shelter-in-place started (vs. his observable polite interactions w/ other customers). Wasn't going to report, but happened again for the third time. He's 1) closed the lane when he sees me coming, stands and cleans for 5 mins, then re-opens; 2) counts change very slowly, waits for me to leave even when register is open. If I wait, then he hurls my items into the bag and loudly calls "next" before I'm even done paying. Rude and racist, since I am often the only Asian American in the store. Is there a category for passive-aggressive racism!?

I called a hair salon to make an appointment. The owner and I talked on the phone (her mobile phone number posted on their website) for a couple of minutes discussing what I wanted done with my hair. Then she asked for my name and when I said my first name and started spelling it, she hung up. Note that my name is clearly "foreign" sounding. I called back and though the phone rang, it went to voice mail. I left my name and number but she didn't call back. I called back the next day since I wasn't going to let her off the hook. She remembered me and said that we must have had a bad connection. Sure. That doesn't explain why she didn't call me back.

Coworker (non-Asian minority) said new COVID-19 cases are due to number of Chinese residents because it comes from China to Chinatown, spreading through the air. Asian American (Vietnamese) coworker doesn't disagree. Both have said racist things before (and since), but we work in a major healthcare system so this is not good for patients. I've gotten in trouble for speaking up about previous racial incidents (also against Asians), so would probably lose my job for saying anything here.

Location_Incident: on 38th Avenue near E. Cliff Drive in Santa Cruz
Description: I went to Santa Cruz by myself to surf. As I was leaving my car, carrying my board, a woman (white, prob 50s) rode by slowly on her bike. She said "we don't want you here" loud enough for me to hear.

Organizational_Affiliation: City and County of San Francisco DPH
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: During a job duty to conduct a wellness check and psychiatric evaluation of a African American teenager at their home, the African American uncle accused me of saying things I did not say (as witnessed by my colleague) ie., they accused me so saying that his mother did not care about the teenage girl. I was wearing a N95 throughout the process. The man openly called my name very loud, labelling me as "disrespectful" and inferring me as "a racist." He told me "to go back to where I come from." He intimidated and coerced me to go back to his house to apologize to his mother with respect. I was caught between two black man as a petite Chinese woman wearing a face shield and a N95 for PPE. I developed panic attack symptoms as a result. Hope we can do something about this kind of racism in America besides reporting them only. I am willing to be part of this process by my reporting this as a health care worker.

I took this angry old man’s basket away after checking out his items, and as I was grabbing it to put it behind me, I believe he told me in a very low voice, “don’t bring anything back,” as referring to the virus. I wasn’t even sure if I heard him correctly, and it didn’t really register yet so I just laughed it off.

Location_Incident: Grocery Outlet/9026 E Valley Blvd, Rosemead, CA 91770
Reason_Discrimination: Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was walking back to my car with two bags of groceries and I was wearing a mask. A man in a green large suv parked near the entrance, sitting in his driver seat, starts to PURPOSELY cough at me. It wasn't until I reached my own vehicle, that it registered to me through his method of coughing, that he was doing it on purpose. I don't think he would have done it if I was a man.

Driving on the highway, and the truck in front of me had a large sticker on his rear windshield that read "Fck China". I've never been to China and this wasn't necessarily directed at me, but seeing people so comfortable with putting that thought out there is making me feel unsafe in public as an Asian person.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have a video clip but it's grainy

Location_Incident: crosswalk near Fort Lee High School in Fort Lee, NJ
Description: While walking across town, noticed a car following me for several blocks. Thought nothing of it until at a crosswalk, the car pulled over revealing a white women who yelled that she'll run me over when I walk across the street. Had to seek shelter at a nearby building for around 15 minutes before the woman finally drove away

The building manager's (John) wife, Fran, and a friend/neighbor were discussing a matter that happened in the hallway involving my children. When she referred to my 5 yr old daughter, she said, the Oriental girl, in response my friend said, that's racist, and she said, "It is not." I was very upset when I heard that the building manager's wife used a demeaning word to describe my daughter, I wrote an all building post (which I knew it would not be approved to get posted), to show all who read the post (building manager, and Gina, rep of AKAM, the management company) how serious and furious I am. The post was not approved. Instead, at 10PM, I got a visit from John at my door and started off by saying, "I apologize if you felt that Fran was being racist, but the word Oriental is not racist. If it were racist, why is there a restaurant called Oriental Garden?" and he continued to yell at my doorstep, waking up my children and scaring them. Eventually Fran came up and apologized and during the apology, John continued to yell and I asked Fran that he needs to stop talking then John left. There is also an email that was sent by John/Fran mistakenly that also said that Arnie (Board President) who is a Long Island Legislator, said the word is not racially motivated but politically incorrect. How is word that was banned federally and state few years ago, not considered racist? The following day, I waited for AKAM to contact me since they are the one who deleted my post. I requested a written and signed apology from John/Fran and AKAM (after few emails going back and forth) decided that enough apologies were made and this was a closed case. I contacted AKAM and someone from the marketing dept asked for my info to elevate this to another. I have yet to hear from anyone from AKAM. I feel that this incidence is being brushed off and it saddens me this happened in my own apartment where I am supposed to feel most safe. 

On a completely separate incidence, the next day while crossing the street on 37th Street and Third Avenue with my children, a caucasian male in his late 20s/early 30s passed by and said, "Thank you for Covid"

This is impossible to do in 2-3 sentences. My 14 year old Chines Born daughter was racially and verbally attacked and felt threatened at Lowes. She was called the Chinese virus and laughed at by two white men late 20's. She is so shaken up she is afraid to leave the house again and go into the public. This was her first time going out since the quarantine.

Description: I was running along the Pier 15 (Seaport area near Financial district), when a biker purposely rode his bike into me and called "you Wuhan chink!" in my face. He then rode off and sped away.

I am a supervisor at Magic Fountain Long Island, an ice cream shop. During a shift, I was asked by another employee to resolve a check issue with a customer. The customer refuses to pay for an additional scoop of ice cream she requested because she was inconvenienced by the wait. After I asked her politely to leave, she hurled many racist remarks and profanity towards me.
Any_SupportingLinks: Since she paid with a credit card, we have her full name. We also have surveillance footage of the incident.

Description: I was given speeding ticket for driving at 83mph. I don't think I was driving that fast. What I am sure are there were many cars overtaking me a couple minutes earlier on the freeway, and there was a car driving very fast behind me right in front of the site on incident.

I was sitting inside the bus when a man (black race) came on the bus. Just as when he passed by me at the aisle I sneezed but I had my mask on. The man started cursing at me saying I was Chinese and I was carrying the virus.

I was waiting at a red light on a 2 lane street and a man was also waiting for a car in the opposing direction. My window was rolled down and my face was visible as my mask was off. I heard a loud cough and a laugh as the man had targeted me, and I told him that he was nasty.

Circa 2:30pm around the Embarcadero Bart Station along Market St., a white male walking the opposite direction changed his course to deliberately veer his shoulder into mine. I was on my daily routine of walking for exercise to the Ferry Building and possibly beyond. As he did so, he then postured himself and arched toward me while shouting "You fucking chinc!" before continuing to walk away. A bystander on his way to BART headed for Oakland witnessed the assault. He asked if I was ok. I assured him I was. He then pointed toward the direction in which the assailant continued to head. I then changed course to find and confront him. When I did, I had my cellphone camera running. I vocally recapped what the assailant did and said to me. He was apologetic, regretful and tried to cover his face as I relayed that there was a witness to his unprovoked and aggressively hateful conduct. He then begged for me to get away from him and eventually rescinded into the Embarcadero Station to hide. Prior to the departure of the witness/good samaritan who was in a hurry to commute, I asked for his contact information. He willfully provided it. I also asked if he was willing to speak to the media. He asserted yes and gave me permission to provide his contact information to any member of the media who so requested it.
I got in line behind a lady at Safeway. I was 6 feet away. She began to yell get the F**k away from me over and over. She then push her shopping cart into as had as she could.

Location_Incident: The Pyramid Group, 45-07 40th Street Long Island City, NY 11104
Description: We were looking at an apt listing from this realtor, David Michael at The Pyramid Group in Queens, NY. During our call to find out more, he become increasingly hostile and aggressive, to which we decided not to do business with him and he agreed stating he would not do business with us, calling us racial slurs and said we were the reason why the US was in war with China.

I was at an avalanche training and two young white men described to an instructor how they are from LA and now live in Oakland, so they are used to living around large Asian communities and are ready to deal with the increased risk of the virus as a result. (could classify more as micro-agression than direct agression)

A man got out of his vehicle to yell at us “thank you and your family for your service for coronavirus” along with some other colorful obscenities. My family (myself, my husband, two kids under the age of 4) were walking along Sloan Lake when this occurred. My husband yelled back ”You should thank us for our service in combat” so the man decided to go back into his vehicle.

Description: I crossed Divisadero Street on Geary heading toward the Embarcadero when a black man holding a golf club came out of a corner "scuzzy looking" building already fuming and looking directly at me. Being hard of hearing, I did not readily understand the moment but continued walking my path along "his" building on Geary, still hearing his ranting sounds. Because I could not get a sense of his distance from hearing alone, I turned and looked back when he was already meeting me at thirty feet and closing. I faced him at my tracks to hear him out. He spatted as he approached me and stopped at a good five feet away while his golf club had a far longer reach. He said to get the fuck away from me and I said, "What?" turned and walked away. Surprised he did swing at me from behind.

Location_Incident: Outside the New York Times building
Description: This man, suspected to be homeless (non-coherent), went out of his way on a busy street to sneeze on my face as I walked by. The whole left side of my face was wet.

Description: I encountered this Caucasian woman 4 occasions while jogging near my house. First encounter she yelled profanity about mask. Encounters 2 and 3, she used "bitch" and "fuck" when she recognized me. Fourth occasion, she came up behind me, removed her face bandana, coughed onto me. I let her pass me on the trail, then she coughed again on my daughter and husband who were walking ahead of me. I never respond to profanity. On fourth occasion, we called Presidio Park Police.
I was jogging on the sidewalk near my neighborhood when a truck rolled down a window as it approached me. The passenger threw a cup of coffee at me (ironically, from the coffee shop I work at).
middle age man pointing at me say "Wuhan, Wuhan" repeatedly and muttering "i can come get you if i wanted to"

Description: Told to "fuck off home to my own country and take my virus with me". I ignored them.

Location_Incident: Cannot say for fear of retaliation
Description: I witnessed several individuals saying things to each other about “how Asians are intentionally spreading the virus” and “the reason why the Chinese keep getting all these plagues such as SARS, MERS, and COVID-19 is because they are filthy people that sleep with pigs and eat bats”. They were discussing these radical and racist ideas very loudly as though to be heard by all they could. When I defended Asian individuals no matter of nationality to them, they yelled and screamed at me saying things like “If you like China so much then you and your wife get tickets and move there! Get your tickets now! Go today, today I said damn it! While pounding on the table.”
My 5 year old son was cursed at and called a racial slur by an elderly lady at the grocery store when he was with his aunt buying vegetables for dinner.

I was taking my evening walk. It was little windy that evening. I was walking on the road, in front of a private property (House). An old man started yelling at me "Go back to your country bitch. Stop spreading the virus here. I want you out of my Country..." I am very much scared after that i stopped going for my evening walks in that road/ area.

Description: This site is promoting hate based on nationality
Screamed at while getting mail with accusations of causing the virus and told to “move” and “go home.” Same family also threw eggs at my home and wrote “move” on my windows

A large unleashed dog jumped on me. I told the 2 female owners to leash their dog. The females said, "Fuck you bitch." And "Go fuck yourself." I did not respond in kind. Then the women called the police and stated I "threatened and attacked them." This occurred before Coronavirus era, but I did not know where to report this. I was too stunned to record on my phone, so I hope you will document this racist false police reporting. Thank you.

Location_Incident: Costco, 15300 West Grange Rd, New Berlin, WI
Description: Costco cashier admonished me for putting my membership card on the conveyor belt yelling "we don't do that here"! I had sat it on top of a large item which I first put onto the conveyor belt ,while I unloaded the rest of my items. The conveyor belt, controlled by the cashier, started to move before I could retrieve my Costco Citi-card and finish unloading the items onto the conveyor belt. I politely tried to explain why the card was on the conveyor belt but was immediately interrupted with further berating. He deliberately wanted to be dictatorial, and glared at me while he scanned my purchases .Proceeded to give me a disgusted facial expression while shoving the receipt at me. Appalled and stunned, a few seconds lapsed, and then I nicely said "thank you" and then waited for him to say the same. He could not be professional enough to thank me for my business. Rather, glared at me even more aggressively. He also tossed my purchases carelessly into a box using the soapy fragranced dishwasher container to smash my berries. I did observe that he did not treat the other customers rudely during their checkout time . This cashier also helped to unload the other customers items from their carts onto the conveyor belt. I was left to fend for myself. I am 100 pounds, 4'11". The other customers were Caucasian, ranged from 5'10 and up, of average weight or overweight.
Any_SupportingLinks: called Costco headquarters in Washington state to report

Description: Screamed at while getting mail with accusations of causing the virus and told to “move” and “go home.” Same family also threw eggs at my home and wrote “move” on my windows

My husband (Chinese-American) and I were walking on the street. When a man wearing a bandana with a child was walking towards us. As he passed by us he purposefully took of his bandana and coughed in our faces while smiling.

Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: A man physically attacked me while I was crossing the sidewalk on 5/27/2020 in Washington, DC. As he was aggressive moving towards me, he said "you're murdering people" and proceed to physically come at me, going for my head and knocking my hat off in the process. I fought him off and screamed for help. There were tons of people walking around me. It was a busy street with all the shops and grocery store. No one came to my assistance. I urgently called the police and I ended up pressing charges. The DC police were incredibly unhelpful, unprofessional, acted as if reporting and pressing charges was an inconvenience to them, the police officer spit on the floor as I was giving him my statement and raised his voice when he said he couldn't hear me because I was still wearing my mask. DC police were insensitive to the situation and scoffed when I brought up the rise of Asian hate crimes.

I was on the bus on my way to a job hirung and a latina female started saying "coronavirus" to me in a racist chinese accent. I told her to "stfu" , then a black male sitting next to her got up and hit me in my face from behind and proceeded saying racist things. Then as I walked off the bus he kicked me in the back.

He did not say anything to me but simply sprayed with Lysol or some sort of cleaning product until I got to the checkout line. He did not follow any other customer while I was there.

Description: Was going there to buy essential items, and saw there was a long line. I noticed there was a shortage of shopping carts, and was lucky that the people who let me have their parking space, were holding the cart for me to use after. I proceeded to the line to enter the store, and immediately everyone around me was distancing themselves more and tried to form a new line skipping me. I verbally spoke up that hey, I'm in line. And this drew the start of verbal assaults and old Asian couples chose not to come to my aid. Manager was called to my spot in line, with people saying I had cut in line. Manager said I needed to go to the back of the line or leave. I explained that I was in fact in line, and I am a Costco member. He didn't want to hear it and said he would call the cops. I didn't want anymore trouble, so I went next door to Home Depot and was in and out of the store in 15 minutes and left.

I returned an to-go order because it was not my order matching up my receipt. The female fastfood worker first said she will return it until I said I touched the wrapper of 1 burger then realized it was not mine. Then she rationalized that I touched the brown bag and the food with no gloves loudly. A Caucasian had the same case few months ago, nothing was like mine.

I was treated like I was invisible at the front of the farmers market and I had a mask on. The volunteer "security" did not say anything to the 2 Caucasian women who were blocking the entry and socializing in front of me while I was trying to maintain social distance. But the volunteer security told whomever was blocking the 2 Caucasian women to enter further into the market to allow visitors to come in.
A coworker advised another to avoid interacting with Chinese nationals while on vacation. Following these instructions would help mitigate COVID19 infection.

I was stopped by a farmers market volunteer playing security for not wearing a mask as required now. I felt discriminated against because farmers market visitors had a mix of no mask and with mask on. The volunteer security allowed other visitors from other races to buy masks from other vendors due to pricing meanwhile I had to mask from a vendor upon entry. I was spoken loudly against, too in comparison to others.

The cashier, Celso, at Smart and Final Extra on Prospect Road in west San Jose suddenly yelled at my wife for no reason when she picked up a package of hand wipes and asked her to put the merchandise back. My wife said to him that she was going to buy the wipes with other items. Celso quickly pointed to the door and told her to go, which ended our shopping at the store. What a racist attitude!

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: In an affluent neighborhood on a Saturday morning, I was driving down a two-way street that would normally be super busy on a weekday. But it's quiet due to the pandemic. I proceeded to move left into the turning lane to turn left on a major street, one with lots of neighborhood shopping centers, a tennis sports center, and a community college. Once the light turned green, I turned left with the intent to stay in the left-most lane, but glancing in my rearview mirror, I noticed a car following me as close as you can get. To get out of the way, I moved to the middle lane - and the car did the same but was right behind me and in my mind, too close. Angrily, the driver of that car behind me moved swiftly to the right lane and proceeded to yell obscenities while keeping pace with my car. I immediately moved safely away to the leftmost lane preparing to make a left turn or U-turn while he shouted "gook!" and other obscenities over and over again. When I saw that he continued driving on ahead, I thought I was safe and I moved back to the middle lane to proceed down this major street. He slowed down the pace of his car again to meet up with me and continued shouting while hanging out his driver's side window. SO I again moved safely away to the leftmost turning lane. He finally made a right turn into a local shopping center. I wanted to take a photo of the car/license plate but couldn't do it fast enough. Yes, I am angry because that behavior is a demonstration of ignorance. Yes, I felt threatened.

While I was using the restroom at an Olive Garden restaurant, a male customer appeared intoxicated and was laughing. When he saw me waiting after him to use the sink, he said to a young adolescent, who appeared to be with him, "let's get out of here before we catch Coronavirus".

My 14 years old daughter, who hasn't traveled anywhere since last summer got criticized for bringing coronavirus to the U.S. by older high school female who lives in the same townhome property. She yelled to my daughter, "You brought coronavirus to this country!" and spitted on my daughter.

My supervisor, dean of the enrollment services, at the college I work and study told in our department zoom meeting in front of everybody that she ordered some merchandise recently and it came directly from China and she's throwing it away because she doesn't know what is on it and disgusted. She showed the thing that she order to everyone and said, "It came directly from China. I even don't want to touch it! Yuck! It's so gross, you don't know what's on it. I'm throwing it away "

Location_Incident: Robert Eagle Staff Middle School / 1330 N 90th St. Seattle, WA 90103
Description: (This happened right before Seattle started quarantine) When my daughter was chatting with one of her teacher in her middle school office, her teacher (white-American) started to cough and told her that she has a seasonal allergy. One of the administrator (white-American) immediately yelled from her office, "xx! Are you the one coughing in the office!!" in intimidated manner. Her teacher answered back "No! It's me coughing". There were many other people in the office when this happened but my daughter was the only Asian there. She came home very upset for being publicly discriminated.
Neighbor in the app referring to COVID-19 as the "China Virus" in retaliation of learning that China accused the US for starting the spread of the virus. Source of his statement is unknown.

My neighbor was unloading his truck when someone drove by, shouted something, and shot him in the back with a BB gun. My neighbor is shaken and bruised but otherwise okay. I am not sure if it was a racist attack, but my neighbor is Chinese and the person was a non-Asian person of color (maybe Latino?). The neighbor didn't want to report anything to the Sheriff's Office because he wants to stay anonymous and doesn't know if reporting will do anything.
I was shouted at -- "You Chinese started all this shit!" (referring to COVID). Raised a fist to threaten striking me.

I locked myself out from the apartment and the front desk yelled at me. He really raised his voice and this scared me from going back home actually. This guy used to be gentle before the Covid19 incident, somehow he stopped respond to my greetings and this day he yelled at me rudely. I can't link it directly to Covid19, but his rudeness was to me only because he still seems friendly to other residences here (white). I wrote to the apartment but no response at all, and then I realize that I was so helpless when this happened. There is no association to protect us at all

Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Workplace Discrimination, Hostility, assumption that I'm not clean or practice good hygiene
Description: I work(ed) in Borough Park, Brooklyn, at a medical clinic serving the predominantly orthodox Jewish neighborhood. Starting in January (a couple of weeks after the initial reports from Wuhan), patients (approximately half) would regularly look stunned/horrified/angry that I was in the exam room accompanying the physician (I have zero direct contact with patients), ignore me when I spoke to them in order to find someone else to help them, make wide circles around me/other AAPI employees (and not the other non-AAPI workers), a nurse expressed anger at me for coming in to work with a runny nose (due to allergies - before any guidelines advised to watch for this), and a few patients (some angrily) asked the provider if it was safe to have me in the exam room with them, although we showed zero symptoms. My supervisor (who has been working to the point of exhaustion for months, now) informed us in mid-April that the clinic was reducing hours (which it was), so our hours are now reduced. However, currently only non-AAPI have returned to working regularly on-site since May, despite my desire to return to work. The date and time submitted for this report reflect my current time (because I'm currently unable to return to work).

Location_Incident: In front of Boston Symphony Orchestra hall on the Massachusetts Avenue exit.
Description: 2 middle aged white males (looked like they worked in construction) walked by me and one muttered under his breath, of course typical classroom bully style, “fucking Muslim”. I was completely calm and just walked on in that situation because I initially thought he said Mulan!! That’s how my brain made sense of it at first, which I thought was funny because that would be a compliment! Then a block later I realized he said Muslim.... it makes me sad that some people hate Muslims that much.

A Korean man was beaten on a California bus by people who feared he had the “Chinese virus”.

Several hand-written messages with phrases that demonized and dehumanized China, blaming Chinese people for the Coronavirus, were placed on the outside walls of a vacant business building, sidewalk, and public trash can. Messages were on slabs of cement and red duct tape. Sometimes the messages were updated. Even after being removed, whoever wrote these messages continued to replace the old ones. The police were notified via non-emergency line. I am unsure of any response they have taken. Also, this is the building literally next to my apartment building.

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment, Blamed continuance of future pandemics and "Chinese and Japanese who will continue to eat wild animals"
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment, Blamed continuance of future pandemics and "Chinese and Japanese who will continue to eat wild animals"
Description: I don't know if this qualifies for reporting in this data collection exercise, but I'm submitting it in case it does qualify. I was on a teleconference with 30 other people from across the country. I have no reason to believe that the instigator knew that there was anyone Asian on the call. We were discussing the possibility of another pandemic, and he said that we would continue to have them in the future because "Chinese and Japanese people will continue to eat wild animals" in effect, blaming pandemics on Chinese and Japanese people and also judging the food that people from these cultures eat. A lot of people eat wild animals -- deer, geese, duck, all of these are hunted by Americans regularly and eaten. But they insinuation by his statement is of course, that Chinese and Japanese people eat EXOTIC wild animals and that is the reason for the pandemics (which it is not).

Location_Incident: Cheery Kids Tutoring Center: 32651 Alvarado Blvd, Union City, CA 94587
Description:
I work at a tutoring center with mostly Chinese American kids. This 2nd grade student (half Chinese/half Caucasian) tells another student (full Chinese), "He has the corona virus!" I intervene and ask her, "What are the symptoms of the corona virus?" And she stayed quiet. I then told her, "He isn't showing symptoms so he doesn't have the corona virus." 

Occasionally the 4th and 5th graders jokingly say other kids have the corona virus. I then created a lesson plan on the racism that's happening to Asians/Asian Americans and had students create action plans on what they should do to combat racism.

Type_Discrimination: Repeated calling East Asians "model minorities," racial antagonism
Description: Had to read and give feedback on a classmate's essay. The narrator expressed great anger at East Asians, dismissed anti-Asian harassment, said that Asians were wrong to complain about covert racism when overt racism is killing Black people, said that Asians are wrong to complain that other people of color don't show solidarity, and called all her East Asian co-workers "model minorities." The piece culminated with "it felt as if their gaslighting might progress so far as to allege that me calling the panelists model minorities might have even been considered an anti-East Asian hate crime!" It just felt like a lot of racial antagonism, and I didn't see either what the narrator was doing to support either Black or Asian communities - both racialized and under attack, though in very, very different ways. PS The narrator is a high caste South Asian, so I have no idea if this is internalized racism and self-hatred, inter-ethnic conflict, or anti-East Asian sentiment.

Type_Discrimination: Denied normal rights and extorted by Illinois State Police & towing company

I was denied usage of my phone, intimidated, subject to an illegitimate 'probable cause search', ordered to remain in a police cruiser for at least 5 hours, and forced to pay $3,875.00 to a towing company in order to get my truck back. All of my documentation & freight was in good order; no infractions or violations noted. My race/ethnicity & language skills contributed to this treatment.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have documentation from the incident (vehicle inspection, tow report, towing company receipt)

Description: I was walking one of my dogs last night and saw a man approaching so I put my mask on. When our paths crossed he said something I couldn't understand, as he was wearing a mask. My dog was barking at him. He kicked my dog and told me to shut my dog up and then spat at me, saying 'take your disease that's ruining our country and go home.'
Threw glass bottle at friend while putting her baby in the car and yelled "go home chink"

After my family and I walked out of the east entrance of the Northrop Hall and headed toward the "the center of the universe", we met this group of three people, including a young woman with a backpack, an older man and a younger man with a dark T-shirt. The younger man pointed and yelled at us with a threatening tone: are you fxxx Chinese? You brought the COVID here! Go back to your fxxx country!

An older white man was walking in the middle of the sidewalk, so I moved into the street and walked right next to parked cars to avoid coming within six feet of the man (the street is wide enough for cars to safely drive around me and there were not many cars driving on the street). The man shouted to me, "I don't have the virus! You don't need to walk in the middle of the street. Stupid, paranoid Chinese." I am not Chinese. I was wearing a sun hat with a wide brim, sunglasses, a long-sleeved top, long pants, gloves, and a face mask that fully covered three quarters of my face, so it was impossible to see my skin color or tell my ethnicity from six feet away. As I am younger and am much more likely to be an asymptomatic or pre-symptomatic coronavirus carrier, I try to stay far away from more vulnerable older people; it is too bad that the older man did not think that I moved into the street out of consideration for him and felt the need to make a mean, racist comment - in a city where about 21.4% of the population is Chinese.

On June 19, I was walking with my two family which includes two kids around my neighborhood. At this store called Jackie Robbins Leather + Jewelry, it predominantly displays marketing and merchandise that says “What’s Made In China Stays In China.” We took photos of the items and signage on the sidewalk and shared it on a private City of Burbank Facebook page to ask our neighbors if they see/saw a problem with this as it hurt my family. Jackie reached out in the forum and accused our family of trying to take down her business. As we live around the block, we felt it was more appropriate to raise the concern and hopefully she would at least take down the blatant racism at her store and on her website. Her friends have contacted us and said she is just being patriotic but she’s been rude since we’ve called this incident out. We’ve called this our to the Burbank City Council, Magnolia Park Board, Burbank Human Relations Council, and her landlord whom plan to reach out to her as well. Her yelp reviews also cite this.

I believe that our board president spread the rumor that I had covid-19 based on my race after overhearing that I had been sick in January.

Description:
I was crossing the intersection when an older white woman stopped abruptly, moved as far from me as possible, and GLARED at me in the cruelest and most disgusted way possible. 

I hadn't left the house in a week, and a week ago, no one was wearing a mask out on the sidewalks in my neighborhood. I didn't know we were all required to wear one on the sidewalks now. She wouldn't have GLARED in such a disgusted way if I were non-Asian. 

I always get singled out for the rudest, crudest treatment. If it were a non-Asian who didn't know and wasn't wearing a mask on the sidewalk, she would've just ignored them, or politely and warmly told them that the rules changed, and it was ok if they didn't know. And the fact she stopped abruptly, moved away from me and simply GLARED without talking to me like a human - meant she thought I didn't know English, when my English is probably far better than hers. 

These kinds of microaggressions, extreme rudeness, and "singling out" towards me has been happening to me everyday LONG before coronavirus, so it's long-running hatred and disgust towards Asians/Chinese. 

It's shameful this abuse happens in city that's supposed to be so progressive, diverse, and enlightened. And it's in a city with 1/3 Asian and over 20% Chinese. We're punished, hated, looked down upon, and discriminated against in many ways, though we've been instrumental in making this the "world-class" city that it is throughout its history. 

Please contact me so we can talk more - I'd like to get a resolution in some way.
Any_SupportingLinks: The City can probably provide video footage because it was at an intersection w/traffic lights.

Location_Incident: Green Apple Books on the Park (9th betw. Lincoln & Judah)
Description:
Right when I went in, the young woman at the register shouted to me, "HEY, GO BACK AND READ THE SIGN!!" in the rudest and most disgusted way possible. Non-essential stores had just reopened, and it was my first time leaving the house in a week, so I didn't know we had to put sanitizer on our hands at the entrance before going further into the store. She definitely wouldn't have shouted at me so curtly and cruelly if I were non-Asian. If you look at the way she acts to every person who comes in without putting on the hand sanitizer, she'll be much nicer to some people than others. 

There's also always the assumption that I don't belong in such a store or environment - a bookstore, hip, intellectual, trendy - when I've been a Green Apple customer since my teens, when they had their original location in a different part of the City. There's also the assumption that I don't read (in English) and that I'm not a "reader" type - because people think only white people are that type. 

Everywhere in SF, I've gotten singled out for extreme rudeness and condescension long before coronavirus, so it's long-running hatred and disgust towards Asians/Chinese. I've suffered from rude, cruel treatment for a long time now. And I've seen employees everywhere in SF single out other Asians/Chinese for rudeness, too, while being warm and kind to non-Asians right before or after them.
Any_SupportingLinks: They probably have a video recording because it was right inside the front door/entrance

I feel like I have to wear a mask and sunglasses so people can't see my face/eyes...so that I can feel comfortable without being identified. I certainly feel like I've been experiencing racism since Covid started.

Location_Incident: Between Centre Ave. and S Aiken
Description: I was walking back from work and started crossing S Aiken Ave. on Centre Ave. at green light. I noticed a man yelling from a car that was wailing on the traffic light to change. I wasn't originally paying attention but started hearing words like 'coronavirus' and 'China' so I realized he was probably yelling at me - although I'm not a Chinese, there was nobody else crossing the road in front of him at that time and I've had a handful of experience that some people automatically conclude I'm a Chinese just by how I look. He accused me of bringing the virus to the US but I kept walking away from his car. I wasn't physically hurt but decided to report the incident. I suspect that he decided to target me because I was walking alone at that time and am only a 5'1" tall woman. I told the story to my Chinese colleague (also a woman) and recommended her to avoid walking alone and late hours as much as possible. I've been living in the US for about 15 years and I've had some racist comments once in a while, but this was the first one related to Covid-19 and from a complete stranger.
I was walking to get groceries in my own neighborhood and an elderly white male called me Asian flu. He laughed and called two times.

While I was walking on the street with a face mask on, a black male threw food (bread crumbs) behind me to my head. I was shocked and turned around and he shouted to me. A few pedestrians saw what happened.

A black guy staying in my place through Airbnb in January sent a message with the contents including my culture brought in the "virus". The main reason I think of the insulting message is because I left a bad review of him for ruining my guest bathroom.

I am responding on the behalf of my mom who told me the incident. While she waited for the bus, a big white man poked her in the chest hard, using his fingers in the shape of a gun. When my mom screamed, he kept walking.

Today, at my local Walmart, and met my first KarenI was squatting down trying to look for Hawaiian rolls when this woman walked behind me and yelled, “GET OUT OF THE WAY.” When I stood up and said, “What did you say to me?” She replied, “Get out of the fucking way you Chinese lady!” I then said, “Did you fucking said something racist to me? Location_Incident: At home, via Facebook and text
Description: My mother received an anonymous text message that somehow knew her name, and said that "I am the person targeting you, to kill you." The police said that the message was sent through an app, and she would probably be fine. Also, a couple days before this incident, some random guy on Facebook messaged her and told her that she should go back to China where COVID came from, and called her a "stupid bitch."

Location_Incident: Safeway in Strawberry Village (Mill Valley, Ca.)
Description: This happened to my wife she is Japanese. Verbal confrontation, people staring, people move away when spoken to.
On a walk, a biker coughed at me and called me and my family are Korean.
a guy called me a chink made fun of all asian people and then told me that it was my fault that the "Chinese virus" was in america.
I was on omegle and one guy called me a chink and said it was my fault that corona existed. I didn't know how to react and just kinda laughed in his face.
During zoom call for public comment, several times a male would manage to get on and make racists attacks towards Blacks by saying the N word; calling Asian’s chinks, wuhan flu
Any_SupportingLinks: Zoom; no video recording of proceedings by Oakland City Council

Description: During car caravan to Mayor Schaff to call on her to defund OPD, a white truck w/big American flag & conservative signs shouting the N word and Wuhan at cars trying to proceed. Loudspeaker, some neighbors and cars, encircled the truck and out shout the truck and soon left the scene. Heard later they were pulled over by OPD.

My cousin and I are both Chinese-American, we were walking down the street (both wearing face masks) when a white woman belligerently yelled from across the street with her face mask uncovered, “Hello!” to get our attention and when I turned around and faced her she said, “Go home!” I was taken aback because I’ve experienced a lot of indirect racism since Covid-19 enveloped the country but this was the first unprovoked verbal attack I encountered. I ignored her because I was shocked and also my cousin was visiting me and he is a very genial person and I didn’t want to cause a scene. This was in the midst of many other people in the streets, some enjoying outdoor dining, yet we were the ones she targeted.
I was at my brother's house in Palo Alto and as a car drove by, someone in the car screamed "Go back to your fuckin home!"
I was walking with my family and someone stared at me and mumbled that we had corona. I didn't cause a scene, but I did feel hurt by it.
I was walking with my family and someone stared at me and mumbled that we had corona. I didn't cause a scene, but I did feel hurt by it.
Ignorant and mocking statement

I was a pedestrian waiting at a 4 way stop, and a car pulled up to the stop sign. The driver was giving me a dirty look, and then pulled his hand across his neck gesturing he was going to cut my throat. All I could think of in that moment was how fast I could run to get away from him. Luckily, he sped off. I was left standing there shocked, angry, and sad.

Location_Incident: My mom’s business in 90047 Los Angeles CA
Description: A slim African American man in his mid-twenties drove up in his car to ask what the price of something was in our store. When we asked him to put on a mask, he yelled at my mom in a threatening manner (70 year old Korean woman) “Are you from China?” When my mom responded that we are Korean, he muttered unintelligibly and drove off.

My 70 year old Korean mom and I (27 year old Korean female) were hiking on a trail in Griffith Park when the trails were open to the public. We got to a more isolated part of the trail when we saw an African American man with a do-rag on his head approaching, so we moved to the side of the trail and faced away to let him pass without breathing on him or him on us. When he got near us, he started coughing on us. I yelled “fuck you” to get him to leave us alone and he laughed as he went away.

I was running in my neighborhood, following the governor's orders (no mask required if running and maintaining a thirty foot distance from others). Two different white women at two different times came up to me and yelled in my face, "Wear a mask!" White people ran by both times, none of whom were wearing masks, but they did not say anything to them.

Location_Incident: 6th Avenue between Downing Street and Bedford Street
Description: I called a Lyft to go to the doctor (I was undergoing IVF - nothing COVID related). I was wearing a mask. When the driver saw me he sped away and canceled the ride

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment, Tried to run me over

Description: White Caucasian female driver tried to run me over at a 4 way stop, while a white Causasian male shouted "thanks for the virus" and gave me the middle finger.
I hate that because Asians are so stupid and ate bats like they eat dogs, snakes and other animals Americans are being punished we should ban all Asians from coming to our country
A store manager asked my father if he was chinese during the height of the epidemic. When my father said no and said he was from another country, the store manager said — oh that’s okay then.

Location_Incident: Carmel Valley Road, Del Mar, California
Description: While taking a walk with my wife (also Eurasian) along the Coast, a white male in a van hung out his window and yelled to us °Fuck You° twice. When looking around to see who he was yelling at, we realized it was us, because there were no other individuals around.

I was at a stoplight, this van was waiting for the light to go green but was in the crosswalk. I waited until the crosswalk light gave me the go ahead. He still didn’t turn. I tried to wave at him to get his attention but he didn’t turn. I went behind his van so I wouldn’t be in his way and in case he decided to go forward. When I was walking behind his van, he suddenly reversed and almost hit me. It was less than an inch before he bumped me. I slapped the back of his van and said what are you doing! I walked around so that he could see from the driver side window, he raised his fist at me and yelled at me, “go back to your fucking country!” And drove off.
This man was older (around 60 yrs old), had a face mask on and Caucasian. I was born in Los Angeles and have lived here all my life. My parents came here as kids and have lived in California longer than they did in the Philippines. THIS IS MY COUNTRY and I shouldn’t be harassed, cursed at, ALMOST ASSAULTED- all because I’m brown and look different. This was such blatant hatred. I find myself being scared and looking over my shoulder when I’m out in public. This is NOT OKAY. Safety should be a right. RACISM SHOULD NOT.
A man called me Stupid Chinese!

I was at a grocery store trying to get by a woman in narrow, one-way aisle. When I got close to her she says, "You know you're suppose to be six feet away." I responded by telling her she was in the middle of this narrow aisle and that it was hard to get past her without getting near her. She then responds by saying, "I don’t even know why they would let you get into the store, you're the one who brought the virus over from China."

Location_Incident: Near her house on the side of the street.

They were sneezing one day in class (pre quarantine) and a bunch of white people yelled at them saying "ew you have the coronavirus, don't bring the coronavirus here next time."

As i was drawing on a plywood board on the street some white middle aged dude yelled at me to stop what i was doing bc it’s a “private property.” He was not the property/he was just walking by the street, yet he yelled till i stopped to leave. To me his action was strange since 1) the plywood is temporary and i was not vandalizing anything, 2) the property didnt belong to him. Now that i think about it, he was just bullying me as i was asian
Man screaming “Fuck you China. I will fight you.” In the middle of Main St. Man was armed and brandishing a knife.

Description: She was called a "fucking chink" and was told that "it was her fault COVID-19 existed."

He was sitting on a bench in the park with his friend minding their own business and this white man (probably about 40) was walking by and said “chinks will be chinks” and walked away. His friend is white and he doesn't look stereotypically Asian (he is half Laotian half white) so he was initially shocked that the man said that and to him and his friend of all people.

Location_Incident: Golden Corral/3520 Us Hwy 9, Freehold Township, NJ 07728
Description: As soon as we walked in, there were stares from the other families. Some of them hugged their children closer to shield them away from us. I walked passed a family that called us "Ling Ling," and my brother over heard a woman say "Stay away from those Chinese people they have corona."

Wife and I were climbing around rocks in the park. Someone was yelling anti Asian sentiment from a distance toward our general direction completely unprovoked. Yeller was probably about 75 yards away saying something about he’s better than us because we are Asian. Additionally yelling fake mock Asian language. Date and time were approximate.

Location_Incident: La Valencia Hotel in La Jolla, CA
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was a hotel guest at the pool, I left the property (barefoot and in my swimsuit, wrapped in a towel) to help my husband unload our luggage from the car. The waiter ran after me accusing me of trying to steal a pool towel. After, I found they assumed we were ‘locals’ and not hotel guests. My white friends were treated completely different.
I was walking to a dance class and a man sitting on a park bench yelled, “Hey! Fuckin’ Asian!” When I didn’t respond, he said, “Fuckin’ Asians” to himself.

I got out of my car after parking and sneezed into my sleeve. An older white female in her 70s parked behind me shouted out from her car window “AHH YOU MUST HAVE THE VIRUS!” I ignored went to my back trunk to get my backpack out of my car with my daughter, and the lady approached us and was screaming “WHY DID TOU PARK SO CLOSE TO MY CAR?! GO BACK TO YOUR COUNTRY YOU FILIPINO BASTARD!” I proceeded to tell her I was too tall to be Filipino and left saying thank you.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was in line at the pharmacy when a women approached me and spray Lysol all over me. She was yelling out”your the infection. Go home. We don’t want you here”. I was in shock and cried I left the building. No one came to my help. I was never even diagnosed with COVID

i have experienced an anti—asian incident since covid-19. when this disease was still only beginning to grow and spread, i had gotten sick. i had no idea what covid-19 was and i was just home for a few days instead of school. as soon as i arrived back, a guy in my class came up to me and insisted i had gotten the corona virus. he told everyone in my class and i saw it as a joke then because i didn’t know what corona was or where it was from or just anything about it. then, he changed my contact name to “Korona Ahn”. he had also changed other of my asian classmates contact names to similar, racist names rather than our own. it was then when i really felt uncomfortable and hurt.

I heard a white teenage boy murmur “Coronavirus” as I walked past him while I walking on the Crystal Cove beach. He was throwing football with another older boy. I also noticed he reduced his distance with the other boy as he uttered the word.

The neighbors at 2751 Greenwich St. were having another loud backyard gathering in the evening. They have met me previously and have seen my Asian face and voice. When I asked them, from my living room window, to be quiet soon after 11 pm, they finally agreed but yelled “ Chinese fire drill“ 3 times as they wrapped up their loud party bringing things inside.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have a video of them laughing and calling a “ Chinese fire drill”

Description: I was standing outside waiting to go inside a small cafe to get coffee to go. A guy walked in disregarding me and I said, "Excuse me, I was next." "Why you standing out there for?" "Uh...I'm trying to social distance?" "OK boss....whatever" "Hey...6 ft apart is better than 6 ft. under." "It's YOUR virus. YOU social distance."
Student in her class kept on calling her "coronavirus" because she is Chinese. This went on for a week.
A white man yelled at me "you yellow bitch, you caused all of this!"

Description: My kids and their cousins ranging from 11 to 17 years old, were biking, crossing the pedestrian/bike path when a truck honked at them and the driver yelled ‘go back to China!’
Any_SupportingLinks: No unfortunately because we were biking and focusing crossing a busy intersection.

Not sure if it were "Covid" related, maybe he had mental problem... but this apparent hate to us, Japanese, in the heart of Japanese village made me scared, and upset.
Any_SupportingLinks: My Japanese American friend was with me.

Description: Someone shouted "Corona Virus" to me while jogging.

Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: Sometime in February of 2020, I got on an elevator with a white male 40s-50s with his son who was like 13-17 years old, and he started coughing so I glanced at him for a second and he said, "what?!" As we got out, I said, "have a nice evening," and he completely ignored me. During a phone interview for a job in March, the interviewer asked me if they could hire me after the pandemic was over, and also coughed throughout the phone conversation but claimed it was just a cold he had from a week ago. Sometime in mid June, my mother told me her friend/co-worker was shopping at a Kroger in Spring, Texas, a suburb in Houston and a lady asked her, "when are you going back to China?" My mom's friend, shocked and confused, followed her to the cashier the lady was at and told her, "you don't do that! First of all, I'm not Chinese!" They didn't argue after that and Kroger employees did not interview. When my friend's mother returned to work that week as an essential employee, she tried to seek cope through a co-worker and told her what happened at the Kroger in Spring, Texas, the co-worker reported what they talked about to the manager and HR. My mother's friend was shocked and very traumatized that nobody would help her. On July 5th, I decided to go to a Kroger somewhere in Houston, Texas, and as I was going to my car after buying groceries, a man in a big oversized blue Chevrolet Silverado Pickup with wheels protruding out so far that it could overtake another lane, stared at me as I walked to me car. After I got in my car, a few minutes later, the guy in the blue oversized Silverado pickup drove next to my car and glanced at me for a second before driving away to the front of the Kroger. His pickup was also raised and customized and I don't know how it could be street legal because if he was pulled over, police would not be able to see the driver through his tinted windows or how high he is that they wouldn't be able to tell if he has his hands on the wheel or somewhere else, and what he could be reaching for. How these pickups are legal in the south, I don't know. Even in New York, my brother was wearing a mask in Manhattan, and someone a bicycle riding past him said, "Selfish!" Although we know that most incidents occur in California or New York where Asians have been since the 1800s, southern states never report their cases because it's bad rap for their southern state and normally the generations of Asians in the south are usually first or people that have just migrated to the U.S. and are afraid to report or say something. I'm reporting them now because I am getting tired of people in the south bullying me. Just a months ago in March, a man tried to confront me for driving too slow that he followed me for more than seven miles. I called the police and the police came out. I did not provoke that person. These cases just never get reported because light is never placed on southern states.

Lapd인터넷사이트 신고하려고했으나 계속 911으로만 하라고-세지가 나와서 이곳에 신고합니다. 저희콘도안에서 제가 부엌에서 설겆이하는데 수도창문위쪽 옆집윗쪽에서(#208,#308,옥상에서-이세곳중의하나가범인입니다)저한테 쏩니다, 제얼굴과머리 심장에 배에 성기앞에까지쏴서 매일쏩니다 뭔가 물리적인 기계총인지뭔지 아무튼 저한테 쏴서 너무나 고통스럽습니다.
