Location_Incident: On Carmelita Ave, near the intersections with Rodeo Drive and N Rexford Drive
Description: I went running on Saturday morning, and had two incidents on the same run. An orange Jeep stopped at the intersection and someone inside rolled down the window and yelled, "It's your fault!" and drove away. Later on the same run, I paused at another intersection to let a maintenance truck by, and a man walking on the other side of the road (who had headphones and a mask on) stopped, and began aiming his phone at me. I stayed on my side and gestured with my arms and asked him what he was doing. He stayed silent, continued pointing his phone at me, keeping it raised and aimed with one hand and adjusting positioning and clicking with the other hand, for another minute or two, while I continued to ask him what he was doing. Then he lowered his phone and walked away quickly without making eye contact or acknowledging me verbally. I ran parallel to him on the other side of the road, and continued asking him what he was doing. He never acknowledged my presence, but walked fast and away. The second incident was more disturbing to me. I reported both incidents to 211. 211 said they didn't rise to the level of a hate crime because there was no explicit mention of race, gender, ethnicity, etc.

Location_Incident: 11727 W Olympic Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90064
Description: Parked at Ralph’s parking lot, sat in my car for a few minutes before heading inside with lots of foot traffic around me. As I left my car to go inside, a older white male pulled up into the parking spot to the right of me. When I returned to my car, there was spit and phlegm all over the passenger (right) side door.

I went to try to cash my check. One guy was infront of me and one window open. I’m just waiting in line. The guy asks the girl if she speaks french and she says “ I speak Chinese “ Mocks the language by making noises/sounds and laughs.
At a gas station, a white women yelled at him saying that "he needed to take the virus away."

I was working at the bar at Starbucks at the time which meant I made the drinks. My white co-worker was working the register, and a customer came in and ordered a drink. When the customer saw me working at the bar, he asked if my white co-worker could make the drink instead. I ended up not making the drink.

While walking back to our car, my parents were honked at for no apparent reason by a young-middle aged, African American woman trying to get into a parking spot a few feet away. They were not obstructing her from driving past them, and were keeping to the side of the road. Though one could chalk it up to impatience or that the driver thought they were blocking her from moving past them, my parents viewed this as an act of racism and AAPI hate.

Location_Incident: Intersection of Broadway and El Camino
Description: I was entering the intersection about to turn left. A man jogged slowly across the street from my right and I had to slam on the brakes to avoid hiting him. I honked in the process. He started screaming unintelligbly and I calmly said that he could have been killed. He then started calling me names, racial slurs, said I should go back to China, and yelled Vote Trump. Then he encouraged me to fight. The interection cleared so I continued driving.
My parents were walking their way home, a person of African descents yelled a racial slur, "chinks", at them from his car.

I was using an app called Yubo, and I was live streaming with some friends. A guy joined our live stream (his account appeared to be a "troll" account) and started making racist jokes about Asians. He asked, "Do you guys enjoy eating bats?"

Walking dog with wife and 1 month daughter in our neighborhood when 2 off-leash dogs ran over and started lunging at us. Yelled at owners to put their dogs on a leash, was told to "Go back to China or wherever you came from."

I'm in an instagram group called Asian Noodle Gang, or A.N.G. A few days ago, someone had hacked our account. He had deleted every post on the account, which my friend and i had both spent hours editing. All of our work and 300 followers were gone. And then the person had started verbally harassing our members, calling us racial slurs and "covid carriers". They told us to "go eat a bat" and many more stereotypical things. and then we found out it was someone who used to be in the group, who was ironically asian.

I rented a condo at the above address and it has been about a year and a half. Someone has been bullied me intensively around our condo for a year and a half. I was waiting for the elevator, but I was so embarrassed that I shot it at the top of the elevator door.
Whether it was a gang leader, such as facility management for a condo, it was very painful to shoot my whole body with something like a laser gun while focusing on me and a cat in my house.

Location_Incident: NE Skidmore and NE Cleveland Ave, Portland OR
Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Description: Biking on a public street (where bikes are allowed) when a car passed me suddenly, white woman rolled down her window, spat at me and screamed slurs. We ended up at a red light where I took a picture of her license plate and she leaned out the window to yell at me more. The light turned green and she continued driving on.

Location_Incident: Santa Anita Ave Exit off of 210 Freeway
Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Physical Assault
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Physical Assault
Description: An older white man deliberately and abruptly braked his car in front of me as we were exiting the freeway ramp, nearly causing a physical collision. He then proceeded to scream "Chinese cunt bitch, go back to China" approximately 20 times and honked his car incessantly at me. When the light turned green, he blocked traffic and refused to let me drive on.

Location_Incident: 1150 N Interstate Hwy 35 Round Rock, TX 78681
Description: I am Everett's mom writing this on his behalf -- "My son was on a summer camp field trip to Gatti Town. While there, a girl from his camp group told him that all Chinese people have the Corona virus. She said that Asians brought the virus. Then, she proceeded to get the other kids to play a game called "corona touch" and said that he had the "corona touch". He didn't want to get in trouble by yelling back at her, so he kept quiet, but the constant insults ended up making him cry. The camp counselors stepped in at that point to stop her."

Site_Discrimination: Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store
Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store
Description: Since the Covid-19 outbreak, I have encountered many case of discrimination as a Asian person. I was verbal abused by a person at Walmart. She told me to Fuck off. In the post office, the clerk ignored and acted really angrily towards me. Many places, I visited many people were very unfriendly toward me. It is definitely much higher than before the covid-19 pandemic.

Location_Incident: ShopRite, 935 Boston Post Rd, Milford, CT 06461
Description: in black marker the word "GOOKS" was written on the side of the car
Any_SupportingLinks: It was reported to the store manager but was told the camera is too far. a police report was also made

Description: My team member at Workday shared racist picture and comments in our team Slack channel. I reported my case to upper management during my exit interview. I received a call from Workday on 07/08/2020 and the only appropriate action Workday took was talking to that person who is racist. No further actions.

Location_Incident: Oakland, CA at the 36th bus stop on 72 AC Transit busline heading into downtown Oakland
Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon, Physical Assault
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon, Physical Assault
Description: Black woman in her 40s blocks bus exit as 60s yr old Asian man tries to get off his stop. Racial slurs said and she physically pushed man's head violently with her hands and physically kicked man off bus with her legs. She was not wearing a mask while yelling the slurs in his face before assaulting him.

I was out running and I passed this house with a mom and her son standing outside. I saw a (non-Asian) woman walk past the house in front of me and the mother didn't react, but then when I passed the house, she held her child closer to her until I passed.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: Was being called a "racist" by a client (African American male), when he did not like the decision we made about his niece. He accused me so saying disrespectful things to him and labeled that as "racist" and I was being told to "go back to where I came from." He publicly humiliated me, he needed the whole street to be aware of my 'racist crime.' He coerced me to apologize with respect.
Some white kids in her mandarin class said under their breath "someone ate the bat" after someone sneezed.
A TSA agent sprayed Lysol after patting me down at LGA. Noticed she didn’t do the same to others.

My wife and I are both of Chinese descent. We are both front-line critical care physicians taking care of increasing numbers of COVID19 patients on a daily basis. Our mother-in-law has been living with us in order to provide care for our one-year-old daughter. For the past year, we have lived in a community with an HOA. Our neighbor has been on the board of directors for the past year, and he has scrutinized alleged violations of the HOA bylaws to the point of making many of us miserable. In particular, this neighbor has repeatedly harassed my wife and I regarding my mother-in-law parking in the guest/occupant parking spot. He does not want anyone to park in the guest spots in front of his house, because it "ruins his view." We ultimately decided to ignore him, but did agree to move the car to the street so as not to incite further harassment. Recently, I overheard him making disparaging remarks about my wife to another neighbor. When I confronted him outside to ask why it was he was spreading malicious rumors about us, he became infuriated, and advanced towards me (breaking the 6ft barrier while not wearing a mask) while carrying a large shovel. He proceeded to "chest-bump" me and told me "I will put you down, little Asian man." Out of self-defense, I shoved him back, and he seemed surprised at the reaction. This incident was shortly reported to the police, who stated this was simply a civil matter. When I reported this to the HOA manager, she was less than helpful, and proceeded to take the side of the neighbor in claiming that this was a dispute between neighbors. Two days later, this neighbor called one of his family members to verbally accost my mother-in-law, who is elderly and barely speaks English. She felt that her life was being threatened at that time. I again reported this to the HOA manager and, once again, she refused to escalate the issue, and instead took the side of the neighbor while also blaming my mother-in-law. I find it incredibly disheartening that, while my wife and I are risking our lives to take care of others affected by this terrible disease, petty individuals like this neighbor are inciting racial hatred against us in our community, and we are unable to seek any form of remedy from the HOA management. We would like to request any possible assistance from Asian American support organizations in bringing into the limelight this and other cases of discrimination against Asian Americans. Thank you.

Location_Incident: Lucia Restaurant, Bernardus Lodge and Spa
Description: Michael Lofthouse founder of Solid8 started cussing and gave his hateful speech to me and my family while we were having dinner celebrating my bday. He called us names and told us to leave. Racism is so surreal and scary.
When Aaron walks with his white dad no one avoids him, but when he walks around with his Chinese mom people try really hard to stay away from them, crossing the street.

I was going shopping in Alameda with his family when a guy in the parking lot started name-calling/verbally harassing us. He accused us of eating bats and hoarding groceries, even though we had a normal amount.

April was walking, wearing a mask and social distancing, along a trail path, when a woman gave her a disgusted look and purposely walked far away from her. She said that this has happened more than once.

Disclaimer b/c I wasn't sure where to put this: I'm an intern with Stop AAPI Hate and am filling this out on behalf of my friend. She wasn't sure about the exact date/time of the incident, but because the form didn't allow me to skip that, I entered a random date/time.

I was on the back machine. Cleaned it, put my little resistance band bag by it and small towel. 
White man: Thew my towel on the ground and kicked my resistance bands aside. 
Me: Hi, sorry, I was on this machine. 
White man: You are a liar! You're CONTAMINATING this entire place. 
Me: What? I just cleaned this area and you moved my stuff. White man: LIAR! You are a liar! You are contaminating this gym. FOLLOWED me...Me: Please stop it. Please stop following me. I am going to the manager. White man: You are a liar! I am going to tell him that you are a liar and that you are contaminating this place. Me: You are spitting in my face without a mask. I am wearing a mask. Please stop. He told the manager that I contaminated the entire gym. The manager handled the entire thing quite well. The manager, as gracious as he was, didn't understand that this was racially motivated. I explained to the manager, "Many people think that we Asians are Chinese and that we have COVID." He said, "I don't think that." I couldn't explain to him that this is what it was. He thought the guy was upset about my small sack, but that was not the case. It was clear to me when the White man carried on shouting that I am contaminating everything in the gym. The gym has always been my safe space/haven. Reza said he will make sure that I am safe there. I was worried that he would stock me, since I can't be anonymous (I'm one of a very few Asians there). (he said he sees that I always put away my equipment, keep things clean and wear a mask). He asked the man to stop following me. The White man continued to stare me down until I left the gym. I do not scare easily, but I was nervous that he was going to follow me out of the gym and shoot me. That was the vibe I was getting. I was and am one of the only Asians in the gym. It was clear what he was saying to me, while other White people had their little sacks with them--he didn't tell them that they were contaminating the entire gym. I was horrified and embarrassed by this confrontation. When he sees me in the gym he stares me down, which makes me feel unsafe. I am afraid he may do more one day if I am alone in the studio downstairs or catches me off guard.

Location_Incident: Outside Los Panchos Restaurant, 480 San Ramon Valley Blvd, Danville, CA
Description: As I was leaving the restaurant, white male stormed up to me and verbally harassed and terrorized me -- screaming "return to China you f***ing Asian" and other hateful, racial slurs... threatening me physically. This went on for several minutes as I departed the scene quickly to call police. A clear case of racial hatred towards me. I called the Danville police who arrived quickly to apprehend him. I gave a verbal account to another officer who arrived later. I have not heard back from anyone.
Me and a few friends were passing by a classroom to which someone outside shouted "corona corona" directly at us.

Location_Incident: Embarcaderro at Ferry Market Plaza crosswalk
Description: 40-50 something male pedestrian swinging a chain ( numchuck chains possibly) crossing at ferry market crosswalk turned around at sight of me stopped at the red light and yelled something while swinging the chain towards my car. i had no idea why i was a target at the time. i assumed it was just early quarantining restless energy pentup among some homeless.
Any_SupportingLinks: likely street surveillance cams wouldve captured this.

Location_Incident: Alemany near San Jose Ave. SF
Description: A vehicle started to tailgate and break check me. As the car pulled alongside the male driver screamed "Fuckin Chink."

School informed and matter handled but just wanted to share this incident occurred. My son, who is half Mexican and half Asian, was racially targeted by random students at school asking if he had coronavirus.
I was at school and going to second period. I was late, so the hallways were empty. This African American boy saw me and walked away while saying, "F**k Asians."
I was at Target with my mom, and we were standing in one of the aisles. This white woman saw us and plugged her nose and walked away.

Connie was in Berkeley and got on a BART train; she sat down and cleared her throat, and all of the other passengers started rushing out of the car. She was not wearing a mask because it was not recommended/required at the time (this happened in late March/early April) but felt extremely uncomfortable as an Asian American teenager. She was upset that the passengers assumed she had COVID-19 or was more likely to have it just because she looks Asian – she isn't even Chinese, but there is little discernment between East Asian races.

Note: I'm an intern with Stop AAPI Hate reporting this on behalf of my friend. The date and time are rough estimates.
While grocery shopping an asian woman was called the name "corona virus". The young kid that called her corona virus continued to point at her.

Location_Incident: Hong Kong’s Cafe, 1632 S Mason Rd, Katy, TX 77450
Description: A random kid (assuming about 12-15yrs old) called during my work shift stating, “My dog just died. Do you need more meat?” I replied “No, but your mom might. You should ask her.” I hung up and never heard from the ignorant child ever again. I’m assuming their friends or parents convinced them to go through with such ignorance calling a restaurant just to waste time and make an offensive prank call.

A government coworker cursed me sarcastically that I may stay well during these times after I told him bless your heart as he became hostile in conversation. I have been getting the asian peace sign out of nowhere from acquaintances and it's annoying.

I went for a walk along the boardwalk with my partner (white), his sister, and a few meters behind us, his parents. As I'm fixing my mask, a middle aged man (white) on a bike comes towards us, and once close enough- presumably to confirm some sort of label of my ethnicity, and- unprovoked he shouts, "you SHOULD take your mask off" while maintaining his eye contact only on me and not the rest of my party.
Thrown to the ground
knife put to head

Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Verbal Harassment, Workplace Discrimination, Barred from establishment

refused service, told to leave the property
refused service, told to leave the property
refused service, told to leave the property
When I was at Nob Hill, there was this white woman who kept on staring and glaring at me. I could tell she almost flipped me off.
Racist remarks in regard to the ongoing pandemic. Confronted her and had a 9MM pointed at me. Opponent disarmed and pinned via wrist control + mount until help and police arrived.

Told to "Go back to China" Spoke with Manager and he said, "I'm not the police, I can't interrogate a customer" He said "we defend our associates", but obviously not the Asian customers. I have shopped at that Publix for 28 years. I later spoke with the District Supervisor who was empathetic and apologized for his actions. Said that they would do training with that manager and that I would get a letter of apology. If they don't say anything, then it perpetuates the problem. I am done being silent.
Was told to get out of my country

Voice mail received from a man yelling about the new Asian Pacific American Studies program, and how stupid we are for having it, and elaborating on all the ways that the Chinese are awful, full of disease and commit genocide. After being contacted by the UA Police Department, the caller explained that he and his family had COVID-19 and he has been out of work. Upon seeing the a new story about the new Asian Pacific American Studies program, and with the racist name calling of the disease, he got upset and made the call.

My husband (who is Chinese-American) and I were walking along Stow Lake with masks on, when an older woman (racial/ethnicity unknown) walking toward us, made eye contact with us and said in a disdainful tone, "Oh/Ugh, China" as we walked passed each other.
random white guy called me "the spawn of coronavirus" on omegle and exited the call
White guy with tattoos called me an"asian mf" at a parking lot at the capitola beach for standing next to me car
I was playing a video game where he was on public voice chat where people were attacking me for supposedly having coronavirus because I'm asian
This person commented: @notyourway99：They have a good fashion sense but they eat everything alive.

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Description: When a group of boys at my school walked by me and my friends, they called COVID-19 "the Chinese Virus" and pretended to cough.

On Tiktok, someone from my school posted an offensive video about Chinese people eating bats and blaming Chinese people for "causing" the coronavirus. This person also happened to be Asian-American. When people started calling him out in the comments, he and his friends (a lot of whom were also Asian-American and went to the same school) continued to defend themselves and say racist comments, and said that it was okay to say these offensive things.

Earlier this year i faced anti asian discrimination at the san leandro public library. there were a group of teens being disruptive, so my friend and i asked them to please keep quiet down as we were studying. the teens then began to make comments regarding the corona virus and racist comments towards the two of us. ex: "stop laughing before she coughs on you" "corona virus" and other racist remarks

My family and I were on a walk and we passed by a man outside his house. He got mad at us for not being 6 feet apart from each other even though we're all in the same household and he didn't pay any attention to other families on the same block.

During a shift at my place of work, I was going to help some customers at an aisle. When I got to the aisle, this huge group of customers walked past me and were standing behind me while I helped the other customers. When I finished helping, that same group began yelling corona, coronavirus, and chink at me, while laughing. I didn't report the incident to my managers because I felt like it didn't matter that much.

At the very beginning of January my dad flew to Macao, then once he got back people kept asking me if my he had Covid-19. I tried to explain that Macao isn't part of China and he didn't have corona for by just being there. They kept asking me questions on what his trip was like and if he had seen anyone with corona. I used to live in Macao and it was very disrespectful to me and my family that my friends would just assume he's sick.

Location_Incident: 2494 San Bruno Ave, San Francisco, CA 93134 (The incident happened in front of the building on the street)
Description: I was walking down the street with my dad and my sister. This guy, who appeared to be drunk or high, walked past us while saying, "F*ck the Chinese."
I was alone sitting in a car when a homeless black man decided to sit directly in front of me and cough on me
I am a nurse. When I walked into my patient’s room, patient stated, “I don’t want that CHONG as my nurse.”

My soccer team has scheduled zoom meetings at 5:00pm everyday and a teammate of mine said during the call "the only reason we're in this is because a Chinese guy ate a bat". No one in the call said anything about it. It was brushed off probably because of the normalization of Anti-Asian jokes and sentiments in modern society.
A lady swerved away from me in the grocery store once she heard me talking in mandarin to my dad

I was in the grass w my puppy when a lady started screaming at me to “get off the sidewalk” and “move” out of her way. She kept yelling “f****** Asian!” “Goddamn Asians!” “Go back to your country you f****** Asian!” And she also went on a triad on how I was going to “eat my dog.” I was so shocked bc we weren’t even on the sidewalk, or in her way but she came up and got in my face w her Doberman Pincher. She was going to have her Doberman pincher attack me and my puppy but noticed her racist screaming had drawn a crowd
Any_SupportingLinks: I posted briefly on my IG story and have videos I filmed, talking about the incident data time stamped from that day.

Description: People asked me if I had Covid-19 just because I'm Asian. They also asked if my country eats bats as well.
This boy at school constantly called my other Asian friend and I "corona virus" and "ching chong". He then proceeded to ask us if we ate bat soup and he mocked the Chinese language.

I joined a video call with my friend, once we joined two people began to yell racial insults at us. They called us "ching chong" and pulled back their eyes to mock us. They told us that we were the cause of Covid-19 and that Asians should just die off.

My father and I were going to the market to pick up some ingredients. We were getting out of the car that was parked next to the sidewalk of the supermarket when an older white man in a bright red sports car came flying down the road. He yelled out the window something along the lines of, “Go back to where you came from, and take your virus with you!” with a derogatory term for Chinese people mixed in somewhere.

Location_Incident: My house while I was playing video games
Description: I was playing a video game and I was on a call with some random other people who were also playing the same game online with my friend and I. Then one of them asked us if my friends and I were Chinese. We responded with "yes" and they told us to leave the game because they didn't want to be catching corona through the game.
sometimes when I go online I am told to go back to china or called slurs.
I was on Omegle, and a white man who I had never met called me a "zipperhead."
When I was scrolling on social media I saw posts calling the corona virus the "Chinese virus" and "Kung flu".
When I was out grocery shopping with my mom people would pull up their masks as we got closer to them or started going down the same aisle.

Location_Incident: Just know it was in nevada
Description: My friend was just somewhere public and coughed a little and some people were making fun of him for having corona and pushed him down for coughing. They also made fun of him saying that he ate cats/dogs and called him slurs.

A girl in my district posted a picture on instagram with the caption "f*** the kung-flu". The comments below the post affirmed the caption and those that opposed the caption were either deleted or the friends of the poster attacked the user who opposed the caption. The post has since been deleted

Location_Incident: With my friends on a group FaceTime call
Description: I was on a group FaceTime call with my friends at the beginning of Covid-19 and they began to joke about how I must have the virus because I'm Asian

Location_Incident: I'm not sure but it was a few blocks from my apartment (425 N Hobart Blvd)
Description: I was crossing the street, and an unmasked Brown man was on the other side. I didn't think much of it because I live in a POC-heavy neighborhood and some of them don't wear masks, but they leave me alone. He glanced at me several times and lingered on the corner, I thought he was checking the street for cars before he crossed. As I passed him, he spat at me from behind (so clearly he was waiting for me to cross so he could do this) and then followed me for about half a block, upon which I turned and ran across the street to hide behind a van and make sure he kept walking without following me home.

“I was looking through my following stories on Instagram when I saw a story showcasing a video post about racism. In the video, a girl decided to go on Omegle (a free chat room where you talk to strangers) and recorded her encounters with racist strangers. The strangers used disrespectful language such as, “Are you the girl who ate bats?”, and “Ling Ling!”. One guy even used the Chinese eyes and exclaimed that the US must nuke (bomb) all Asians.”
I was walking down the sidewalk in Sonoma and a lady yelled at me for not walking out of the way onto the street as we passed each and she told me, "You're more likely to have it."
