Description: I was in line at the pharmacy when a women approached me and spray Lysol all over me. She was yelling out”your the infection. Go home. We don’t want you here”. I was in shock and cried I left the building. No one came to my help. I was never even diagnosed with COVID

I was on the bus going back home from my orthodontist appointment. There was a guy who came on the bus and there were other Asians who were also on the bus. He repeated shouted at us saying that we are the reason why COVID-19 is happening and we should just go back to our country.

When I was on a walk with my dad and brother at Stowe Lake, we were wearing our masks and there were lots of people. Some white lady was walking near us started shouting at us how we started the virus and calling it the "chinese virus."

I was in a Discord Call with people on my friends server. All of a sudden people joined our call and asked us what race we are. When I said I was Asian they started harassing us saying things like "You're the reason for Corona".

엘에이로 경찰웹사이트에 신고가 안되서 여기에 신고합니다
저는 엘에이로 콘도렌트해서 살고있는데 콘도한테 엘리베이터내려서 현관문벽쪽에 저희집쪽벽에 몰카같은게 조종할수있눈것이 붙어있습니다. 안방화장실에서 옷장방에서 모두 현관문벽쪽인데 제몸에 마구 뭔가 쏴대고 안방화장실변기위에서 거울위에서 불빛이 왔다갔다하고 성범죄자인지 변태같은 사람이 저의 몸을 보고 뭔가 쏩니다. 시설관리쪽사람인지 갱이나 도둑들같습니다.
베란다벽쪽에도 나무정원관리하는사람들이 몰카붙여놓고 저한테 또 고양이한테 뭔가 쏜적이 많습니다. 인터넷할때도 전자파를 마구 세게 쏘고 도둑들같습니다. 윌셔베란다쪽과 브론슨애비뉴쪽에서 윌셔 로스알토스아파트쪽에서도 윌셔창문쪽에서 엄청나게 제책상쪽으로 어깨에 신장염에 마구 쏘고 인터넷해킹하고 책상위에서는 화이어알람에서 빨간불로 번쩍거리면서 대머리와 눈에 쏩니다.’또 에어컨히터나오는곳에서 수상한사람이 담배냄새와 성욕자극하는것등나쁜것들을 마구 내뿜습니다(저는 담배든 나쁜것은 안합니다)
또 주차장에서 저희집이 1층인데 책상의자밑에서 제성기에 엄청 많이 쏘고 고양이한테도 쏩니다.
1년반동안 너무 고통을 당해서 신고합니다.

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Description: My ethics teacher is full Filipino. She was taking the bus with a mask on following all of the precautions. This man comes on the bus and started to shot nonsense about how Asians are at fault. All of the sudden he singled my teacher out and got in her face. He proceeded to shout when she got off the bus. He followed her and spat in her face then left.

Location_Incident: Leaving The Vitamin Shoppe, 1692 Saratoga Ave, San Jose, CA 95129, In the parking lot
Description:
My mom and I were leaving The Vitamin Shoppe as COVID-19 cases began in our area, and on our way to our parked car, a white car purposefully drove up to us as close as they could and a man in the passenger side sing taunted at us: “You are the virus. You are the virus.”

Twice with a pause in between to ensure we heard what he said clearly as we were puzzled at first. They drove off after but it was still shocking and disheartening to hear 10 minutes away from any surrounding neighborhood that is at least 60% Asian.

I was jogging in midtown on Sunday and a woman yelled at me loudly and repeatedly "Go back to hell, go back to China. Your country is hell." I was caught off guard and I froze for a moment. Then I tried to say something to defend myself but it came out nonsense. I choked and stuttered for a minute and I then ran away. Afterwards, I felt so angry with myself because I was so weak and completely forgot how to defend myself. I felt so powerless, I thought that I should have fire back with words since this was not the first incident that happened to me. Over the past 5 months I have been the target of many curse words around Manhattan. Every time, I promised myself to record the next time this happens, but every time I freeze up and fail to do anything. I was so angry and had no way to seek justice for so many times, and that day was just a tipping point for me. I couldn't take it anymore. I cried when I got home in the shower and then the whole night. It has become too difficult to handle and I barely sleep right now. I just don't know how to fight back and take back some of my dignity. I feel useless, but I want to change that and that is why I am here. I want to help every Asian faces for the right of my people, and take back what those people has taken from me -- my agency as a human being. Please tell me whatever I can do to fight back.

Location_Incident: Over the radio -- Radio station was KBCO 97.3
Description: A political ad for Cory Gardner over the radio contained anti-China statements, tied COVID to China, and demanded reparations from the Chinese.

My friends - all asian- and I went on Omegle and were video chatting and within the first 5 minutes someone immediately started being racist and saying stuff like "did you eat a bat? and "its all your fault." We thought that this would be the only racist incident but 3 more people did this.
Me and my brother were standing in a shop and a man came over and said fuck all of yall asians and threw his cup against the window. We thought that he might be crazy and we didn't know what to do.
Me and my friends were facetiming random people and some black kids joined and pointed at me and said “haha you have corona. How do bats taste.”

Social media was flooded with "jokes" that were awfully offensive to Asians when coronavirus started to spread. Especially on the app "Tik Tok" it was used as a platform to spread hate towards Asians and it was so normalized no one seem to be questioning it.

I was in the school bathroom and three white girls entered. They immediately covered their face with their shirts, even though they were with each other before. When I confronted them about it, they said they didn't want to get the coronavirus.

I had been sitting in English class, my fifth period, waiting for class to start when the incident occurred. I saw people entering the classroom talking about coronavirus, carrying hand sanitizers, washing their hands like crazy and making jokes about COVID-19. One of my classmate walked up to me with water on their hands from washing them and their hands in my direction, getting water on me and walked away saying “Coronavirus!” I didn’t mind it too much because I noticed many people were making jokes and I was used to people making these racist jokes. It did make me feel sad for a while but I tried not to care.

During break at school, I usually go to talk with friends in a certain area under a tree. These boys were talking about going back to China and they said “Go back to China! You uncle probably ate the bat and things similar to that '' At the time I didn’t think much of it taking it as a joke. But ever since quarantine and seeing asians getting beat up because of the issue, it made me realize that the jokes were disrespectful and racist.

I had just finished going to the bathroom and washing my hands when I saw someone walk in. She looked at me and mumbled corona under her breath. This made me feel scared to go to the bathroom alone at that point because I didn’t want to face this racial comments again. This encounter even made me feel embarrassed to be Asian.

I went out to go grocery shopping and I was casually minding my own business, when an old white man with no mask came behind me. He started saying “It is your fault that corona is in America and Chinese people suck, stop taking all these jobs, the economy sucks because of your people, go back to your country” I replied by saying “I was born here and it isn’t my fault” Later a young African American lady intervened and told the man to stop bothering me and that we should all be working together and I was really grateful. I felt angry because I hadn’t done anything and I didn’t know why he was blaming me.

I was crossing the street and a random black woman started following me and shouting "go back to China" at me. I tried to let her pass at first, but she would not pass and continued shouting at me. I tried walking away or keeping a distance, but she would stop and walk toward me while shouting "go back to China".

Location_Incident: Mall (the person I've interviewed cannot recall what shopping place her sister went. Even her sister and mom cannot remember.)
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: "My sister was shopping and wearing a mask. When she would look at certain merchandise, an employee would follow her and clean where she had touched. My mom noticed that she did not do this to any of the other customers, all white, only my sister."
"I have had people look at me funny when I was in public like a grocery store. I have terrible allergies and if I sneezed or coughed, people would give me a disgusting look and walk away."

People constantly ask me if I know someone with the coronavirus, or claim that I have the coronavirus because I am Chinese. Also at school other students would joke about me eating dogs, or would tell me to go back to my country.

"When corona first hit Arizona, many white athletes would wear masks in the halls, and before lunch, the science halls are majorly empty. So as I was walking through them, I was walking past those athletes with masks. Despite an empty hall with just me, they hug the walls and exaggerated their intent to avoid me."

“I was in line at the dollar store and there was this lady in front of me paying. The man before the lady has a dog, so I stepped closer to see the dog, but then the lady looked at me up and down and said: “You need to be behind that line.” I went to the line that was 6 feet away from her, but she screamed annoyingly at me with disgust, “NO THE OTHER LINE BEHIND YOU!” (which is 12 feet away from her) and rolled her eyes. Everyone turned around and looked at her, even the clerk made this face like "Woah what is that about?””
Me and my friends were facetiming random people and some black kids joined and pointed at me and said “haha you have corona. How do bats taste.”

It all took place on a video game and it started at the beginning of the match. This one person out of nowhere said "I hate gooks, if you're a gook I'm going to leave." I immediately went off on him and so did everyone in the lobby. He began to ramble about COVID-19 and started saying gook again.

In the beginning stages of COVID in the U.S., my boyfriend (a white make) and his friends were harassing me. After not contacting each other for months, he was sending me snaps (on the app Snapchat) of him and his friends calling me a chink. It was clear that he was drunk but they went on about how I had the coronavirus. After that they blocked me.

I arrived at the park for an engagement shoot since I am a photographer. As soon as I got out of the car, these teens started yelling “Coronavirus!”. There were other people there that asked why they were shouting “Coronavirus”, but as soon as they saw me, they just looked away and were quiet.

Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Description: I faced quite a bit of racism while I was in Kenya due to tensions over the Coronavirus. I was followed and verbally assaulted while at the market. There were several incidences of people surrounding me and coughing while yelling “coronavirus” or “Chinese virus”.

Type_Discrimination: Threatened to get run down by a delivery van driver of Famous Dave's.
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Threatened to get run down by a delivery van driver of Famous Dave's.
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was returning to work from my usual lunch break walk, when the delivery van coming from Curtner was speeding approximately over 20 mph into the parking lot towards in front of me only swerving at the very last minute with tires screeching a couple of feet away. It's noon, I could clearly the driver smiling while he was in front of me and so did the witnesses dinning outside Applebee's who were shaking their heads with me. The intent was there, it's real and sad at these hard times.

Location_Incident: on M14 bus route, along 14th street near union square
Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Physical Assault, attempted theft
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Physical Assault, attempted theft
Description: suspect called me and/or my wife a Chinese bitch. attempted to steal my phone and may have hit me but in an attempt to get the phone. we moved away to tell the bus driver and the suspect did not pursue.

My HR manager (co-lead of Brown-Forman's Blacks United in Leadership and Development [BUILD] ERG), HR generalist (member of BUILD), on-site nurse, and union leader were having a discussion directly outside my office regarding wearing masks. They were generally complaining about having to wear them, and ways people were dealing with them. For example, the nurse mentioned that someone she encountered was drinking through his gaiter-style mask. Yes, through it— as in pouring the water through the fabric of the mask into his mouth. The HR manager offered to give the union leader a mask and he said, "I don't need one." The nurse responded with, "Here, you can have this whole box. They came from China." to which the union leader replied, "I don't want 'none' of those. They're probably contaminated. I'm not wearing anything from China!"
Other comments included:
"Here this one's from Vietnam!"
"She won't wear anything from Vietnam!"
"Can't anything be made in America except Fords?"

The overall feeling of the conversation was of general disdain for anything coming from or related to China and Asia in general. Anything from that part of the world is contaminated and shouldn't be touched.

i was hiking and took my mask off for a little to get fresh air. this lady walks past us and murmured under her breath in a disgusted tone something like “uh uh y’all ain’t wearing not mask” when there were others ahead of us that didn’t even have a mask with them.

Walking my dog, stopped on sidewalk to quickly adjust my headphones while listening on a company training session on racism & being a stronger ally. Caucasian woman approaches me out of the blue, and yells that I don't belong in this country, it's HER country, and to get the hell out.

Location_Incident: Through Google Classroom (But this is the school name: North Phoenix Preparatory Academy)
Description:
During my 11th grade in May 2020, we were required to do a 6-minute video about leadership in drama class. 

The drama teacher gave feedback, saying, "Things to work on: American Diction. You should work on your diction to ensure you are easily understood as it is sometimes hard to understand you." 

I decided to email her back, telling her that Tagalog (Filipino) is my first language, not English, however, she never replied back.
A homeless man walked up to my friends and I. He proceeded to call us racial slurs and blamed us for the virus.
We were the only POC customers at the coffee shop. A white lady walks up and tells us she's going to put her mask on because we're here.

Two guys made racist comments such as “Chinese people are gross because they eat bats and dogs” and “go back to China” because I posted an Instagram story defending Chinese people and speaking out about the racism going on right now.

Location_Incident: It was a post on social media from someone I knew.
Description: Someone that I’d knew posted hate speech against Chinese stating that Hitler has the right idea but did it to the wrong people aka he should’ve tried killing off the Chinese. He said a bunch of other hateful things and I have a screenshot of it. It wasn’t pleasant to wake up and read that.

Location_Incident: Parking Lot of a skating rink
Description: A white girl walking down the sidewalk (about 15 feet away) cupped her hand over her mouth and nose when she saw me and my kids at the parking lot then uncovered it as soon as she walked past us. This happened when the coronavirus outbreak just began. We were attending my daughter’s classmate’s birthday.

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon
Description: I’m reporting this on behalf of my brother who got spat on and got told to go back to where he came from because he looked Chinese to the racist attacker. He always takes the train to go to work and sometimes my house. It’s actually strange because I happened to come across a homeless guy who was taking to another homeless person at the same location (there’s a 7-11 by the station) and I overheard one of them admitting he’s a racist and was talking about hating black people and prefers beautiful blonde girls instead - I couldn’t believe it.

I sat near a girl in class who was talking to her friend and they were talking about the virus. The girl said "f China.” That hurt because I’m Chinese and I grew up in China, so I identify as more Chinese than Chinese-American.

Recently we went to a restaurant where we (my family and I) were the only POCs in the restaurant and a white couple kept turning around and staring at us. I tried to ignore them at first but eventually I just stared back at them.
In early March there were lots of jokes online about eating bats and how the virus is the fault of Asians because of our choice of culture and food.

TikToks in March (in the few days while schools were cancelling there were a lot of tiktoks)
People saying how some person ate a bat and now we all have to struggle
My reaction was: Are they dumb?
Some of them would show Asian people (people they knew?)
A lot of Asian people would make tiktoks explaining what people were saying to them.
Almost every tiktok was about COVID during this time.

I was with my mom and we were shopping, then someone next to my mom was trying to talk quietly but loud enough for us to hear. The person said "Asian people all have the virus, they eat anything We have to stay away from Asian people."

On social media there were videos of micro aggression I saw where these "Karens and Kevins" (white males and females) were very hostile. I would see many videos of people expressing their hate towards Asians. I usually go through the comments section and about one or two comments and treads of comments that are arguing back and forth with each other.

I was with my grandma getting groceries and this person yelled at us and told us, "Stay home, we don't want you here. You people are spreading corona everywhere." Then the person walked far away from us.

I was in my car scrolling through Instagram and saw a post on @nextshark that someone was selling a Lululemon shirt (bat fried rice shirt). I saw the image first and thought that is so mess up and I saw the bats on the sleeves. Then when I read though article I was more upset because someone thought that this was okay.

When my mom, Lola, Avery, and I went to the doctor’s office (it was a normal checkup for Avery, before everything got serious), this lady (non asian) came in with her family. She saw us and lowkey freaked out. She told the nurse that her family would be staying outside. There was no one else there except my family, which obviously meant that she wanted to stay away from us.
Right before we went into quarantine, I was told many times in school by my old friends that I have it (coronavirus) as a joke just because I am Chinese. They also said my whole Chinese class had it.

My dad and I were at a farmers market and it wasn't too crowded. Most people weren't six feet apart but at the same time no one really said anything and minded their own business. We walked past this older white mad and he pushed my dad with his finger and yelled "Six feet apart." Even though there were other people walking close to him, he specifically touched my dad and yelled at us.
My mom was at Target and she was being stared at, probably because she looks very Asian. Then a white woman saw her in the isle and dropped the flour bag she was holding and hustled out of the isle.

Site_Discrimination: Private Residence, Business: Non-Grocery Store, Public Street/Sidewalk
Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: Private Residence, Business: Non-Grocery Store, Public Street/Sidewalk
Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Blatantly followed by neighbor at a store and back to resident area.
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Blatantly followed by neighbor at a store and back to resident area.
Description:
Everytime go to smoke a cigarette in the backyard, some lady yells that I "keep smoking and smoking, and smoking", but when the other resident that resides here at the house (who is white) is left alone when she comes out to smoke. Also a previous resident that lived here, he is Polish and Mexican (he looks white) who practically stayed out there almost all day and all night smoking was left alone and was never harassed like I am. 
Just today (07/16/20) they have gone too far as to follow me to the boba shop and then tail me back until I got close to the house.
My sister Avery wanted to high-five a little baby and the stupid mom literally yanked the baby away.

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Barred from transportation (e.g. Lyft, Uber, public transportation)
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Barred from transportation (e.g. Lyft, Uber, public transportation)
Description: I see these videos on instagram with picture of cooked or dead animals and with people speaking in foreign languages that isn’t even Chinese and the post saying that this is why corona stated and they don't know how to eat food. I've also seen a video of an old Asian man pushed out of a convince store.
A girl hated the fact that apparently people were blaming African Americans for Covid and talked crap about Asians.

I was at Foodmax with my mom and we were in line to pay. We were almost at the cash register and an asian lady in front of us and another lady saw that we only had one thing so she said that we could cut her but the white lady behind her said “No we were all waiting for so long go back in line ching chong.”

Type_Discrimination: @ 2 construction white males loading truck, 1 cough loudly into maskhen I passed by; I know it was purposeful as he was eyeballing me w
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: @ 2 construction white males loading truck, 1 cough loudly into maskhen I passed by; I know it was purposeful as he was eyeballing me w
Description: 2 construction white males loading truck, 1 cough loudly into mask when I passed by; I know it was purposeful as he was eyeballing me , I'm tired being blamed for this virus and no politicians will address this, where's gavin, breed, others since they are so concern for humanity, asians worth nothing?

Location_Incident: Not specified it was while driving
Description: While driving with my father, someone next to us rolled down his window and called me a bad driver because I was Asian. He then proceeded to speed up and cut me off after.

I was at Costco with my mom and during that time the pandemic just started and people were were buying things in bulks. I was in the toilet paper isle and these white people were just mugging us and when someone talked in native language white people would mug them. The way they acted put out a lot of hate towards the Asians.

It was a random person online and then she was like hey cutie and stuff then I posted it on my story because like it was so damn creepy and then she texted me again and then she was like “Hey why did you post me on your story you chink?” Then she started spamming me with more racist stuff like “End your fucking life you ugly ass chink.” and “Go cook some rice you worthless fucking Asian” and then after that she blocked me.

My family and I wanted to buy mochi donuts we had to order online and picked up in the supermarket. There was a line to go in so I waited in line and when I was in line there was this lady with her husband in front of me and I wasn’t even close to her but she yelled at me saying "Social distancing please." Then she would always turn around to see if we were too close to her and tried to avoid us and the way she acted just showed that she didn't”t want us there.
While I was running a lady stopped me and assumed I was Chinese. She told me I was crazy and said to go back to my country.

I was scrolling through Tik Tok and saw in the comments of one of the videos on their about how someone was beat up and spit on just because he was asian and suspected to have coronavirus because of his race.

When I took the bart, I sat next to a lady. Immediately, she leaned away, covered her face with her shirt, and kept glancing/glaring at me. She only acted this way when I was near her. The next stop, she moved seats.

I was joining a game “Call of Duty” and had a profile picture of me and the other person that was losing the game against my team said “Coronavirus,” to me. I responded “That's kinda racist of you to say,” then the person told me “I don't care and every asian has corona anyways.”

I was scrolling through Instagram and I saw this video on @asiansneverdie of this Asian women waiting for a bus and these three grown men went up to her and started harassing her and one of them kicked her in the face.

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment, enforcing a negative stereotype
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment, enforcing a negative stereotype
Description: When I was hanging out with a group of classmates there was a piece of clothing that had a panda and traditional Chinese writing. One of my classmates looked at me, the only asian in the group, and told me that the top would look good on me.

Site_Discrimination: Place of Worship, Public Park, Public Street/Sidewalk
Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: Place of Worship, Public Park, Public Street/Sidewalk
Description: I was working at the polls and I was the only Asian person there. Then, This white lady walked up to me and asked me if I had Coronavirus. She was very passive aggressive about it.

I tried to return an unused Starbucks mug 1 day after I had purchased it. I presented my receipt and was initially told by a Starbucks employee that it wouldn’t be a problem. Then Kay, a white Vons manager, came to tell me that she could not accept a return of any product that I had touched because of the Pandemic. Kay told me that she did not know what was happening in my home so for the safety of her and her store I could not return it. Although there were no signs posted about a no refunds policy - nor was she able to locate a sign to post while I was there - she told me the State Law was no refunds but if I waited she could print something out for me so I could understand what she was saying. I actually spoke with Starbucks corporate following the incident and they in fact extended returns because of store closures due to COVID-19 and refunded me. I filed an Albertsons/Vons ethics report the same day. INCIDENT REPORT #41269160

A non Asian boy, my age, went up to me in Ralph’s and said “coronavirus”. I was shocked that this would even happen since Asians are heavily populated in the SGV area and I didn’t think I’d experience anything like this because of the pandemic. I didn’t respond and I ignored it, half because of shock and because I did not want to incite violence.

Location_Incident: Remax Revolution 932 Shadyview Blvd Pleasant Hill IA 50327
Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment, Online, Racist comments toward Chinese
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment, Online, Racist comments toward Chinese
Description: Owner, broker and real estate agent Stacey Carpenter posted on Facebook a commentary association of coronavirus with Chinese. She included a photo showing dog meat in China and stated she was disgusted.

In class, people noticed I was sick for around a week or two. When I came back, not looking 100% recovered yet, my friends and classmates jokingly asked me if I had the "Wuhan virus" or if I had been to Wuhan recently. We all knew I hadn't been there, but it was just a harmless joke. It was not said in a harmful way, I never took it that way. To be honest, I laughed alongside the jokes. I didn't consider it to be an act of hate against me, but I understand how those comments may affect the AAPI community in general.

about two weeks ago, my mother and i were in salinas. and we were grocery shopping with my grandmother. she's a very pale filipino woman, and she speaks broken english. some tall white man bumped into her and literally said, "watch where you're going you fucking chink" word for word. then after, we said sorry to him. he walked away saying, "damn chinese people started this mask shit". that man was 6'1 and my tiny 4'11 grandmother just bumped into him a little and that was his reaction.

My family went into Lucky's and we were waiting in line to check out, and everyone around us was staring at us weird and whispering. We couldn't hear what they were saying, but I'm not sure whether it was because we're Chinese or if it because we were with my white dad and they were talking about us as a mixed family.

I was walking from my mom's car to the Walmart in the Cerritos Towne Center, wearing a mask and trying to keep my distance from others of course, when a middle-aged lady, not wearing a mask because this occured back in March before my city required masks on all public outings, went to the other side of the sidewalk from me and said, "get away from me Asian lady". Although a brief moment that lasted maybe 3 seconds, this upset me and made me realize purely because I was Asian some people will see me as a covid carrier or spreader.

I was scrolling on Instagram, when I came across one of my schoolmate's finsta (a smaller instagram account intended for close friends) posts, that read, "Ya'll Chinese ppl better not give me rona *laughing emoji* ". As a Chinese American myself, I was really offended to hear this coming from my own classmate, and it made it worse that he thought it was a careless joke and writing that was funny.

I am an international student living on campus. As I was studying at the liberary when the director of campus housing found me with a bottle of EPA-approved disinfectant. He order me not to use it and leave the building immediately, although no relevant guideline has been communicated to me. In a hour I received an email from him asking me to leave by the end of the day.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was walking to school in the morning and I passed by the boys training on the football team on the football field. When I passed by, I heard someone shout, "Look out guys! It's the coronavirus!" There's a specific kid who always makes covid jokes. I was also one of the few kids who was wearing a mask to school before quarantine was announced.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: Before quarantine, I was walking home and I came across a few guys, most likely students, and I think they thought I couldn't hear them because I had my earbuds in and that I wouldn't pay any attention. They pointed at me and said, "Look! Coronavirus!"

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I didn't personally hear anything, but I was walking with my sister and mom and 2 younger boys, maybe in middle school, walked by. My sister said that they started laughing at them and pretended to cough. I wish I could've caught it, because then I would've said something to those boys.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I went into T4, and there were these 3 white girls there and I heard them whisper, "Why is this girl here? I can't believe she caused covid." They weren't even wearing masks themselves but they were still all staring at me and whispering.

I was on Omegle, a video chat site, and a teenage boy said to me jokingly, "How was the bat?". He proceeded to laugh and I couldn't help but feel embarrassed and infuriated that this was the type of comment I receive because I look/am Chinese.
One time during this quarantine I went on Omegle because I was bored and there were a few people who were like, “Oh you’re Asian? Can you tell your people to stop eating bats so we can go outside
I was contacted by a random number and got called racial slurs such as 'chink' and the n-word. This person also contacted my friend and many others from my school.

I have been made fun of on my way home from school on multiple occasions. I am Filipino but a lot of people assume I'm Chinese. One time on the bus, this boy would make remarks like, "stay away from her she has the coronavirus". him and his friends would actually distance themselves from me while laughing to themselves. when i would cough or sneeze, they'd freak out.

I was ordering Thai food with my brother at a walk-up window on a street full of establishments in a wealthy neighborhood. We were both wearing masks. A white man stopped and looked at us disgustingly mumbling, then when a white family not wearing masks passed by, he pointed at them and said "See now you are the good guys."
This did not directly happen to me, but I work at Sonic Drive-In, and I saw my Hmong co-worker interact with a customer who told him that he did not want him to touch his food.

People saying how some person ate a bat and now we all have to struggle
My reaction was: Are they dumb?
Some of them would show Asian people (people they knew?)
A lot of Asian people would make tiktoks explaining what people were saying to them.
Almost every tiktok was about COVID during this time.
When I coughed in a grocery store in March everyone stared and avoided me

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: My friend was working at Dunkin Donut and she was wearing a mask. Because of the mask was hard to breathe in and was slipping down due to lack of it, she took it off to adjust for a second. A customer came in and reported to the manager. She was immediately fired without a chance to explain.

Reason_Discrimination: Ethnicity, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Ethnicity, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: My family and I were walking at Alki Beach and we were wearing masks. A white couple actively avoided us and stared at us aggressively as we walked past them while maintaining a safe distance.
I was on the subway station and I was walking up the stairs with my friend. There was a man behind me yelling at me and my friend saying that ""this sh*t killed my friend in Italy".

An old white couple were sitting in their front yard with their dog looking at their phone and I was walking by really far away and I wanted to say hi and be neighborly but they just stared at me and made a disgusted face. Now when I pass that block I try to walk on the other side of the road to avoid interaction with that couple.

Location_Incident: On the public streets on NYC
Description: I walking home with a friend from a program and made eye contact with a man. This man directed a statement towards us "free NYC from the coronavirus you Asian".
I was helping out her dad's restaurant and there were many repeated calls that ranted about the coronavirus and saying how it's our fault.

A classmate explained a video that he saw on Instagram of an Asian woman touching all the elevator buttons with her palm. He said, "you don't even have to guess what race it is" inferring the woman is Asian because of her actions.

Location_Incident: Public streets near Queens Center Mall
Description: In March, I was working with a political campaign and went up to two college black student for their signatures. They said "you should date and go out with them because we have the cure to covid and that they could cure me".

I was playing an online game known as Secret Hitler with my friends. We joined a public room and there were a couple strangers. A stranger was talking in really bad Chinese through google translate so I also replied in Chinese. Immediately, the man started blaming china and saying how they should pay reparations to the United States. Also, blamed me for the virus

I was at our local park (Regional Park in Cerritos, CA) with my mom, taking our daily walk. We both of course had our masks on. When we started walking up and down the flight of stairs we always do reps on, this lady that was on the opposite side of us with who I'm assuming was her husband, she kept making racist remarks to both me and my mom, for example, “Get off these steps do you know about the Chinese disease", and she even referred to me as "Asian boy". They were both not wearing masks and had the audacity to call out my mom and I, who were, for not being cautionary. The man she was with also chimed in and very rudely ordered me to stay away from him although that's what I was doing in the first place. It is a public park, and we were taking the appropriate safety measures, so I didn't understand why they had to make comments like we were trying to bother them. I feel as if I wasn't Asian, me being close to them wouldn't have been a big deal.
When I sat down on the bus, there were people who moved away. It's not offending, but it reminds me of my identity as Asian American during this pandemic.

I was on discord playing video games and someone said “we wouldn’t have this problem if some guy in China didn’t eat a bat” and people were laughing about it. At the time I was a little pissed off but I didn’t say anything. It came off as cultural superiority.
My mother was getting takeout in Flushing, Queens when a random person shouted at her for being a "dirty Chinese".

Location_Incident: Bellevue Whole Foods (888 116th Ave NE, Bellevue, WA 98004)
Description: I was walking between the checkout aisles at Whole Foods and this lady swerved me super obviously and went the other way.
I was on the train with my boyfriend when everyone would stare at them and sit as far as possible or even go to the next empty cart.

I witnessed a particular incident that has made me furious. There was an animation posted by the artist named Sven Stoffels that sexualized Chinese woman and depicted them as disease-ridden and subhuman. It garnered widespread outrage especially because Instagram refused to delete it.
In early February of this year, one of my classmates said to "make sure not to get the ling long virus or the kung flu virus". I didn't know how to react and was angered by the joke.

An online incident was my school had a instagram page where you could post anonymously. Two main posts that stuck out was "our entire year was ruined by the Chinese thank you retards from the non-Chinese asian" and "why are we focusing on the virus being called the ching chong ling long virus instead of the number of deaths".

Site_Discrimination: Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store
Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store
Description: I was in a donut shop, taking appropriate safety precaution (wearing my mask and gloves, as well as staying 6 feet apart from others), and this middle-aged man walked in only to walk back out three seconds later because he saw me, a Chinese teenager, in the store and it obviously bothered him. Before he walked out he gave me a side-eye and remarked, "It's time to leave." Additionally, the same day I went to a grocery store with my mother, and as a lady passed by, she looked at us, rolled her eyes, and snarked, "oh God...". Although both of these people I encountered did not directly say anything about me being Chinese/called me a name, I still felt the disgust and discomfort from them and they made it obvious that they were scared of me. They were at food places/grocery stores... I had every right to be as well. It seemed wrong that they treated me like this.

A couple of years ago, I found out that I was going through kidney failure, and so my life turned into one of much stress, medication, and frequent trips to check-ups and my doctor's. One of the side effects of my medication is coughing, which I understand can be seen as worrisome to strangers that don't know about my condition. I was at the grocery store with my daughter picking up some items for dinner, with a mask and gloves on, and staying away from people as best as I could. When I coughed, a lady in the same area as us gave me a disgusted look and speed-walked in the opposite direction of me. I wish that simply me being a Chinese woman and coughing didn't automatically deem me as someone with covid-19. I feel as if though I was not Asian, people's reactions to me would not be the same

I was on this app called Yubo which is an app where you are on a video call with random people to make new friends and to just talk to random people in general. This random person joined me and my friends live and started saying racial slurs to us like “You guys have corona” and “you guys eat bats?”

Site_Discrimination: Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store
Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store
Description: Well my family and I had pretty microagressive stuff happen to us (dirty looks when we speak our native language and white people just watching us) but the most anti-asian thing that happened to me was when I was having an argument with a receptionist and she called me a ‘gook’ and proceeded to mutter about corona under her breath.

When I was at the hardware store with my mom, she started coughing and this lady started to run away and hide behind a flower pot when my mom started getting closer to her area. She later on apologized to us

It was the last day I went to school before the stay at home order was put in place. I went to the bathroom during class and 2 girls followed me. 1 oof them had orange juiced so when I walked into a stall, I got juice thrown into my stall and it got all over me. When they threw it they yelled “coronavirus”
Me and my friends were facetiming random people and some black kids joined and pointed at me and said “haha you have corona. How do bats taste.”

A middle age white man approached me and said, “You look like an alien with that mask on. What do you think about this Chinese virus? You are from there, aren’t you?” He said he doesn’t care if he gets the virus and he wants to spread it to everyone. My children were terrified of him.

Location_Incident: Norms; 10620 Valley Blvd, El Monte, CA 91731
Description: I was going out to eat at the Norms in El Monte on February 1, 2020 with four of my friends. When we entered the restaurant, we noticed a dominant presence of White and Hispanic people dining in. We were the only Asians in the restaurant and on our way to the table, we noticed as we were walking by other tables, that we were being looked at with eyes of disgust from some individuals. Some even moved slightly away from us while we were walking by them.

When this disease was still only beginning to grow and spread, I had gotten sick. I had no idea what COVID-19 was and I was just home for a few days instead of school. As soon as I arrived back, a guy in my class came up to me and insisted I had gotten the coronavirus. He told everyone in my class and I saw it as a joke then, because I didn’t know what COVID was or where it was from or just anything about it. Then, he changed my contact name to “Korona Ahn”. He had also changed other of my Asian classmates contact names to similar, racist names rather than our own. It was then when I really felt uncomfortable and hurt.
I have had a man come up to me and my father and scream something about China. I’m not Chinese. I’ve heard ignorant comments in school about the coronavirus.

Location_Incident: Windtree Condos, University of Texas student condos
Description: Was riding bike home, minding my own business, when two guys in a truck called me a chink and chased me down. Made it home but worried and frightened. In the process of filing police report and asking apartment complex for security camera footage.

Location_Incident: 402 Calle Del Prado, Newbury Park, CA 91320
Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon, Physical Assault
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon, Physical Assault
Description: A white woman in an SUV mounted the curb to try and run over one of my family members, who was just out taking an exercise walk alone in our usually deserted neighborhood. This woman saw that they were Asian, pulled over, started yelling and spitting at them (with the window closed though, so we're unsure what she said), drove off, then turned around and tried to run them over with her car and even mounted the sidewalk to chase them. There was a white male bystander/witness who just stood there and watched. And when my family member asked if they saw everything, he said yes but he "didn't want to get involved."

Location_Incident: home depot/ 24451 Crenshaw Blvd, Torrance, CA 90505
Description: I was waiting in line and a white man cut me, so when I told him I was here first, he said, "I was here in this country before you, so I was here before you. You guys are the problem."

A white lady, that looked like she was in her 70s, told my 12 year-old son "don't steal my stuff" outside the cash register. My son told me about the incident after she was gone, so I wasn't able to confront her.

I was with three of my friends and we just got off the link and we were waiting for the bus to go to south center mall. A group of people (around 6-7 probably high school to college aged) got off a bus and walked over to us and surrounded us. A couple of them stood right next to us and inhaled really loudly and said “smells like dog” and “smells like dank coronavirus”. They all started laughing and looked at us and said “f*** these ling lings”.
My friend was walking with her mom through a supermarket and a white lady just glared at her the entire time.
My friend was walking and people would act weird around him.

My friend was at school when her teacher was talking about coronavirus precautions. A few kids in the class made fun of her for having come back from Taiwan a few months prior and everyone moved away from her, making jokes that she was infected. Meanwhile, the teacher did absolutely nothing to intervene.
My friend's Korean American sister went to Target. A lady looked at her and covered her mouth before running away.
A teacher referencing and become argumentative when describing Covid-19 as the Kung flu and Chinese Virus. When addressed that is a racist term and inappropriate, the teacher continued.

Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Repeat labeling East Asians as "model minorities"
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Repeat labeling East Asians as "model minorities"
Description: Classmates reading. Already gave her feedback re: anti-Asian sentiment expressed in her creative writing essay. She described her East Asian colleagues as undifferentiated mass with "infuriating model minority faces." Her piece characterized East Asians as "model minorities who barely face discrimination," was supposed to uplift Black folks - but it did neither. It was full of microaggressions that felt dangerous during pandemic-infused xenophobia.

We were shopping for food in Japantown, and some black teenagers were shouting at people on the street that it was "our fault" for coronavirus and that we were "all just stupid chinks". They left after that, high-fiving and laughing.

We were walking down the street, and a man was shouting at an elderly asian couple in front of us, calling them derogatory terms and threw his cigarette at them. My friend and I went to confront him, but he just called us names and walked away. Someone said they would report it to the police.
Man in truck yelled "Go home!!" as he passed by me on the street. Drove away laughing and holding up a peace sign with squinted eyes/

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Religion, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Religion, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: July 18, everything is in post

Type_Discrimination: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon, Physical Assault
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Shunning, Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Coughed At/Spat Upon, Physical Assault
Description: A woman targeted me out of a group of people and shoulder pushed me extremely hard where my phone nearly fell out of my hands. She then said to me, "F**k you, ch**k." Afterwards, she spat on a man who defended me and tried to on me as well.
Two women whispered loudly "la Chine" as I approached, and they swerved their cart away from me as quickly as possible.

Location_Incident: 101 Freeway in San Francisco, near where 101 and 280 split
Description: This took place on a freeway. Traffic was slowed down on the 101/280 due to accident ahead on 280. I was moving left across lanes in order to get to the 101 side of the split. I moved my vehicle in front of a white van/truck in the lane to the left of me. While we were stopped, I heard a thunk as if something had been thrown at my car. I looked in my rearview mirror and saw the person behind me flashing an OK white power sign at me.
My car was keyed by a neighbor at my apartment complex, even though I had not had any contact with any neighbors for 4 months

A man shouted, “Fuck you, Chinese bitch! Fucking diseased saliva” at me while I was walking past him walking toward the entrance. I did not react and rushed inside the store. Upon checking out, I noticed he moved location by the door as if he was waiting for me.
The white male said corona virus to me when I was driving with rolled down my car window from my home to safeway in Aptos.
Leaving parking lot at Dairy Queen couple shouted Fucken Asians.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have photo of the vehicle n their covered faces

Description: Leaving parking lot at Dairy Queen couple shouted Fucken Asians.
Any_SupportingLinks: I have photo of the vehicle n their covered faces

Description: I worked in a store and these customers came in and called me a small eyed chink while telling me to go back to my country.

Location_Incident: Cornor of Lennon Lane and Ygnacio Valley Rd
Description: Being shouted at with very loud and angry voice and coupled with middle finger, "This is MY territory! YOU, get out of MY territory!"

Location_Incident: Moe’s Southwest Grill on Falls of the Neuse Road, Raleigh, NC 27615
Description: A guy (looked white) with brown hair and beard kept screaming “Nazi” around me when I picked up my Doordash delivery. Then he started shouting at me as I got in my car. I don’t know if he was yelling “Nazi” at me or calling himself a Nazi.
I was livestreaming on Yubo with a friend and a guy commented "you eat bats and caused the coronavirus."
Standing in line to enter Trader Joe’s. Man behind me making loud remarks about Chinese and the virus
My neighbor started yelling at my mom after she rejected him and blamed her for the virus and then asked me if I had it.

Location_Incident: 2753 E Eastland Center Dr Suite 5555, West Covina, CA 91791
Description: I was with my mom and this white guy came really close to us and said "Go back to f*cking China!"
A lady yelled at me and my mom and told us to go back to our country. She then met us again at the checkout and continued verbally harassing us.

Type_Discrimination: racist fake restaurant account on Instagram and Yelp
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: racist fake restaurant account on Instagram and Yelp
Description: There is a racist fake restaurant account called ChingChongHouse on Instagram and Yelp (supposed address is Fort Collins, CO). Racist imagery, language, menu.
I choked on a jolly rancher and the people around me thought I had COVID so they immediately walked away.

Location_Incident: E Panorama Dr, Signal Hill, CA (Close to the Discovery Well Park)
Description: As I was walking with my dog, this man on the passenger side from a moving car yelled something at me, unfortunately the only word I was able to hear was "asshole" at the end, there was nobody around me so I knew that was directed towards me

Location_Incident: 99 Ranch Market 34444 Fremont Blvd, Fremont, CA 94555
Description: Two grown women were stopped by a Ranch 99 worker because they were trying to enter without a mask. One of the women got really angry and started yelling at the worker, “it’s because of you Asians! It started in China, it’s all your fault! and now your asking me to wear a mask?”. I interjected and asked her, “did you really have to say that?”. The entire time, I was being really passive and didn’t say anything rude at all. However, she then started going off on me, saying, “but it’s true! you people started this whole virus!”. The entire time, I remained calm and was just telling her how ignorant she was being. She threatened to beat me up if I didn’t shut up. She continued to mock me as she was leaving.

Location_Incident: technically at home, but it was online
Description: My friends and I were live-streaming on an app called Yubo. People joined and asked us if we ate bat soup. They also commented bat and soup emojis.

Doordash Driver came to the store for pickup. And he said I don't want to get close to you because you are Asian, and you have Corona Virus. We reported it to the Doordash but we were not able to talk the manager about the issue.

I was walking past a biker who was African American when he waited until I passed when he shouted, "All you Asians can suck my dick!" I kept walking and gave him the finger. He continued screaming similar profanities, so I called him an "Asshole" and told him to "Get out of my [diverse] neighborhood!" back.

Location_Incident: Dardanelle RV Resort in Stanislaus County, CA
Description: My husband is Filipino. We were walking around the Dardanelle Resort campground with our two dogs when a group of mid-twenties Caucasian lowlifes yelled at him that “You brought the virus here, Chink”

Location_Incident: Walmarts on Florin Road, Sacramento, CA
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I walked into the restroom of the Walmarts store, looking to use a toilet stall. I saw a black man in his 20s staring at me and said, "What the fuck you're looking at, Chink?" It was just him and I inside at the time, and I wasn't even looking at him. I simply ignored him and quicky locked myself inside a toilet stall. The black man just washed his hands and took his time in the restroom waiting for me to come out. I waited about 5 minutes and he was still there. I knew he was waiting for me to come out and then beat me up since it was just him and me in the restroom. Finally, I heard somebody walked inside the restroom. I then took the chance to come out of the toilet stall hoping that with someone else there, the black guy would not beat me up. I quickly left the restroom feeling scared for my life. I saw he had his camera phone ready by the counter on my way out. My instinct was right. He was waiting for me. I'm only a 5'2" guy. He's about 5'10" or taller.

Location_Incident: Windtree Condos, 106 E 30th St, Austin, TX 78705
Description: I experienced Assault by Threat and Hate Speech. While riding my bike, 3 people drove by in a truck 3 times and each time yelled Hate Speech of racist assaults. The third time was Assault by Threat as one of the guys got out of their truck, jumped out at me, and chased me down on foot.
Asked if I wanted to buy some sunglasses, didn’t realize I was being spoken to, before he immediate started calling me a gook faggot and followed me down the block continuing his slurs.

Location_Incident: Price chopper parking lot, fireworks tent
Description: In line to buy fireworks. Guy in front starts running his mouth about “Kung Flu” and other tRumpy sayings. I tell him I don’t appreciate it and that most of my family is Asian. He tells me he doesn’t mean anything by it. He did. I let it go. He left.

Location_Incident: Roosevelt ave/Jackson height E train platform
Description: Walking on platform and middle age white man walking from opposite direction purposely elbows me and says “fucking chink.”

Location_Incident: United States Postal Service in New Hope, PA
Description: I approached the glass door at our local P.O. with my mask already on. I reached for the door, she said "you can't come in here" and pulled the door shut. I said loudly "excuse me? what did you say?" She said it again. I glared at her (like you didn't just say that) and she back pedaled. She said "I mean, you know, you have to wait outside until I can go inside." And shut the door on me again. I looked at the outside of the door to make sure it didn't say "servicing just 1 person at a time". I said, "I'm coming in. I need an envelope to mail this." She said (back pedaling) "oh, I guess you can do that". There is a LOT of space in the lobby and she could have easily taken 2 or 3 steps back to maintain social distance - IF that's what she was concerned about. I looked at the ground and said, "Look! There are even lines to show where I should stand after I'm done getting an envelope!" She said "oh ok, I guess."

Site_Discrimination: School, Business: Non-Grocery Store, Public Street/Sidewalk
Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: School, Business: Non-Grocery Store, Public Street/Sidewalk
Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment, Stereotyping, racism, discrimination, etc
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment, Stereotyping, racism, discrimination, etc
Description: Two 60+ male poll workers asked me if I was a U.S. Citizen or if I was Born in the U.S. before asking for my voting card and identification during the election week of 2016. Man in front of me who says he was a Vietnam veteran made remarks about Asians to people in front of me. I am worried it could be worse this coming November 2020.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was walking on the Riverway in Boston when a man on a bicycle sped past me and called me a 'pussy'. I was wearing a face mask. Perhaps he thought I was being a 'pussy' for wearing one. When I asked "What did you say?", he said "Chink, go back to your country." He then sped away. The USA is the only country I've ever known. I was born in the USA and have served in the U.S. military. What right does he have to say this?
Car drove by, man opened window to yell profanity at me. This happened again the next week. I was alone both times.

Older lady pulled over and got out calling our family Chinks, and cursing at us. Acting like she was going to hurt us. We got our young children away very quickly, and filed a report when we found out she is a neighbor.

My three neighbors use beaming alike device since March trying to push me out my apartment . The pains are unbearable when they use unknown device aiming at me , I reported police and manager . But they don't believe me . It gets worst . I have to go to my car to study in the day time .
Asked if I wanted to buy some sunglasses, didn’t realize I was being spoken to, before he immediate started calling me a gook faggot and followed me down the block continuing his slurs.

This angry white lady targeted us getting out of our car and ran up to the three of us screaming and waving her hands at us. She got right into our faces (this was when masks were not required) and told us to get off her land and that we were not wanted there (we were at Joshua tree national park). She screamed at us and told us to go back to our country (riveting). Then she followed us into the park and screamed at us over and over again that we needed to leave and get off her land and that she called the cops on us already and that they were on their way. They obviously never came and she obviously doesn’t own Joshua tree national park. After 10 minutes of following us around she gave up on harassing us because I started to follow her every move and cornering her fatass and asking her invasive questions and calling her names and making her feel alienated.
Any_SupportingLinks: I wasn’t smart enough to video this nimrod.

Description: I went grocery shopping with my mother and when we returned to our car we found a note. The paper read "Go back to China asshole fuck your virus fuck you fuck off Chinese" We reported the incident to San Mateo Police Department.

Site_Discrimination: Public Transit, Public Park, Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store, Public Street/Sidewalk
Site_Discrimination_Cleaned: Public Transit, Public Park, Business: Grocery Store, Business: Non-Grocery Store, Public Street/Sidewalk
Description: My friends and I would go to restaurants, tourist areas, bars, etc and people would look at us hostilely, cover their noses and mouths, make side comments like "I smell corona in the air all of the sudden", and say "coronavirus" whenever we'd pass by.This behavior would happen throughout the week. By the end of the week, my female (Asian) friends and I expressed that we would have rather been verbally harassed about their gender/catcalled rather than receive verbal racist remarks.

Location_Incident: C&O Canal by Potomac River at the Glen Echo, MD and DC border
Description: My 14-year old son and I were hiking and fishing along the Potomac River near the C&O Canal at the Glen Echo, MD/DC border. A friendly dog off leash came to us and we petted him. His owner, a white man in his 60s on his bike with another unleashed dog, immediately called out to the dog, yelling not to let us "Chinese people touch" him. He sped off before we could say or react. The insinuation was that we, as monolithic Asians (he mistook us for Chinese), were diseased.

I was the only Asian American at a conference with work colleagues and I had allergy flare up that day. One woman, seeing me sneeze, told me I couldn’t be there, that I needed to leave, and ordered me not to touch any of the coffee and cookies put out by the convention. She singled me out when other people in the conference were sneezing, sniffling and coughing.
black peoples in a car spewed racists comments about "chinks" spreading virus

In my initial request, I stated "...I am working remote while sheltering in place in Broward County in order to provide support for my 84-year-old mother who lives in West Broward." I have a flawless record of renting property on VRBO. Property Owner (Barry Bauman) did not respond to my offer until I messaged 3 hours before offer expired. Property Owner stated "hi Alan unfortunately it was booked through another portal for your dates so please kindly withdraw your request while i check in our building to see if another good condo is availavle for you. barry" I inquired with VRBO and they stated that Property Owner was in violation of Terms and Conditions. Today, the listing is still available on the VRBO site. Both the Property Owner and VRBO have been complicit in denying me accommodation for no reason.
Any_SupportingLinks: I am willing to supply screenshots of the original reservation, the communications between the Property Owner and me, and the communications between VRBO and me.

Description: I (wearing a mask) was waiting to pick up food from a restaurant and a group of people walked down the street (without masks) started yelling and cursing at me, saying that I'm the one who brought the virus to the U.S.

A middle-aged white female in a cowboy hat and black oval sunglasses in a black pickup truck followed me home after I went drove through the stop sign before her (I had the right of way). She followed me through 5 turns to block me into my driveway and yell out her window "Don't drive through MY neighborhood like that" and "Do you want to know why Asians like you have a bad rap, because you can't drive!" I responded with repeating "I'm sorry ma'am" and did not get out of my car to confront. I filed a police report later that day.

I am white, my husband is Taiwanese-American. We were pumping gas and a large white male in his later 40s/early 50s driving a gold Bentley coupe was staring at us from the other side of the pump. Just before he got into his vehicle to leave, he looked at me and said, “Keep it white.” I asked him to repeat himself (I was literally in disbelief) and he did. I asked him what that was supposed to mean as he got into his car to leave. I then yelled some profanities in his direction, and he drove off.
Stay out of Indiana.
A white man got in my face and coughed on me twice and told me to go back to my country. Ended up getting in a physical confrontation with him.

My father was saying hello to our neighbors and the neighbor below us rudely ignored my father while others said hello. Then night before neighbor comes upstairs to pick on my 5 year old for being loud bc he was walking or running or even playing too loud.

My downstairs neighbor harassed their Asian roommate and myself in our apartment in Brooklyn, New York. They used the Black Lives Matter movement as ammunition and wrote "apologize for Awkwafina", "Give us sum $" and other messages to intimidate us (I had only met this person 2-3 times in passing).The harassment got so bad that we had to move out and as I was moving out, they blocked my path and called me a "little bitch" and told me to go "back to California."
Any_SupportingLinks: I have documentation, video and pictures of the harassment

Location_Incident: Corner of Bonifacio Place and Washington Street
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was crossing the street wearing a mask when I saw two gentlemen (in their 20's) walking perpendicular to me. Since they are not wearing masks, I decided to pause and let them pass. Once they passed, I proceeded to continue walking. Once I had my back towards them, they started name calling and laughing - they were pretending to speak in Chinese. One of them said, "You're a Chink, that's why you need to wear a mask." I turned around and gave them the middle finger until they walked away...which they did while continuing to laugh and making sounds to mock the Chinese language.

I was at a 4-way stop sign with my 89 year old Japanese mother. I am mixed but look more Asian. Another vehicle stopped at the stop sign that was to our right. The driver started staring right at us. As we entered the intersection, he aggressively stepped on the gas and aimed his truck right toward us. At the very last second, he sharply turned away but he was going fast enough that he tires were sliding on the pavement towards us. I am guessing his truck missed my mother's door by no more than 2 or 3 inches. He could have easily slid right into her.

Location_Incident: Corner of Wood Canyon and Oak View Drive in Aliso Viejo
Description: I was walking in my neighborhood when a white teenage boy yelled out of a car that drove by. He yelled, “ Fuck you, chink! Fuck you!”

While checking Instagram, I noticed that my white friend reposted a meme that is mocking and blaming people for eating bats. This post does that directly blame Chinese people, but as a Chinese-American, I found this to be offensive. It has prompted many anti-Asian comments to be posted under the meme. I am scared to confront my friend about his decision to repost this meme on his account. I have had conversations about the pandemic and racism with him before, and he often fails to see past his privilege.
A man in a small sized orange car said “she’s the reason why covid’s here.” He then came back through the roundabout while yelling at other people for various reasons

Location_Incident: Silver & Yale Ave San Francisco on the 44 O'Shaugnessy Bus
Description: 2 Latinx couples were looking at Asian person in front of their seat and looking at me and calling me "China Virus" in Spanish.

Location_Incident: Silver & Yale Ave San Francisco on the 44 O'Shaugnessy Bus
Description: 2 Latinx couples were looking at Asian person in front of their seat and looking at me and calling me "China Virus" in Spanish.

Location_Incident: Intersection of Battery Street and Jackson Street (zipcode: 94111)
Description: After verbally assaulting and spitting on four Chinese elderly persons walking on the street, the perpetrator proceeded to threaten violence against me for bearing witness to this incident. He then shoved the grocery bag I was carrying to the ground while simultaneously using racist language towards me. Luckily, he walked away after that and I was physically unharmed–yet there is no denial that it was an emotionally shocking/traumatizing incident. I chose not to report to the police due to rising tensions between the Asian and the Black community, lest a restorative justice model is to be considered.
spitting at

Type_Discrimination: Refused to rent room stating that they do not like Chinese people.
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Refused to rent room stating that they do not like Chinese people.
Description: I went to check out a room to rent. After I left the apartment with a pending decision. I got a message from the person who showed me the room that she thinks I am Chinese and she does not like Chinese people.

Location_Incident: San Francisco, CA 94115. The bus stop at Geary & Fillmore
Description: Kick me out of bus when I got off the bus and called me corona sick virus.
Any_SupportingLinks: No I did not record any video and report.

Description: A homeless man harassed me, trying to grab me and my umbrella, along with racial slurs. He followed me for a block and would not let me continue my journey. He specifically called out I am Chinese more than once.
Any_SupportingLinks: Full story on my FB - https://www.facebook.com/ITGirlNYC

Description: Carli B rapper called her daughter CHINK and did not make an formal apology or realizing it is racist and derogatory term often used by non-Asians as a slur against Asian ethnic groups.

Location_Incident: San Ramon Rd. & Alcosta Blvd. Dublin CA
Description: White youth throwing rock and beer can to my car

Location_Incident: Commercial Street, Portland, Maine by Casco Bay Lines
Description: I was in my car with my two young children at a red light when a man spit on my car. We stared at each other as he crossed the road. I wanted to confront him about it but I was worried about the safety of my children. Though I am not 100% sure why he spit on my car whenever I replay the incident in my head I cannot think of any other reason why he would have spit on my car other than I was an Asian person.

I live on the 6th floor. I got into the elevator (mask on) so I could get my mail from the lobby. The elevator opened on the 4th floor and this unmasked white woman with a bike yelled “OH HELL NO” when she saw me. I didn't think it would be fair to make the connection then, but I had my suspicions. I got my mail and then went to wait for the elevator to take me back up. The elevator door opens on the 1st floor and she gets out of the elevator and looks me up and down and goes, "You fucking Chinese people, you're not going to get away with this, we're going to get you." I followed her out from the elevator to the leasing office to report her.

Location_Incident: Learn to Drive, Severna Park, MD
Description: Someone in the class supposedly hacked two users. One posted the racist term "nigger" in the chat and another posted a song that repeatedly said the racist term "nigger." This is an online Zoom driver's education class.
Called me a yellow mf & told me to back where I came from. After exiting elevator, picked me up by my shoulders & threw me against elevator bank.

Type_Discrimination: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling / 口头骚扰/叫名字
Reason_Discrimination: Race / 民族, Ethnicity / 种族
Description: A white senior couple said it loud to us when waiting inline to use the sink at the camp site. They said, "Stop spreading the covid virus".

Police followed me and stopped me after leaving Costco to the gas station saying they were looking for an oriental man. They started harassing me implying I had committed a crime. Then they handcuffed me and started searching my car while keeping the verbal and physical harassment.
Any_SupportingLinks: The Costco gas station must have a video. There were some bystanders who recorded the event. Need to get body-cam footage.

Description: Racist teens tagged our house in the middle of the night

I went into CVS for medications 7/25, people gave me stares because I was wearing a mask. I didn’t care at first until a man came from behind me. He muttered China virus under his breath close by me and I was offended.

Location_Incident: Jamba Juice, 48 E 4th Ave, San Mateo, CA 94401
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: A older white gentleman without a mask on walking down the street muttering "Why are all these people wearing masks, I'm not going to wear one." and then pointed to my 14 year old masked Chinese American daughter, who was in the Jamba Juice line outside, on the side walk, with 2 friends and said "You're the reason we have Corona.... Go Back...." and continued muttering as he walked away. I was not with my daughter at the time and she reported this to us at home after the incident.

I was sitting in my car scrolling on my phone and had a white male constantly staring at me and when confronted, told me to take my asian ass back to my car when he wasnt the one minding his own business.
"fuck you, you Chinese shit" was said to me while waiting for my ride on the sidewalk

My husband was approached by two women and screamed at. One woman got in his face and yelled at him to "get the fuck out of America." I walked over with my cell phone and confronted them, and they agreed to leave the store if I deleted their photos.

Location_Incident: Sawyer Camp Trail, Skyline Blvd & Crystal Springs Rd, San Mateo, CA 94401
Description: Today on our walk on Sawyer Camp trail, there was a tall slender, dark-skinned man with a very long dark brown braid (to his waist), wearing a red/black biking outfit, who stated "we need to get rid of the Asians" as he rode quickly past several small groups of Asians.

My boss referred to COVID-19 as the Chinese virus and said that it was a hoax.Said it was a set up by the Chinese and Russian government. Said that she didn’t mean racist but that’s what it was…a Chinese virus.
As we begin to talk about COVID19, my boss referred to it as, instead, the Chinese virus.

I said I’d work with industry because of my experience working in corporation. My boss aggressively responded, “the only reason why industry wants to work with you is because you are just another “white girl”.” 

And then ignored my professional input.
A seemingly homeless person, who appeared to be a caucasian male, shouted out to me when I was running. He was shouting at me as me spreading the Coronavirus.

Students from Colorado State University created a fake restaurant called "Ching Chong House" featuring dishes like "Mouse tail salad" and "Crispy Burnt Pug- Delicious Deep fried dog body" and many more racist and offensive comments.

I recieved an call to help an 85 year old senior Caucasian female customer with carrying bags to her vehicle. Waited patiently as she chatted with cashier and judged me then customer said she does not need me help & rushed out the door.

I am reporting an incident I was not a part of, but was told by the owner of the restaurant Oriental Noodle. Because I was Chinese, she felt comfortable letting me know of difficulties she's had with past employees and customers from the local area. She showed me evidence of assault and videos of people going to her house. She said she did not feel comfortable going to the Police and decline to give her name. She only said any follow-up be directed to the restaurant.
Any_SupportingLinks: Please contact the owner of the Oriental Noodle if possible. (901) 872-0048‬

Location_Incident: Resident counseling workshop and Luis Vutton Store at Waterside Shops
Type_Discrimination: Barred from establishment, Almost ran us over by someone's car, talked about mocroaggression
Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Barred from establishment, Almost ran us over by someone's car, talked about mocroaggression
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Language, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: An organizer through my university counseling workshop talked about bad drivers as an example when I was the only one taking the workshop and she was aware that I was Asian. A car also backed up on us in the parking garage at waterside shops almost running us over. While waiting at the Luis Vutton store we had an appointment and she told us that the lady behind us should go first because she had an appointment. It took them awhile to let us in and when we arrived to the store we weren't attended to.
Got on the bus to run errands and as soon as my wife and I boarded the woman started verbally assaulting us. Guess it’s because of our ethnicity.
