Type_Discrimination_Cleaned: Verbal Harassment/Name Calling, Physical Assault, Workplace Discrimination, Online
Description: ONLINE BULLYING , WORK PLACE HARASSMENT ,SEXURAL HARASSMENT

I was emptying my trash into a public trash can at a rest stop and a cat white male of about 30 years old, walked towards me asked me where my mask was, shoved me back and said if anyone should be wearing a mask it is people like you. He mocked by pulling his eyes back to resembled slant eyes and bowed to me.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I’m a healthcare worker. Saw maskless man sit across from me on subway. I moved to the other side of train car and he follows. He spat and coughed on the subway while yelling racial slurs. No one stood up for me until after

My white female and Latina coworkers at Research Design Specialists sporadically mock "Asian accents". This isn't a one time incident. I worked with 2 white girls and 1 Latina who keep making Ching Chong "noises" or accents in a mocking tone.

I was washing my car on my dad's driveway when I saw a white couple in their 70s or 80s walking around the neighborhood. I was ready to say hi when the man spoke to me first and said something that I didn't fully catch but ended with the word "Wuhan". I said, "Excuse me?" To which he repeated, "Are you a refugee from Wuhan?" I was taken aback but managed to ask him, "Are you being racist?" He just smiled smugly and said "No". I told him "That's a very racist thing to say" then went back indoors to grab my phone. I followed them back to their house at 37 Whistling Isle in Woodbridge, Irvine, CA and recorded them briefly. I did not report them to the police because my dad lives on his own, and I didn't want the couple to retaliate.

Racist remarks of something along the lines of "this is now the wu-han lane, and welcome to the wu-han lane" over and over again while looking at my family and I. My family and I were the only Chinese on the street sidewalk, and it was clearly directed at my family and I, almost a challenge for us to do something. We felt really unsafe at the time and left, I regret not taking a video recording of the incident.

Sometime in early April of 2020 when the US shut down due to COVID-19, I was walking down the block and a Caucasian elderly man in a wheel chair shouted at me specifically to stay "seven feet away from him!". He did not say it to the other six or seven passersby who did not appear to look Asian. No bystanders did anything to help alleviate the situation. A day or two after this incident, I was called "dirty" by another male walking down the street on my way home.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: I was walking south along the outer perimeter of Prospect Park West when a shirtless man I've never met saw me and shouted, "GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE YOU STUPID ASS MOTHER FUCKER". He rose from the park bench he was sitting on, continued shouting profanities at me, puffed up his chest to signal to fight, and started walking towards me. I felt unsafe because there were no bystanders, so I ignored him and quickly dashed across the street to get away from him. He didn't follow me. I was not in his way or anyone's way given how wide the sidewalk is on the outer perimeter of the park.

It started with noise issue with my neighbor for the whole day. I tried to approach and described the situation. I haven't raised up solution, more like FYI. My neighbor, without letting me talk, immediately used hostile language, started finger pointing and shout about Chinese just want to complain, why you Chinese always complain.

Location_Incident: El Camino Real next to Sunnyvale-Saratoga Road bus stop in Sunnyvale, CA
Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: Black guy got up from sitting down at the end of a bench to walk over and stand in front of me about 4 feet with his nose & mouth exposed. He said Fuck you ... (I don't remember the rest of that sentence). I told him to leave me alone, I didn't do anything. Then he yelled louder, "I'm going to punch you in the mouth through your mask."
Any_SupportingLinks: I posted this incident on my Facebook page and reported it to the Sunnyvale Police by phone call.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Gender, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: Reporting for my 70 year old mother, who lives at this address in Apt 308. The man from Apt 310 angrily shouted at her for several minutes in a public area of the building. He mentioned the Chinese, people dying because of them, and "the virus," presumably COVID-19.

A white-appearing woman I don't know and have never interacted with called me an "Asian bitch" multiple times. She also said, "You're being special. Why don't you walk into a wall" in a very clearly derogatory and scornful manner. We were just passing each other on the sidewalk.
The woman behind me in the drive-thru at Starbucks yelled at me to take off my mask when I was ordering. It was completely unprovoked.

Reason_Discrimination: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Reason_Discrimination_Cleaned: Race, Ethnicity, Face Mask or Clothing
Description: As I was walking into the grocery store, a white man in his mid-40's was driving slowly around in the parking lot, in his convertible and yelling at the customers (mostly Asian) to take off their masks and go back to where they came from.

My boyfriend (who is Chinese/Vietnamese American) were enjoying a late afternoon walk when a car sped past us and a man's voice, sounded possibly in their 20s-30s, screamed/shouted "Fuck off" at us. When we turned around, they were already gone. At first i tried to convince myself i was overthinking but there was no one else on the sidewalk, both my boyfriend and I are not the type to have conflicts with people that warrants this kind of behavior from someone, and we were wearing masks so it's unlikely for someone to recognize us.
